loans.name: Ajebaye

texts.en: K. lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells plantains. K. has been in this business for the past 10 years. She is 35 years old and married, and she has 6 children. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more plantains to sell. She thanks you

loans.use: To purchase more plantains to sell

loans.name: Ciumwari

texts.en: Ciumwari B. is a 39-year-old married mother of five children. She lives with her family in Runyenjes. She is a dedicated entrepreneur who runs a cereal store in Runyenjes.She started this business in 2000 with her own small savings. She sells grains, such as maize and beans, to retail customers and, at times, she supplies schools. Ciumwari is applying for a loan for the first time/ She has requested her loan in order to help her purchase additional supplies to improve her current level of stock.

loans.use: Purchase stock of grains

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en: Milicent N. was born in 1960. She is a married mother of three children. She lives with her family in Runyenjes Embu. She is the proprietor of a cereal-selling business that she initiated in 2004. Millicent’s hard work, determination and excellent skills have led to her success.  Her profits pay for the household expenses as well as secondary school fees for two of her children. She plans to use the funds from her next loan to buy more grains, particularly maize.

loans.use: Purchase grains

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en: Jane is a 38-year old entrepreneur and mother of two school-aged children.  Jane began her current dressmaking business in 1998.  She specializes in making women’s clothing, such as skirts, dresses, casual and formal tops. The central location of her shop in a busy town, coupled many years of doing good business within the community, has gained her a good reputation and a wide customer base. She intends to acquire an additional stock of dressmaking materials with a portion of the loan for which she has applied.

loans.use: To add to her stock of dressmaking materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Babalola

texts.en: D. sells juice and drinks. As a single parent, D. is faced with the problem of caring for her family of six, herself and five of her children. She is 53 years old. D. is requesting a loan of N140,000 to purchase more juice and drinks to sell. She remains grateful to Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more juice and drinks to sell

loans.name: Asharaf

texts.en: Asharaf is a young man working as an employee in the Palestinian National Authority. He is not married and lives with his father, mother, and two younger brothers. Asharf is the only source of income for the family, and he wants the loan to renovate the family house in order to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To expand his family's house and do some renovations

loans.name: Mabondeli Plus Group

texts.fr: David K. est président d’un groupe qui évolue avec Hope RDC dénommé « Mabondeli Plus ». Il gère sa propre cabine téléphonique qui se situe dans le quartier populaire à l’est de Kinshasa. David est entré dans le monde des micro-entreprises en 1993. Il allait dans des villages faire le troc en échangeant des poissons salés et des savons aux sacs de manioc et maїs qu’il revendait à Kinshasa. Cette activité l’a soutenu pour terminer ses études secondaires en 1998. Après la fermeture de la société où il travaillait en 2002, David s’est de nouveau lancé dans le troc dans des villages jusqu’en 2002 lorsqu’il a ouvert sa cabine téléphonique à Kinshasa grâce aux bénéfices accumulés. Il compte avec le prochain prêt de Hope acheter des cartes prépayées à revendre pour accroitre le revenu de son affaire qui lui génère un bénéfice de $35 par semaine. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une pharmacie à cause du besoin croissant en médicaments. David est âgé de 36 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 2 et 8 ans. Deux d’entre eux vont à l’école primaire.
texts.en:
David K. is president of a group that started with Hope RDC and is called “Mabondeli Plus.” He runs his own telephone booth in a busy neighborhood east of Kinshasa. David entered the world of micro-business in 1993. He would go from village to village bartering salted fish and soap for bags of cassava and corn, which he then sold in Kinshasa. This business supported him while he finished his high school studies in 1998. After the company where he was working closed in 2002, David once again took up bartering in different villages until he opened his own telephone booth in Kinshasa in 2002 using the profits he had accumulated. He plans to use the next loan from Hope to buy prepaid phone cards and sell them in order to increase the income from his business, which provides him with a weekly profit of $35. His ambition is to open a pharmacy, given the increasing need for medicines. David is 36 years old, married and the father of four children aged between two and eight. Two of the children are at primary school.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy prepaid phone cards to sell in order to increase the income generated by the business

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Yeimy Julissa

texts.es: Yeimy Julissa A. de 23 años de edad reside en el cantón Las Chinamas del departamento de Ahuachapán. Yeimy vive con su hermano de 12 años de edad y su hija de 8 años de edad. Yeimy se dedica a la venta de boquitas como yuca y papas fritas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su casa tiene nueve años de experiencia en la elaboración y venta del mismo, el crédito Yeimy lo solicita para la compra de materia prima, ya que desea aumentar su producción de boquitas para lograr obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Yeimy Julissa A. is 23 years old and lives in the county of Las Chinamas in the district of Ahuachapan. Yeimy lives with her 12 year old brother and her daughter who is eight. Yeimy sells snacks like fried yuca and potato chips for a living, and her business is loaced near her home. She has nine years of experience of making and selling these foods, and Yeimy would like a loan to buy raw ingredients as she would like to increase the production of these snacks in order to obtain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients/Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel C. D. R. D. 33 años D. edad resiD. en San Luis La Herradura departamento La Paz. Reina vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos José D. 18 años, Wendy D. 15 años, Gabriel D. 9 años y Brenda D. 2 años D. edad. El esposo D. Reina la ayuda económicamente con 200$ mensuales. Reina tiene un negocio donD. venD. gas propano y agua purificada, también surte su negocio con otros productos D. plástico como huacales y vasos; Reina solicita un crédito por que desea invertir en comprar mayor cantidad D. gas y agua.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel C. D. R. is 33 years old and lives in San Luis La Herradura in the district of La Paz. Reina lives with her husband and four kids: Jose who is 18 years old, Wendy who is 15, Gabriel who is 9 and Brenda who is 2. Reina's husband helps them out financially with $200 a month. Reina has a business selling propane gas and purified water, as well as stocking other plastic products like crates and cups. Reina would like a loan in order to invest it in buying larger quantites of gas and water.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy propane gas and purified water/Comprar gas propano y agua purificada

loans.name: Manlikova  Ivanova

texts.es: Manlikova Ivanova M. M. de 27 años de edad reside en el municipio de Cojutepeque ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Manlikova vive con su madre, su esposo y su hijo de 3 años de edad, Manlikova posee una tienda ubicada en su casa con diversos productos de consumo, la tienda es atendida por ella y su madre Doña Sara; ya que Manlikova trabaja también como profesora de Computación en una escuela y recibe un salario mensual de 200$. El crédito que Manlikova solicita es para surtir su negocio el cual tiene ya diez años a flote y quiere seguir creciendo en su volumen de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Manlikova Ivanova M. M. is 27 years old and lives in the county of Cojutepeque which is located in the district of Cuscatlan. Monlikova lives with her mother, her husband and their 3 year old son. Malikova has a store in her house which sells various consumer products. The store is looked after by her and her mother, Doña Sara, as Manlikova also works as an IT teacher in a school and receives a monthly salary of $200. Manlikova would like a loan to stock her business which has been going for ten years as she wants the amount of products she is able to offer her clients to keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business/Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Maria Oribel

texts.es: Maria Oribel N. D. R. D. 64 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad. Maria vive junto a su esposo Don Joaquín D. 74 años D. edad quien se dedica a la sastrería también se encuentran sus dos nietas que actualmente están estudiando el bachillerato. Maria se dedica a la venta D. pupusas en su casa donD. lleva ya cuatro años D. experiencia en el negocio, cada pupusa Maria la venD. a $0.30 ctvs. Y su venta promedio total diaria es 40$. El crédito Maria lo solicita para la compra D. materia prima D. sus pupusas ya que desea aumentar la producción D. las mismas.
texts.en:
Maria Oribel N. D. R. is 64. She lives in the La Libertad department with her husband, Joaquín. Joaquín, 74, is a tailor. They also live with two granddaughters who are currently in high school. Maria sells pupusas (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) in her house. She has four years of experience in this business. Maria sells each pupusa for $0.30. Her average daily sales are $40. The loan Maria is asking for is to buy raw material for pupusas. She wants to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make pupusas

loans.name: Ana Josefa

texts.es: Ana Josefa F. reside en Cuscatancingo ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella vive solamente con una nieta. Ana posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa donde vende productos básicos de consumo, Ana solicita este crédito por que le hace falta muchos productos para su tienda ya que posee un poco inventario, con este crédito Ana pretende surtir su negocio así lograra aumentar sus ventas por que todos sus clientes encontraran lo buscan en la tienda de Ana, cabe mencionar que Ana ya ha obtenido cuatro créditos anteriormente de los cuales todo han sido cancelados siendo fue muy responsable en todas sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Ana Josefa F. lives in Cuscatancingo, which is in the department San Salvador. She lives alone except for a granddaughter. Ana runs a small store out of her house, selling basic necessities. Ana is requesting this loan because many products are missing from her store since she has a small inventory. With this loan Ana hopes to stock her store, which will win her increased sales since all her customers will find what they are looking for in her store. It is worth mentioning that Ana has already had four loans prior to this, all of which have been payed off very responsibly in all their installments.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking her store

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Miriam vive  en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos en la calle Manuel Ergueta de la zona de san pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un automóvil con el cual trabaja el esposo todos los días como transporte publico; con esta actividad  mantienen a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para salud ya que Miriam se encuentra muy delicada , además cabe recalcar que por trabajar independiente no cuenta con seguro medico y los costos de consulta y medicamentos son muy caros.

El esposo, don Robin Gorostiaga, fue cliente de Impro y parte de Kiva y su historial de pagos fue muy bueno.
texts.en:
Miriam lives in her own house with her husband and children on Manuel Ergueta street in the San Pedro area of La Paz. She has an automobile that the husband uses every day to transport others like public transportation. This is how they support their family. The loan that she is requesting is for health reasons since Miriam has become weak. Also, since they work independently, they cannot count on medical insurance and the medical expenses are very high. The husband, Robin Gorostiaga, was a previous client of Impro, which is part of Kiva, and his history of loan repayments was very good.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses and medicine for Miriam

loans.name: Bien Fait Plus Group

texts.fr: Katshaya L. vend des pièces de rechange automobile au sud-ouest de Kinshasa. A côté de la vente, il a aussi des champs de manioc qui produisent du manioc qu’il vend à Kinshasa. Il a débuté ses activités respectivement en 2002 et en 2005 avec un capital initial de $50. De 2002 – 2008, l’augmentation du stock de ses marchandises ainsi que leur valeur, ont démontré la prospérité de l’affaire.  En juillet 2008, Katshaya a décidé de joindre un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Bien fait » dans le but de réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour un magasin des pièces de rechange automobile à Kinshasa et de devenir fournisseur. Il a reçu trois fois les prêts de Hope qu’il a remboursé correctement. Le prochain crédit lui permettra d’acheter des boutures de manioc (high bread seeds) en vue de produire une grande quantité de manioc sollicité par beaucoup de gens dans son quartier. Katshaya est âgé de 46 ans, marié et père de cinq enfants âgés de 4 à 25 ans dont le plus âgé est indépendant. Les quatre autres vivent avec lui et deux seulement étudient à l’école primaire.
texts.en:
Katshaya L. sells auto parts to the southwest of Kinshasa. Along with this activity, he also has a field which produces cassava that he sells in Kinshasa. He began these businesses in 2002 and 2005 respectively with an initial capital of $50. From 2002-2008 his stock levels increased, as did the value of the merchandise, demonstrating the business’s profitability. In July 2008 Katshaya decided to join one of the groups of Hope RDC called “Bien Fait,” with the aim of achieving his dream of one day opening an auto parts store in Kinshasa and becoming a supplier. He received three loans from Hope which he repaid as required. The next loan will enable him to buy hybrid cassava seeds to produce large quantities of cassava, which is requested by many people in his neighborhood. Katshaya is 46 years old, married and the father of five children aged between four and 25, the eldest of whom is independent. The four others live with Katshaya and two are at primary school.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cassava cuttings with a view to producing cassava in volume to then sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Deicy

texts.es:
Deicy tiene un puesto de venta donde vende sopa de fideo y silpancho (carne asada con arroz y huevo frito) medio día y por las tardes comercializa productos de Herba Life. Estas dos actividades son su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos que depende de ella pues es madre soltera. Vive en alquiler ubicado en la Zona Ballivian de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para la compra de insumos (fideo y arroz por cantidad) para tener almacenado, reducir costos e incrementar sus ingresos. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Deicy has a stand where she sells noodle soup and silpancho soup (grilled beef with rice and fried egg) at lunch and in the afternoons which are Herba Life products. These two activities are her main source of income that she uses to support her two children that depend on her since she is a single mother. She rents an apartment in the Ballivian zone in the city of El Alto. The loan will go towards the purchase of ingredients (noodles and rice in bulk) that will be stored in order to reduce costs and increase her earnings. This is the first loan with Kiva partner Impro, but she has completed the assessment to qualify for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of noodles and rice in order to save in the costs of her food selling business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 42 years old and married and with three children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and kerosene and has been in this business for the past nine years. She hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria sells loaves of bread in wholesale and retail. She also sells household items. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell.

Victoria is 30 years old and married with two children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia trabaja como costurera, confecciona chamarras y tiene un ingreso mensual; el esposo es chofer de taxi y así logran sus fuentes de ingreso con que cubren la manutención de su familia. Viven en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona de Villa Ingavi – Alto Lima de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (telas, cuero, forros, hilo, etc.), que requiere para confeccionar chamarras en mayor cantidad y así incrementar sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, La evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Lidia works as a seamstress making jackets and has a monthly income. Her husband is a taxi driver and they use these sources of income to support their family. They live in a rented house in the Villa Ingavi – Alto Lima zone of the city of El Alto.

She will use this loan for the purchase of raw material (fabrics, leather, lining, thread, etc.) that she needs to make more jackets and increase her income.

This is her first loan with Impro. The evaluation completed qualifies her for the approval of the loan for which she has applied.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics, leather, lining, etc. to make jackets.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea confecciona mantas para cholitas (mujeres que usan polleras), que  comercializa en las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto, siendo esta su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos;  vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de German Buchs 123 Alto Lima de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra materia prima (Tela) para confeccionar mayor cantidad de mantas, pues su mercado está creciendo.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Andrea makes shawls for “cholitas” (women that wear skirts), which she sells in the popular markets of the city of El Alto. This is her main source of income, which she uses to support her three children. She lives in her parents’ house located in the German Busch 123 Alto Lima zone of the city of El Alto.

She will use this loan to buy raw material (fabric) to make more shawls because her market is increasing.

This is her first loan with Impro. The evaluation completed qualifies her for the approval of the loan for which she has applied.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric for her shawl making business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina trabaja de cocinera en una pensión donde percibe un sueldo mensual y por las tardes confecciona polleras. Así logra sus ingresos con que cubre la manutención de sus cuatro hijos; ella es madre soltera, vive en alquiler ubicado en la zona de German Busch 1-1-2 Alto Lima de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima – telas - para elaborar mayor cantidad de polleras para damas.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Cristina works as a cook in a guesthouse where she receives a monthly salary, and in the afternoons she makes skirts. This is how she earns her income, which she uses to cover the cost of supporting her four children. She is a single mother and lives in a rental located in the German Busch 1-1-2 Alto Lima zone of El Alto.

She will use the loan for the purchase of raw material – fabrics – to make more women’s skirts.

This is her second loan with Impro. The good payment behavior that she demonstrated with our institution qualifies her to access another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics for her business making "polleras" (skirts for rural women)

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina trabaja vivandera (vende comida); tiene un puesto donde todos los días a partir de las 10:00 de la mañana vende almuerzo; el esposo trabaja de costurero en la Republica de Argentina. Los ingresos de la actividad de Celestina más algún dinero que su esposo envía constituyen sus principales fuentes de ingreso con que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos. Celestina vive en su casa propia ubicada en la zona de German Busch 1-1-2 Alto Lima de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra insumos por cantidad como ser papa, pollo, arroz y otros, para obtener mejores precios y tratar de mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación  del préstamo solicitado por Celestina.
texts.en:
Celestina works selling food. She has a stand where she sells lunch everyday starting at 10:00 in the morning. Her husband works as tailor in Argentina. Celestina’s income plus some money that her husband sends are the main sources of income that cover the cost of supporting her three sons. Celestina lives in her own house located in the German Busch 1-1-2 Alto Lima zone of the city of El Alto.

She will use this loan for the purchase of ingredients in bulk such as potatoes, chicken, rice, and others so that she can have better prices and try to improve her earnings.

This is her first loan with Impro. The evaluation completed qualifies her for the approval of the loan for which she has applied.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes, chicken, rice, and other items for her food sales business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 50 years old and married with three children. She sells planks in retail. Mary hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en:
Omolara is 39 years old and has six children. She is married to A. who is a taxi-driver.

Omolara sells drinks and water. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Marcia Mireya

texts.es: La señora Marcia Mireya C. M. , tiene la edad de 37 años , habita en el barrio San Juan , ubicado en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a sus hijos , ella es madres soltera , los planes hacia su familia es poder ayudar a finalizar sus estudios a sus tres hijos , doña Marcia desde hace 15 años se dedica a la confecciones , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio con esfuerzos propios este negocio , los planes futuros hacia su negocio es poder comprar maquinas industriales . Con el financiamiento va a comprar materiales de confección para poder hacer sus vestidos y poder vender.
texts.en:
Marcia Mireya C. M. is 37 years old and is a single mother. She lives with her children in the neighborhood of San Juan, which is located in the municipality of La Concepción. Her plan for the family is to be able to help her three children complete their studies. Marcia has been in the clothing industry for 15 years. The greatest difficulty that it has presented to her is the lack of financing. She started the business on her own. Her future plan for her business is to buy industrial sewing machines. With this loan she will buy materials so that she can make her dresses and sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other items to be able to do her sewing work

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
Isidora es empleada domestica, trabaja en la calle Murillo y su esposo es jubilado. Por los pocos ingresos que tiene la señora recibe la ayuda de su hija que es madre soltera para que pueda solventarse los gastos de alimentación. 
Vive en la Zona de pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa propia
Requiere el crédito para el tratamiento medico de su esposo.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su responsabilidad le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito ya que es un cliente con calificación 1 es decir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas
texts.en:
Isidora works as a housekeeper from her job on Murillo Street. Her husband is retired. Due to her low wages, Isadora receives assistance from her daughter, who is a single mother, in order to pay her food bill. She has her own home in the Pasankeri district of the city of La Paz.

She needs a loan to pay for her husband’s medical treatment. This is her third loan with IMPRO. Based on the responsibility she has demonstrated from previous loan opportunities, this client has been given a high rating – which indicates she will make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her husband's medical treatment

loans.name: Evarista Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Evarista del Carmen R. , tiene la edad de 56 años , habita en el barrio el cielo , ubicado en Masaya , junto a su esposo , el cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas, ellos tiene cinco hijos tres de ellos ya son casados y dos todavía estudian y le poyan con las actividades del hogar y campo, los planes hacia sus familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Evarista desde hace 12 años se dedica a la agricultura , el mayor problema que se le presenta es el mal invierno y la falta de financiamiento  , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus hermanos , los planes futuros hacia la producción es diversificarlo y darle mejor mantenimiento .Con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y aplicar el cultivo para lograr una buena producción.
texts.en:
Evarista del Carmen R., 56, lives with her husband in the El Cielo neighborhood in Masaya. Her husband helps her with the farm work. They have five children. Three of them are married, and two still go to school. They help with the work at home and in the fields. The family plan is to improve their living conditions. Evarista has been farming for 12 years. The biggest problems are the bad winter and the lack of financing. She started this activity with help from her siblings. Future production plans are to diversify and to have better maintenance. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and supplies to put on the crops to achieve better production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers to put on the crops

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel es jubilado de Comibol (Corporación Minera de Bolivia) y tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde vende refrescos, abarrotes, dulces conservas y otros.
Vive en la zona de Alto seguencoma de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para compra de mercadería ( abarrotes y conservas).
Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas
texts.en:
Abel is a pensioner, retired from Comibol (Corporacion Minera de Bolivia), and operates a general store in his house where he sells cold drinks, groceries, canned goods and other products. He lives in his own house in the Alto Seguencoma section of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to buy merchandise (groceries and canned goods). This is Abel's sixth Impro loan application. He is considered to be a good customer of the bank because of his past payment history.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to stock general store.

loans.name: Joke

texts.en: Joke is 56 years old and she is a widow with four children. She sells food and drinks. With the income from this business she has been able to pay the school fees for her eldest children, who are in the university. Joke hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more food items to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, es empleado trabaja en el Instituto Geográfico Militar, es soltero e independiente ya que la fuente de trabajo que tiene es para solventar los gastos de alimentación, vivienda y vestimenta.
Vive en la zona de Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa en anticrético.
El crédito será destinado para pagar un curso que su trabajo le exige en el ministerio de defensa y así tener mejores condiciones laborales.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Jose, employed at the Instituto Geografico Militar, is single and independent. The income from his job covers his food, housing and clothing expenses. He lives in the Villa Copacabana section of the city of La Paz in a house "en anticretico" [a lease arrangement common in Bolivia]. The loan will be used to pay for a course required for his job at the Ministry of Defense that will help him to further his career there. This is Jose's fourth Impro loan. He has a good history of repaying past loans that qualifies him as a good customer of the bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a course that will further his career at the Ministry of Defense.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Fátima del Rosario M., tiene la edad de 44 años, habita en el barrio Lomas del Gavilán, junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen cinco hijos , ya todos mayores de edad y casados , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Fátima desde hace ochos años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas, ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su esposo .Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y mejorar la producción, con esto espera obtener mejores ganancias y poder cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Sra. Fatima del Rosario M., 44, lives in the town of Lomas del Gavilan. Her husband helps with household expenses. They have five children, all grown now and married. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions. Fatima has earned an income from farming for the last eight years. The most difficult thing for her are the "plagas" [could be "insects" or "diseases" that affect crops, but not clear]. She started the business with help from her husband. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and supplies to improve crop production and, in turn, she hopes, increase her earnings and cover expenses for the things that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and supplies for improving crop production.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es comerciante se dedica a la compra y venta de queso, repartiendo en domicilios de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz.
Vive en la zona de irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de queso).
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de kiva.
Las ganas de trabajar le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Teodora operates a business buying and selling cheese, delivering her products to houses throughout the southern neighborhoods of La Paz. She lives in the Irpavi II area of La Paz in a house that she owns. The loan will be used for working capital (cheese purchases). This is her third Impro loan and the second one that has required support from Kiva. The earnings from working have given her the opportunity to get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stocks for retail cheese business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina se dedica a la venta de ropa a crédito, deja su mercadería en los mercados, sindicatos y oficinas. Su esposo es chofer de radio taxi.
Vive en la zona de Bolognia de la ciudad de La paz en casa Alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo ( Compra de pantalones, camisas, blusas, chompas y otros.)
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la tercera que requiere el apoyo de kiva Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Marina operates a business selling clothes, on credit, offering her merchandise in markets, cooperatives and offices. Her husband is a cab driver. She lives in a rented house in the Bolognia area of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used for working capital (purchases of trousers, shirts, blouses, sweaters and other articles of clothing). This is Marina's third Impro loan and the third one that has required support from Kiva. She has a history of repaying past loans on time which qualifies her as a good customer of the bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes for retail clothing business.

loans.name: Wipala Jóvenes Group

texts.es: “Wipala Jóvenes” es un grupo de cuatro integrantes, de los cuales dos se dedican a la venta de productos medicinales naturales, tales como yerbas, semillas y plantas, uno  se dedica a la  costura de diferentes prendas de vestir, especializándose en deportivos y uno a vender productos varios  según la temporada o época. Todos necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
“Wipala Jóvenes” is a 4-member group. One of the group members sells natural medicinal products, such as herbs, seeds, and plants. Another member sews different types of garments, specializing in sportswear, and another member sells seasonal products. All of the group members need the loan for the purchase of merchandise and raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Helman Santiago

texts.es: El señor Helman Santiago R. López, tiene la edad de 30 años, habita en el barrio Lomas del Gavilán, ubicado en Masaya, junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen dos hijos, la niña de siete años estudia actualmente y el varón de tres años, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, don Helman desde hace cinco años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de asesoramiento técnico , ya que por no saber inducir bien los fertilizantes a perdido producción , el inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es poder tener una buena producción. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes y poder lograr una buena producción.
texts.en:
Helman R. López is 30 years old and lives with his wife in the Lomas del Gavilán neighborhood, located in Masaya. She helps him with household tasks. They have two children – their 7-year-old daughter is currently in school and they have a 3-year-old son. His plan for the family is to improve their living conditions. Helman has been working in agriculture for five years. The biggest difficulty that it has presented to him is the lack of technical advising because he does not know how to apply fertilizers well to lost produce. He started this business on his own and his future plan for his farming is to have better production. With the loan, he will purchase fertilizers so that he can have better production.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers to improve production.

loans.name: Funke

texts.en:
Funke is a tailor and she also sells tailoring materials. She hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

Funke is 29 years old and single without a child. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla Patricia S. , tiene la edad de 29 años , habita en el barrio Las enramadas , junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene un hijo y actualmente ella espera un bebé, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder construir su vivienda , ella desde hace trece años , se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y la erosión de suelo , doña Karla inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es poder diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y aplicarlo al cultivo.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia S. is 29 years old and lives in the Las Enramadas neighborhood with her husband, who helps her with the household tasks. They have a son and she is currently expecting a baby. Her plan for her family is to improve their living conditions and be able to build their home. She has been working in agriculture for thirteen years. The greatest difficulty that it has presented to her is the lack of financing and soil erosion. Karla began this business with the support of her parents. Her future plan for her crops is to be able to diversify them. With the loan, she will buy fertilizers and supplies to use for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers to improve production.

loans.name: Nueva Luz Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario nueva luz esta ubicado en la aldea coyolito a 100 metros al este de la lonja, y esta formado por tres miembros, ellos se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo.
 
las actividades que realizan cada uno son las siguientes:
el señor fidel C. R. tiene 26 años de edad y esta casado con la señora edit xiomara G., tienen dos hijos una niña pequeña y un varon que esta en la escuela.
ella se dedica a cuidar los niños y el se dedica al negocio de compra venta de pescado y camarones, su casa es de madera a la orilla del mar.
necesita el prestamo para invertirlo en compra de pescado blanco, pescado rojo y pescado babosa.
 
la sra patrocinia del carmen D. tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en la
aldea del tular abajo. se dedica a la compra venta de pescado que lo vende en la zona, tambien le ayuda la nuera a vender en la comunidad y fuera de la zona necesita el crédito para comprar mas pescado y asi tener mayor utilidad.

la sra. mirian griselda G. tiene 23 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos su esposo se llama hector ulices rivas, se dedica a la venta de frescos y golosinas, necesita el prestamo para comprar mas refrescos para surtir el negocio.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Nueva Luz is located in the village Coyolito, 100 meters east of the fish market. It is made up of three members, who have known each other for a long time.

The activities that they each do are the following: Sr. Fidel C. R. is 26 years old, and is married to Sra. Edit Xiomara G.. They have 2 children, a little girl and a son who is in school. She takes care of the children, and he is a dealer of fish and prawns. Their house is made of wood, and is at the sea shore. They need the loan to invest in the purchase of white fish, red fish, and babosa fish.

Sra. Patrocinia del Carmen D. is 36 years old, and is a single mother. She lives in the village of Tular Abajo. She is a fish dealer and she sells fish in the region. She also she helps her daughter-in-law sell in the community and outside of the region. She needs the loan to buy more fish and therefore have higher profits.

Sra. Mirian Griselda G. is 23 years old, is married, and has two children. Her husband´s name is Hector Ulices Rivas. She sells soft drinks and candy. She needs the loan to buy more soft drinks to supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish, prawns, and soft drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es: El señor Santos Isabel García , tiene la edad de 51 años , habita en el barrio Panamá de los Amadores , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tiene dos hijos ya casados unos de ellos es artesano y el otro se dedica a la agricultura , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Santos desde hace 25 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que son las plagas y  dinero para combatirlas, el inicio esta actividad con esfuerzos propios , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es poder establecer una manzana mas de que quique .Con el Préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar la producción.
texts.en:
Santos Isabel García is 51 years old and lives with his wife in the Panamá de los Amadores neighborhood located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She helps him with household tasks. They have two children who are already married – one is a craftsmen and the other works in agriculture. His plan for the family is to improve their living conditions. Santos has been working in agriculture for 25 years. The biggest difficulties are pests and the money to get rid of them. He started this business on his own. His future plan for his farming is to be able to set up one more plot of quequisque. With the loan, he will purchase fertilizers and supplies to improve production.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: 16 Magnificas Group

texts.es:
“Magníficas” es un grupo de señoras dinámicas, todas escuchan atentas a la explicación de la asesora, sobre la importancia de la garantía solidaria. Ellas tienen negocios pequeños como: venta de víveres, ropa de bebe, garrafas, accesorios de celulares, tejido de prendas, elaboración de embutidos y otros, requieren el préstamo para comprar arroz, lana, funda de celular, carne y así incrementar su mercadería.

Maria Q. tiene el negocio de embutidos y  menciona que la capacitación que recibe en las reuniones  sobre la administración del negocio le ayuda a no perder las cuentas y tener en orden su negocio.
texts.en:
“Magníficas” is a dynamic group of women. All of them listen attentively to the advice explaining the importance of their solidarity loan. They are small businesses owners involved in selling groceries, baby clothes, bottles, mobile phone accessories, woven garments, sausages and others items. They require a loan to buy rice, wool, mobile phone covers and meat in order to increase their merchandise.

Maria Q. has a sausage business. She mentioned that the training she received at the meetings has helped her organize her business and prevented her from losing customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
la señora Cornelia R. tiene 56 años de edad, vive en la colonia Fraternidad, tiene 8 años de vivir en ese lugar, es madre soltera, no tiene dependientes, todos sus hijos estan casados y viven en diferentes lugares de San Lorenzo, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas. 
De esta manera a podido salir adelante, pudo construir su casa y a podido hacer muchas mejoras a su hogar, es una mujer muy emprendedora y honesta.

ella esta solicitando el prestamo para comprar maiz, leña, cal, y ademas desea mejorar las condiciones de la cocina donde elabora las tortillas, su negocio es muy rentable debido a que en la zona no hay otro negocio de tortilla cerca tiene muchos clientes.
 
su sueño es poner una pequeña fabrica de tortillas en la zona.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cornelia R. is 56 years old and lives in the district of Fraternidad, where she has lived for 8 years. She is a single mother, but she doesn’t have any dependents because all of her children are married and live in different places in San Lorenzo. She makes and sells tortillas. In this way, she can go forward, build her house, and make many improvements on her home. She is an enterprising and honest woman. She is requesting this loan to buy corn, firewood, and lime. She also wants to improve the conditions of the kitchen where she makes the tortillas. Her business is very profitable because in her area no other tortilla businesses nearby have many clients. Her dream is to have a small tortilla factory in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, corn, water, and lime

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hermen Abed

texts.es:
el señor Hermen Abed N. Zuniga tiene 31 años de edad, es vecino del barrio la ceibita, esta casado con la señora Jessi Espinal Aguilar,  tienen tres hijos estan en la escuela.
ella se dedica a cuidar a los niños y atender la casa, el se dedica a la carpinteria, tiene un taller en su casa de habitacion, el fabrica muebles como ser: juegos de comedor, puertas, ventanas,
sillas, camas, chineros, comodas y todo lo relacionado con la carpinteria.
tiene su negocio desde hace 02 años el local es propio y necesita el crédito para comprar madera, sellador, barnis,y clavos. ya que desea trabajar con un contrato de fabricar chineros para una casa comercial y asi podra tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Hermen Abed N. Zúñiga, 31, lives in the Ceibita neighborhood. He is married to Jessi Espinal Aguilar. They have three children who go to school. She takes care of the children and the house. He is a carpenter. He has his shop in his house. He makes furniture like dining room sets, doors, windows, chairs, beds, china cupboards, dressers, and everything that has to do with carpentry. He has had this business for two years, and the place is his own. He needs a loan to buy wood, sealant, varnish, and nails. He wants to work with a contract to make china cabinets for a commercial house. That way he will be able to have greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood, paint, varnish, sealant, and nails.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
el señor Wilson Daniel M. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en la colonia 17 de septiembre y tiene 16 años de vivir en esa zona, el esta casado con la señora Reina Isabel Rivas con la que ha procreado 03 hijos dos de ellos estan en el colegio.
su esposa le ayuda en el negocio de la venta de confites y galletas las venden en las escuelas y pulperias de la zona.  el producto lo transporta en su carro y ademas el señor wilson tiene un taxi que le genera Lps. 250.00 diarios.
 
este negocio lo realiza desde hace dos años logrando asi una buena estabilidad economica para el y su familia, el necesita el credito para comprar 8 cajas de bombones, 2 cajas de conserva, 5 cajas de galletas, 4 cajas de gelatina, 5 cajas de chicles. 
 
su deseo es convertir su negocio en una distribuidora fuerte de confites y galletas de la zona.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilson Daniel M., 33, has lived in the 17 de Septiembre neighborhood for 16 years. He is married to Sra. Reina Isabela Rivas and they have 3 children, including two in high school. Wilson's wife helps him operate his business selling sweets and snacks at schools and corner stores in the neighborhood. He carries his products in his car and also operates a taxi business that generates Lps. 250.00 per day.

He set up his business two years ago and, with the business, managed to get greater economic stability for himself and his family. He needs the loan to buy 8 cases of bonbons, 2 cases of jam, 5 cases of cookies, 4 cases of gelatin, and 5 cases of chewing gum

His hope is to grow his business into a strong distributor of sweets and snacks in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for sweets and snacks business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: El señor Ismael R. Hernández , tiene la edad de 53 años , habita en el barrio Pilas Orientales , ubicado en Masaya , junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja como docente y le poya con los gastos del hogar ,ellos tiene tres hijos , los cuales estudian y le apoyan con las actividades del campo en sus tiempos libres ;  los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Ismael desde hace 36 años es agricultor la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , él inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos , los planes futuros a su cultivos es poder legalizar donde se encuentra la plantación .Con el financiamiento va a comprar semillas y fertilizantes y lograr una mejor producción para vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Sr. Ismael R. H., 52, lives with his wife in the Pilas Orientales neighborhood of Masaya. His wife is a teacher and helps with household expenses. They have three children, all in school, who help Ismael with farming chores in their free time. His plan for his family is to improve their living conditions. Ismael has been a farmer for 36 years. The biggest problem he faces is a lack of financing. He grew his business from scratch and his future goal for the business is to be able to legalize the land where he plants his crops. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to improve his production so that he can sell his crop for a good price at market.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to improve crop yields.

loans.name: Kantutitas Group

texts.es: La asociación “Kantutitas” trabaja junto a Pro-mujer hace  un año aproximadamente, se reúnen en el centro focal Alto Lima, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con trece integrantes.Diversas son las actividades de este grupo, como ser; confección de deportivos, otras tienen tiendas de barrio, elaboran remedios naturales, venden accesorios para autos, también  realizan tejidos de mantillas y trabajos de carpintería, Rosa por ejemplo trabaja siendo carpintera junto a su esposo, elaboran sus trabajos para luego venderlos a pedido y en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de el Alto. La asociación Kantutitas desea comprar materia prima y productos para ampliar su producción, solo con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos  para  ofrecer bienestar en sus hogares
texts.en:
The Kantutitas association has worked with Pro-Mujer for approximately one year. It meets in the Alto Loma center in the city of El Alto. The association currently has thirteen members. The group's businesses are diverse and include: making sports clothes for sale, operating retail stores, concocting natural medicines for sale, selling automobile accessories, knitting matillas for sale, and carpentry services. Rosa, for example, works as a carpenter with her husband, making products and selling them to order and in the 16 de Julio market in El Alto. The Kantutitas assocation wants to buy raw materials and products to expand their output, with the end of improving their incomes and enhancing the wellbeing of their respective households.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various supplies and products for range of businesses.

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Danelia del Carmen Rodríguez, tiene la edad de 58 años, habita en el barrio Medardo Andino, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos , ya todos independientes , los tres son docentes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar la vivienda , ella desde hace 20 años tiene a cargo el cafetín del Instituto de Ticuantepe y a la vez le proporciona el alimento a los docentes , ella inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos .  Con el financiamiento va incrementar su inventario en la compra de granos básicos, carnes, productos lácteos, golosinas y otras variedades de productos para atender bien a su cliente. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con los préstamos ya que ha logrado permanecer en las ventas. Este es su sexto ciclo y espera seguir trabando y seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Danelia del Carmen Rodríguez is 58 years of old. She lives in the neighborhood of Medardo Andino in the town of Ticuantepe. She is married and has three adult children, who are all teachers. Together with her husband, they support each other with the household expenses. She plans to make improvements to her family’s home. For 20 years she has been in charge of the cafeteria at the Instituto de Ticuantepe where she prepares food for the faculty members. She started this business of her own initiative.

She will use her loan to increase her inventory by purchasing basic grains, meats, dairy products, sweets and other varieties of products to serve her customers well. Thanks to the support of her loans from AFODENIC she has managed to maintain her sales. This is her sixth loan and hopes to continue working and strengthening her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, meat, and sweets for preparing meals

loans.name: Mujeres En Victoria Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres en Victoria son personas luchadoras con muchas esperanzas de superarse, ellas son vecinas cercanas. Sra. Esperanza M. es la lider del grupo, ella tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, sus hijos tienen 7 y 2 años de edad. Tiene un año de dedicarse a su negocio el cual es venta de golosinas como ser, tacos, platanos fritos con frijoles, baleadas, pollo frito, refrescos naturales y de botella, ahora ella cocina en su estufa pero va a usar el prestamo para comprarse una freidora.
la sra. Claudia es dueña de una pulperia en donde vende productos como ser pan, pastas, jabones, apomitas de maiz, sopas, refrescos, huevos, lactesos etc. ella tiene 24 años de edad y tiene dos hijos los cuales tienen 8 y 6 años de edad.
sra. Doris tiene un puesto de frutas y ahi vende minimos, aguacates y sandillas, ella esta ubicada en un lugar en donde pasa mucha gente, ella necesita el credito para comprar mas frutas, tambien ella quiere empezar a comprar lacteos para vender como queso, quesillo, mantequilla, requeson.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus familias y sus hogares.
texts.en:
The Women in Victory are tough people with great hopes of improving themselves. They are close neighbors. Mrs. Esperanza M., 30, is the group leader, a single mother with kids ages 7 and 2. She's spent a year on her business, which sells sweets, tacos, fried bananas with beans, fried chicken, natural refreshments, bottled soft drinks, etc. For now she cooks with her stove, but she's going to use the loan to buy herself a deep fryer. Mrs. Claudia is owner of a local store where she sells products like bread, pastas, soap, soups, drinks, eggs, dairy products, etc. She's 24 and has two kids, ages 8 and 6. Mrs. Doris has a fruit stand, and sells there avocados and watermelons. She's located in a place where many people pass by. She needs a loan to buy more fruit; she also wants to start buying dairy to see cheese, butter, and cottage cheese. All of them need the loan to be able to improve the situations of their families and homes.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fryer and merchandise

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El Joven Sergio C. es soltero, actual mente terminando de estudiando. 
En está momento solicitando un préstamo ay que no cuenta con el dinero para poder pagar la colegiatura de la universidad y así terminar sus estudios. Para titularse en la carrera de administración de empresas. 
En este momento elaborar como supervisor de personal en una fabrica esté es el ingreso que tiene para salir adelante y con el cual pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Sergio C. is single young man who has his mind set on completing his studies.

Right now, he is applying for a loan since he does not have the money to pay the college tuition necessary to earn his degree. He plans to pursue a career in business administration after graduation.

At the moment, he works in a factory as a personnel supervisor. His job provides the income necessary to move forward and make his loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay college tuition

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La señora Maribel
texts.en: Miss Maribel

loans.use: To build a concrete roof

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Rafael S. es padre de familia, tiene dos hijos que actual mente están estudiando.
A la vivienda le está haciendo falta el vitropiso en toda la casa no cuenta con el dinero, para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de colocar el vitropiso.
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así realizar la mejora los más pronto posibles ya que quiere que su familia viva mejor.
Don Rafael planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos de su trabajo como guardia de seguridad en una compañía.
texts.en:
Mr. Rafael S. is the father of two children who are currently studying.

His house is missing a “vitropiso” (a ceramic-tiled floor) throughout the entire space. He does not have the money to buy the materials and pay for labor to have the floor installed. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can make these improvements as soon as possible so that his family can live better.

Don Rafael plans to repay the loan with the earnings from his company job as a security guard.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a ceramic tile floor in his house

loans.name: Las Ungidas 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
20-year-old Nemesi partially demonstrates her maturity by the fact that she is one of the coordinators for the Bank of Hope Las Ungidas. She also looks after her three younger brothers who live with her. She plans to use her increased profits to help pay for their school which will resume in August. Using her house as a base, Nemesi plans to use this loan to expand her business of selling wallets, purses, shoes, and skirts. The capital, Santo Domingo, is about an hour away from her home in Los Alcarrizos and Nemesi plans to make bimonthly trips there to purchase her merchandise for the best price. 

Not only is Nemesi excited about expanding her business efforts, but she is also excited about the responsibilities associated with being a group coordinator. Esperanza International uses the Grameen model of group lending. This means that if one member in the group defaults, the other members are responsible for this portion too. Thus, it is important the group maintains a sense of solidarity and actively works through problems together. Nemesi is eager to help facilitate these conversations and unity. She described “solidarity” as a little word that has great meaning; that it means a group commitment to helping one another mutually attain goals and overcome obstacles. 


On behalf of Carmen Nemesi, the Bank of Hope “Las Ungidas,” and the microfinance institute Esperanza International, thank you for providing opportunities to those who need it most.

loans.use: To expand her busines

loans.name: Alma Nidia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, la señora Alma Nidia V. con gran esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de venta de comida la cual es preparada por ella misma en su localidad donde es muy visitada por sus clientes porque les gusta los alimentos que ella prepara.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo requiere de la inversión para crecer, la señora Alma necesita invertir para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así venderlos a sus clientes en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the city of León, Mrs. Alma Nidia V. works hard at her business of preparing and selling food. Her customers frequent her vending location because they enjoy the food she makes.

Like any developing business, Mrs. Alma’s venture needs capital to grow. She needs to purchase ingredients to prepare her meals and sell them to the customers in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, la señora Flor de María se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de productos personales siendo ofertados en su localidad el cual es muy visitado por muchos clientes por estar en un lugar céntrico en el mercado Central de León.

Ella tiene la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y por ese motivo es que ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y así mejorar las condiciones de su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
In the city of León, Mrs. Flor de María runs her own business selling personal products. Her products are sold in her shop in the center of León's Central Market. Due to its central location, her shop is visited by many customers. Needing to invest in her business, she has approached Ceprodel to benefit from a loan, which will improve her business that is so greatly in need of an investment.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing of personal products

loans.name: Isabel Del Pilar

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, la señora Isabel G. se dedica a vender en su establecimiento frutas y verduras siendo comercializadas por ella misma todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Con mucho esfuerzo, la señora Isabel ha logrado mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las frutas y verduras y de esta manera ofertarlas en su localidad donde a diario es visitada.
texts.en:
In the city of León, Mrs. Isabel G. is at her same vending location each day selling fruits and vegetables. Her days start in the very early hours of the morning.

Through her hard work, Mrs. Isabel has managed to improve her living conditions. For this reason, she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables that she can offer from daily-frequented establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marco R. se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa en su localidad en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de León donde oferte todo tipo de ropa tanto para niños, damas y caballeros.

El señor Marco decidió acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la ropa con el propósito de ofertarla en su localidad y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Marco R. sells clothes from his stand in the Central Market in the city of Leon. He sells all types of clothes for children, women, and men. Marco decided to come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy clothes. His plan is to sell them at his stand; this way he can improve his economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Olga María

texts.es:
Con gran esfuerzo por mejorar sus circunstancias de vida, la señora Olga M. se dedica a trabajar en su negocio de venta de ropa la cual es comercializada por ella misma en la ciudad de León.

Es de importancia destacar que hoy en día, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la ropa ya que le es de utilidad y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida y beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Olga M. works with great effort to improve her life circumstances. Her business is selling clothes. She sells them herself in the city of Leon. She has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy clothes. This is profitable, and it will improve her living conditions and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruben Antonio

texts.es: El señor de nombre Rubén Antonio C. tiene 24 años de edad. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de soldaduras. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio desde muy joven, trabajando para salir adelante. Por lo que sus servicios los brinda de manera ambulante, y por medio de sus amistades ha conseguido obtener a sus clientes. Rubén es un hombre muy responsable disfruta mucho su trabajo pues cada día se instruye en algo nuevo. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de herramientas. El deseo de Rubén es  seguir con alternativa para vivir.
texts.en:
Rubén Antonio C. is 24. He offers his soldering services as a street vendor. He has been doing this for more than eight years. He started working to get ahead when he was very young. He offers his services as a street vender. He obtained his customers through his friends. Rubén is a very responsible man who really enjoys his work. Every day he learns something new. The loan is for working capital to buy tools. Rubén’s wish is to continue working towards an improved lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La Señora Isabel vive con su esposo y su pequeño nieto, tiene una tienda D. abarrotes la cual le permite generar ingresos y podele ayudar a su esposo con los gastos D. la familia, ya que su esposo trabaja como chofer asalariado y no tienen aún una vivienda propia, el prestamo lo invetíra en la compra D. mercadería que le va permitir surtir mas su tienda y poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel lives with her husband and her little grandson. She has a grocery store that allows her to generate income, and she can help her husband with the family expenses. Since her husband works as a wage-earning driver, and they do not have their own home, she will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise, which will allow her to supply her store more and improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of groceries for her store (rice, pasta, flour, oil, etc)

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: La Señora Sandra María E. A. tiene la edad de 28 años. Es una joven soltera. Tiene 2 hijos y todavía no asisten a una escuela. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de alquiler de teléfonos, venta de recargas telefónicas. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella decide buscar una fuente de ingresos para su familia, ya que sus hijos tienen muchas necesidades, y como una madre responsable decide incursionar en este trabajo, algunas veces Sandra tiene que pasar mucho tiempo bajo el sol, porque su pequeño negocio está situado en un lugar donde transitan muchas personas y es así como decide seguir adelante con su negocio. Por lo que el dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de teléfonos, recargas para abastecer a la demanda de sus clientes. El sueño de Sandra es lograr obtener un cyber en donde pueda darles un mejor servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Sandra Maria E. A. is 28 years old, and single. She has two children, who are not in school yet. Her business is to offer the services of rental phones, and sales of cards to recharge minutes for cell phones. She has had this business for more than four years. She decided to look for a source of income for her family, since her two children have many needs, and as a responsible mother, she decided to foray into this work.

Sometimes Sandra has to spend a lot of time in the sun, because her small business is located in a place where many people pass by, and that is how she decided to move forward with her business. The money that she is requesting is for working capital for the purchase of telephones, and recharge cards to supply the demand of her customers. Sandra´s dream is to succeed in obtaining a cyber-cafe where she can give better services to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Betty Del Socorro

texts.es: Betty del Socorro R. C. tiene 28 años. Es una mujer casada. Ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y sus hijos estudian. Betty es una mujer muy luchadora por lo que inicio este negocio hace 5 años. Para ella este trabajo es muy agotador, pero sabe muy bien que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado realizar grandes progresos, por lo que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de golosinas, jugos y gaseosas ella ofrecía estos productos en la terminal de buses, por lo que aquí circulaban mucho clientes, pero con el tiempo reserva una parte de dinero y decide vender otro tipo de productos como calzado, camisetas, camisolas, calcetines y ropa interior. Es por eso que solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de nuevos y variados productos. Sus aspiraciones son de establecer un negocio en su vivienda para tener un amplio inventario.
texts.en:
Betty del Socorro R. C. is 28 years old, married and has two children, who are still in school, under her care. Betty is a hardworking woman and she began her business five years ago. She finds this work very exhausting but she knows well that with great sacrifices she will be able to make great progress. She used to sell sweets, juices and carbonated beverages at the bus terminal because of all the customers congregating there. But over time she set aside some of her money and decided to sell other kinds of products, such as footwear, blouses, undershirts, socks and underwear. That's why she is seeking a loan for working capital to be used to purchase new and different kinds of products. Her aspirations are to establish a business in her home so she can have a bigger inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Desarrollo Rural Group

texts.es:
Ubicado en el Departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta Comunidad que pertenece al barrio D. Yananaco y se dedica al Comercio.

Maxima, es casada y tiene 07 hijos. Tiene por negocio la venta D. yogurt que ella misma elabora con la ayuda D. uno D. sus hijos, el cual estudia industrias alimentarias fuera D. Huancavelica. Hilda ahora que aprendió a ahorrar, lo hace para formalizar su negocio y hacer D. el una empresa.

Julia es casada y tiene 04 hijos, todos en edad escolar. Ella se dedica a la venta D. golosinas, negocio que inicio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. El dinero que recibe lo invierte en su negocio, para poder variar sus productos y tener mas mercadería que vender. Sus ahorros, están destinados a la educación D. sus hijos.

Beatriz tiene 02 hijos y es madre soltera. Ella se dedicaba  a la venta D. productos por catálogos y gracias a sus prestamos empezó a vender ropa para bebes. Hilda invierte sus ahorros en mas mercadería y tiene como meta abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Located in the Department of Huancavelica, this community belongs to the Yananaco neighborhood and they work in retail. Maxima is married and she has 7 children. She has a business selling yogurt that she makes herself with the help of one of her children, who is studying food industries outsiD. of Huancavelica. Hilda, now that she has learned how to save does so in order to formalize her business so that she can make into a company. Julia is married and has 4 children, all of school age. She sells sweets, a business that she started to help her husband with the family expenses. She invests the money that she earns in her business so that she can vary her products and have more merchandise to sell. Her savings are destined for her children’s education. Beatriz has 2 children and is a single mother. She sells products from catalogs and thanks to her loans she has begun selling baby clothing. Hilda invests her savings in more merchandise and she has the goal of opening a store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The members of the communal bank “Bancomunal Desarrollo Rural” (Rural Development) are requesting a loan of 8,300 PEN so that they can invest in their businesses

loans.name: Mujeres Sinceras Group

texts.en:
Ruth R. is a cheerful single mother and the coordinator for a new microfinance group of fifteen entrepreneurs. Her four children, Andelie, Danielle, Avel, and Ruth are 13, 11, 9, and 1 years old, respectively. They live together with her mother in Villa Isabela, a small village west of Puerta Plata. On days when her children aren’t in school, they enjoy playing baseball with other kids from the neighborhood. Although Mrs. R. says she has very little time for fun, she enjoys playing with her one-year-old child and listening to Shakira and Juanes.

Recently, Mrs. R. has been working to expand her hair salon. A friend told her about Esperanza and she recognized the opportunity to increase her income. She intends to use her increased capital to buy a new hair salon, which she believes will pay back the loan and significantly improve her life.

Mrs. R. works mainly for her children. She hopes to provide them all with a college education and wants to secure a future for them in the Dominican Republic. Like many of the other women in the group, she sees her first loan from Esperanza as the beginning of a more secure, more fruitful lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a new hair salon

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es:
Aurea es socia del Banco Comunal Kutimuy que significa Regresa en quechua.
Aurea es soltera, tiene 59 años y 3 hijos, Aurea vende refrescos que ella misma prepara, sus ventas son de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Clara, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Aurea junto a sus hijos realizan artesanía en piedra de Huamanga, sus productos los vende en los mercados.
Aurea necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de piedra de Huamanga.
Los sueños de Aurea son progresar con su negocio y que sus hijos se superen.
texts.en:
Aurea is a member of the communal bank “Kutimuy”. “Kutimuy” means “return” in Quechua. Aurea is single. She is 59 years old and has three children. Aurea sells cold drinks that she prepares herself. She sells them everyday by moving around the Santa Clara market. Also, Aurea, along with her children, makes folk-art from the stone from Huamanga. The folk-art she also sells in the markets. Aurea needs a loan of 1,000 soles that she will use to invest in more of the stone from Huamanga. Aurea dreams of progressing with her business and also that her children are successful.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone from Huamanga

loans.name: Gloria Epifania

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Kutimuy que significa Regresa en quechua.
Gloria es casada, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Gloria junto a su esposo e hijos se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos en telares, producen pasadizos, frazadas, productos que envía a la ciudad de Cuzco y también en los mercados de la ciudad de ayacucho. Además Gloria tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lanas, tintes.
Los sueños de Gloria son progresar y ser una gran empresaria, sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Kutimuy -- which means "return" in quechua -- community bank. Gloria is married, is 33 years old and has three children. Alongside her husband and children, Gloria is dedicated to weaving on looms. They produce "pasadizos" (textiles that can cover tables, chairs or floors) and blankets, products that they send to the city of Cuzco and also to the markets in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Gloria has a small shop in her home. Gloria needs a loan of 1,400 soles which will be invested in the purchase of wool and dye. Gloria's dreams are to progress and be a great entrepreneur and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of wool and dye.

loans.name: Yene

texts.es:
Yene es socia del Banco Comunal Kutimuy que significa Regresa en quechua.
Yene es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Yene vende vino, caña, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, sus productos los comercializa en la feria de San Felipe donde también vende verduras y frutas. Además Yene vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Yene necesita un préstamo de 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas variadas.
Los sueños de Yene son tener una casa propia y tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Yene is a member of the Kutimuy community bank, which means "Return" in quechua. Yene lives with a partner. She is 28 years old and has two children. She sells wine, cane, products that she acquires in the city of Lima. She sells her products in the San Felipe fair where she also sells fruit and vegetables. In addition, Yene sells catalog cosmetics. Yene needs a loan of 450 soles which will be invested in the purchase of a variety of fruit. Yene's dreams are to have her own home and a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of a variety of fruit.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Kutimuy que significa Regresa en quechua.
Marcelina es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Marcelina se dedica a la compra y venta de tuna en época de producción, producto que compra de los productores y los lleva a la ciudad de lima en donde los comercializa, también compra tara y cochinilla que vende a los intermediarios. Además Marcelina brinda servicios de transporte con su carro.
Marcelina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos para su carro.
Los sueños de Marcelina son tener una tienda estable y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the Kutimuy -- which means "return" in quechua -- community bank. Marcelina lives with a partner, is 40 years old and has two children. Marcelina is dedicated to the purchase and sale of tuna (the exotic fruit, prickly pear), when it's in season. She buys from producers and takes the product to the city of Lima where she sells it. In addition, she purchases tara (a native shrub) and cactus which she sells to middlemen. In addition, Marcelina provides transportation services with her car. Marcelina needs a loan of 3,000 soles which will be invested in the purchase of tires for her car. Marcelina's dreams are to have a stable shop and that her children finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of tires for her car.

loans.name: Sere Pou Choche Group

texts.en:
The Sere Pou Choche Bank of Hope is made of 20 male and female entrepreneurs.
