After successfully repaying their first loan they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses with their second loan. There are five members of the Bank of Hope that will not be taking out another loan.

Delcame P. is one of four representatives of the group. He is a happily married father of two small children. The hardworking family man works with his wife to buy used clothing and footwear in the big city to sell in the rural areas. He often works with his wife to monitor the selling while he is able to purchase in the city, thus allowing the business to always be operating. He admits that times have been tough but the loan was a blessing. He says sending his six-year-old son to school is easier and even though the meals his family eats aren’t extravagant, they are consistent. He attributes the recent development in the area to the presence of Esperanza’s work in the area.

On behalf of Sere Pou Choche, Delcame, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothes in bulk, including sneakers, shoes, and sandals.

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: María Azucena C. E. tiene 43 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 5 hijos a su cargo. Hace más de 18 años que vende comida. Ya que cuando ella inicio este negocio fue, por cuenta propia para ayudar en los gastos de la familia y además sacar a su hijos adelante, por lo que desde muy joven aprendió este oficio, para que a sus hijos pudieran estudiar. María Azucena dio inicio con una pequeña mesa en las afueras del mercado, muy humildemente se levanta todos los días temprano en busca de las compras y además tiene que preparar los alimentos para llevarlos a ofrecer. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de carnes, aceite, arroz, frijoles, plátanos entre otras cosas. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Azucena C. E. is 43 years old. She is a married woman with 5 children in her care. She has been selling food for over 18 years. When she began this business on her own it was to help with the family expenses and to help her children get ahead, so she learned this profession at a young age so her children would be able to go to school María Azucena began with a small table outside the market. Humbly she would get up early every morning to shop and then she had to prepare the food to take and sell. The financing she seeks is to buy meat, oil, rice, beans, bananas, and more. Her wish is to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Marcelina

texts.es: María Marcelina Juárez O. tiene 47 años. Es casada, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Anteriormente se trabajaba en una empresa de conversión ocupacional. Por lo que no fue mucho el tiempo en el que se permaneció en este trabajo con el poco dinero que logro recaudar, decide incursionar en el negocio de ofrecer mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Y ha logrado mantenerla, ya que fue por medio de este negocio que sus hijos estudian. Además María tenía la facilidad de ofrecer sus productos porque ella  tenía muchas amistades y fue por ellos que logro adquirir cada día más clientes. El dinero que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, ropa interior camisetas, pantalones y faldas. Su deseo es mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old. She is married and cares for 2 sons. Previously, she worked in an occupational conversion business. She didn’t stay long in this job due to the little money she earned, and she decided to get into the business of selling general merchandise. She has been in this business for more than 6 years. As a result of her success, her sons can continue with their schooling. Maria has been able to sell her products successfully because she has many friends, and through them she adds more customers each day.

Maria is applying for a loan for working capital which she will use for the purchase of footwear, underwear, T-shirts, pants and skirts. Her desire is to improve her family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mollecito De Covadonga Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mollecito De Covadonga es un banco nuevo que inicia su primer ciclo con 11socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de ropa, abarrotes, frutas, comida, animales menores, brindan servicios de trasporte.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, haciendo un total de 4,200 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, ropa, animales menores.

Los sueños de las socias son mejorar su negocio, superarse como persona y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Mollecito de Covadonga," is a new bank that is starting it's first loan with eleven members. The members have different businesses like selling clothing, groceries, fruit, food, small animals, and offering transportation services. The members need loans in different amounts like 300 and 450 PEN, which all total to 4,200 PEN for the communal bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, clothing, and young animals. The members' dreams are to improve their businesses and themselves and to see their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, clothing, and small animals

loans.name: Mxima Audely

texts.es: Máxima Audely García Martínez tiene la edad de 43 años. Es madre soltera. Ella ha logrado darles a 2 hijos la educación necesaria. Su actividad económica es la venta de comida. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este humilde oficio. Anteriormente su Mama se dedicaba a este negocio, y fue algo que ella aprendió desde niña. Más tarde Máxima decide hacerse cargo muy contenta atiende a sus clientes para proporcionarles lo mejor, además Máxima está luchando muy fuerte porque además quiere dedicarse a vender ropa. Por lo que así podría aportar más ingresos para su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos. El sueño de Máxima es asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Máxima Audely García Martínez is 43 and a single mother. She has succeeded in giving her two children the education that they need. She sells food for a living and has done this for more than 9 years. Her mother used to have a business like this, so it is something that she learned how to do when she was a young girl. Later on, Máxima decided to run the business, and she is very happy attending to her customers so she can offer them the best. Máxima also works very hard because she also wants to sell clothing so she can have more income for her family. The financing she is requesting is for working capital so she can buy basic grains. Her dream is to secure her children's future.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amparo De La Concepcion

texts.es: Amparo de la Concepción B. tiene 48 años. Es una mujer trabajadora. Amparo trabaja desde muy joven, pues su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo. Ya que es el único oficio que conoce y que le ha generado ganancias. Algunas veces recorre lugares muy lejano por buscar el cerdo que le ofrecen a un buen precio. Amparo tiene los deseos de mejorar su establecimiento pues es aquí donde ofrece sus productos. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos y algunos utensilios.
texts.en:
Amparo de la Concepción B. is a 48-year-old hard-working woman. Amparo has worked since she was very young, and she butchers pigs for a living. This is the only work she knows and it has generated profits for her. Sometimes she travels long distances to find pigs for a good price. She has dreams of improving her location because it is where she sells her products. The money she is requesting is for working capital so she can buy pigs and tools.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eddy Alfredo

texts.es: El Señor Eddy Alfredo A. Cáceres  vive en su propia casa con su esposa. Tiene un taller de soldadura en su vivienda, por lo que  muchos clientes lo visitan por el buen servicio que le ofrece, Eddy se gana la vida desde muy joven, ya que tenía muchas responsabilidades y con lo que ganaba ayudando en un taller de soldadura, logro terminar sus estudios, pero más tarde decide establecer su propio negocio. Eddy es hombre muy responsable y un buen cliente, además genera fuente de trabajos para 2 personas que lo ayudan. El crédito que solicita es para capital de trabajo es para materiales de soldaduras. Su deseo es ofrecer un mejor servicio y permanecer con su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Eddy Alfredo A. Cáceres lives in his own home with his wife. He has a welding shop in his home, and many customers visit him because of the good service he offers. Eddy has supported himself since he was very young since he had a lot of responsibilities. He used what he earned helping out in a welding shop to finish school. He later decided to start his own business. Eddy is a very responsible man and a good client. He also provides jobs for two people that help him. The credit he is requesting is for working capital so he can buy welding materials. His dream is to offer better service so he can keep his business going for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jairo Rolando

texts.es: Jairo Rolando Álvarez M. tiene 36 años de edad. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. El Señor Jairo comenzó este negocio con capital propio, junto con su esposa lucha para que su pequeño negocio siga adelante. Jairo se levanta por las mañanas a comprar los productos que son necesarios para la pulpería sus clientes recurren a su pulpería por la gran sonrisa que les espera. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos y golosinas. Sus aspiraciones son de engrandecer su negocio para propiciarle a su familia el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Jairo Rolando Álvarez M. is 36 and has 3 children. She has owned a small grocery store for more than 5 years. Jairo started this business with his own money, and he and his wife fight to progress their small business. Jairo gets up in the morning to buy the products he needs for his grocery store. His customers frequent it because of the big smile that waits for them. The financing he is requesting will go towards working capital to buy basic grains, soft drinks, juice, and candy. His dreams are to expand his business so he can provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Mercedes del Socorro Ríos tiene la edad de 35 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos y estudian. Mercedes tiene un buen ánimo y espíritu de salir adelante esto fue lo que la motivo a dedicarse a ofrecer productos de medicinas naturales. Desde que inicio ha logrado acaparar la atención de sus clientes, pues algunas veces sus clientes recurren a su casa de habitación, solicitando consejos de los productos que ella ofrece, por lo que ella les dedica la atención personalizada que se merecen. Con este financiamiento comprara productos omnylife que es la casa comercial que distribuye estos productos. Sus sueños son de comprar su propia casa para que sus hijos tengan donde dormir el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 35 years old. She is a single mother with two sons in school.. Mercedes has a good mind and a forward-looking spirit which motivated her to sell natural medicines. Since beginning the business she has succeeded in grabbing the attention of her customers. Sometimes her customers come to the house she lives in asking for advice about the products she sells. She gives them the personalized attention they deserve.

With this financing she will buy Omnilife products from a commercial distributor. Her dream is to buy her own house so that her sons have somewhere to sleep in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles O. tiene la edad de 57 años. Es una mujer casada. Su actividad económica es la ofrecer los servicios de costura. Hace más de 41 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que sus inicios surgen por cuenta propia, por lo que tenía que buscar un medio de supervivencia. Para su familia, María tiene varios financiamientos con Fundación León 2000 y en su mayoría han favorecido su negocio. Por lo que ahora solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima para su taller de costura. Su deseo es salir adelante cada dia.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles O. is 57 years old. She is married. She has a seamstress business. She has had this business for 41 years. She needed to find a way of making a living, so she started the business on her own. María has had several loans through Fundación León 2000 and most of them have been favorable for her business. She is now requesting a loan for working capital to buy materials for her sewing shop. Her hope is to get ahead each day.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Desde hace 10 años, en la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua, la señora Agustina M. posee su negocio de pulpería el cual atiende con mucho esfuerzo en su propia casa de habitación siendo visitada por varios clientes que buscan los productos tanto comestibles como productos del hogar que ella vende. 

Con el propósito de suplir sus estantes, la señora Agustina ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos comestibles y los productos del hogar para ofertarlos en su pulpería y de esta manera satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
For ten years, in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, Mrs. Agustina has owned a grocery store, which she has maintained with great effort, in her own house. Her store is visited by many customers that are looking for products such as groceries or things for the home. With the hope of stocking the shelves of the store, Mrs. Agustina looks to “Ceprodel” to request a loan to buy groceries and products for the home. She will offer these for sale in her grocery store in a manner that will satisfy her customers

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María D. se dedica a su actividad de venta de productos comestibles y productos del hogar ofrecidos en su pulpería ubicada en la ciudad de León donde atiende a sus clientes que le visitan para realizar las compras.

Ella ha decidido invertir en las compras de los productos y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito  ya que requiere la compra de los comestibles y de los productos del hogar para salir adelante mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana María D. sells food and home products in her small grocery store, which is located in the city of León and this is where she tends to her customers who come to make their purchases. She has decided to invest in buying merchandise, so she has turned to Ceprodel to request a loan. She needs to buy food and home products so that she can improve living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Simona Alicia

texts.es:
Simona G. es una dama que a raíz de sus grandes esfuerzos se ha dedicado a mantener su negocio de pulpería la cual es atendida por ella misma en la ciudad de León donde tiene muchos deseos de desarrollar su negocio ampliándolo y brindando buenas condiciones para su desarrollo.

Hoy en día, ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de mercadería tales como comestibles para ofertarlos en su localidad y así salir obtener mejores ingresos en su negocio para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Simona is a woman that, because of her great efforts, has dedicated herself to maintaining a grocery store. She works at the store that is located in the city of Leon. She has a many desires to expand her business. This will provide good conditions for its development. Today she looks to “Ceprodel” to request a loan in order to buy merchandise such as groceries that she will offer in her neighborhood. In this way she will obtain a better income from her business. This will allow for its development

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es: Ezequiel Hernández R. tiene 32 años de edad. Hace 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de pinturas y enderezado. Ezequiel empezó como ayudante en un taller, por lo que fue aprendiendo muy bien este oficio, Ezequiel tiene mucho carisma para atender a sus clientes, por lo que decide establecer su propio negocio, y así con la ayuda de su familia han logrado mantener este negocio, por lo que su mayor desafío es que cada día hay mucha gente en este negocio, pero todo depende de la muy buena administración. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materiales de pinturas automotrices, y otros productos utilizados en su taller. Su deseo es acondicionar su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Ezequiel Hernández R. is 32 years old and has been in business for 6 years. He provides paint and auto body repair services. Ezequiel began as an assistant at another shop where he learned this line of work. He is very charismatic and enjoys dealing with customers, which is why he decided to go into business for himself. His family has helped him maintain the business, but he says the greatest challenge is dealing with too many people and that success lies in having good administration skills.

The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase automotive paints and other products used in his workshop. His desire is to upgrade his business so that he can provide better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: La Señora Marta Isabel Martínez S. tiene la edad de 53 años. Es madre soltera. Su actividad económica es venta de comida. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que anteriormente era su Mama quien se hacía cargo de esta actividad, por lo que ella ayudaba en la elaboración de la comida. Y así fue como fue instruyéndose en esta actividad. Ya que algunas veces ella salía a vender a las calles para obtener más ganancia. Por lo que Martha tenía problemas pues ella no logro terminar sus estudios. Pero con este negocio obtuvo lo necesario para vivir. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, pollo y verduras. El deseo de Martha es poseer su propio local para prestar mejores servicios al consumidor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Isabel Martínez S. is a 53 year old single mother. She has been selling food for 4 years. Her mother had been in the same line of business, so she helped with the food preparation while learning about the business at the same time. She occasionally sold her products in the streets in order to earn more money.

Due to some setbacks, Martha was not able to complete her studies. However, her business was enough for her to make a living. Her loan will be used as working capital to buy rice, beans, oil, chicken and vegetables. Martha hopes to have her own restaurant where she can better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta A. A. tiene la edad de 40 años. Es una madre soltera. Tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Modesta es una pulpería. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, por lo que al iniciar con este negocio no fue fácil, por lo que tenía que cuidar a sus hijos y velar por la condiciones de vida de la familia, es por eso que decide iniciar con muy poco capital, pero con esto logra comprar unos pequeños estantes para colocar las golosinas, y así fue que logra obtener clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, detergente entre otras cosas. su deseo es de acondicionar su pulpería con mucho mas productos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Modesta A. A. is a 40 year old single mother of 3 children, all of whom are students. She operates a small grocery store out of her home and has been in business for over 21 years. Starting her business wasn’t easy – she still had to look after her children and take care of the family’s living situation. With very little capital, she bought a few racks of candy and started attracting customers.

The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, detergent and other items. She hopes to expand her grocery store so that she can offer more products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Isaura

texts.es: María Isaura R. C. tiene la edad de 41 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. María inicio ofreciendo sus productos visitando a algunas amistades, por lo que con la ayuda de ellos fue que logro obtener popularidad para vender sus productos, ya que tuvo que recorrer distancias mucho más larga, algunas veces recorría municipios, pero lo hacía con la esperanza de que a sus hijos no les faltara el pan de cada día. Por lo que el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de calcetines, camisas, pantalones y toallas. Su deseo es comprar un lugar que facilite las condiciones para ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Isaura R. C. is a 41 year old single mother of 2 dependent children. She has been selling clothing for more than 3 years. María started offering her products while visiting friends. With their help, she managed to obtain a following for her line of products. María has to travel great distances, even into the cities, as part of her job. She does this with the hope that her children won’t go hungry. The loan she is requesting is for working capital to purchase socks, shirts, pants and towels. She hopes to buy a suitable place where she can offer her products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita L. is a 56-year-old woman, married to Rodolfo L., with two children. Her eldest child is still studying in college and her youngest is a computer programming undergraduate who works as a computer programmer and a sales boy in a private computer shop in town. Her husband has been her partner for life in the business. Rodolfo is the one that managed the business and Rita manages their finances.

Rita joined ASHI in 1999 because she wished to have her own business. Through ASHI she was able to acquire capital to start up a business which she and her husband chose. Rita’s husband is skilled and well experienced in repairing and vulcanizing vehicle tires, therefore Rita thought that doing this kind of business would not require any more training. As years went on, Rita’s loan in ASHI grew from Php5,000 to Php30,000 in her most recent loan. She expanded her business as well, however, it is not as big as she expects and is not earning as much as she imagined due to frequent electric power interruptions. There were times when the interruption lasted for several weeks, especially when there is a typhoon.

Rita knew that only if they have their own electric generator, can their business continue its operation even if the whole town suffers from electric power interruption. Hence, Rita applied for a loan from ASHI. After using the generator and seeing improvements in her business income generation, Rita will borrow a bigger amount to improve their vulcanizing shop and purchase more necessary machines for the business. Rita also wants to have more supplies of vehicle tires to sell to her customers.

Aside from Rita’s business managed by her husband, she is also into a buy and sell business. This is how she makes her weekly payments for her loan from ASHI. Rita is so much happy to have her own business to run and a business that her family is having. She hopes that her vulcanizing shop will grow further and will be successful for this has been her family’s cup of tea and bread for long time.

loans.use: To purchase a generator and vehicle tires for selling.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis tiene 62 años, es viuda, vive en su casa propia con el menor D. su hijo D. 14 años. DesD. hace18 años se dedica a la costura D. faldas y fustanes típicos D. su zona, su principal herramienta D. trabajo es su máquina D. coser que tiene desD. hace muchos años atrás. Lo bueno es que su trabajo lo realiza todos los días en la comodidad D. su casa, generalmente por las mañanas, ya que por las tardes cuida D. sus animales. Su hijo la apoya en la comercialización D. las faldas y las reparte a domicilio como un servicio adicional para sus clientes. El deseo D. Gladis es aumentar su producción para incrementar sus ganancias. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y quiere ser una socia muy comprometidas que vele por el bienestar común D. su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra D. tela para confeccionar mayor variedad D. diseños D. faldas.
texts.en:
Gladis is 62 years old, a widow, and lives in a house she owns with her son’s youngest child who is 14 years old. For 18 years, she has dedicated herself to sewing skirts and petticoats typical of her region. Her main tool is her sewing machine, which she has had for many years. The good thing is that she can realize her work, every day, from the comfort of her own home. She generally sews in the mornings, so that she can use the afternoon to tend to her animals. Her son helps her with the selling of her skirts, and delivers them to their customers’ homes as an added service. Gladis’ wish is to augment her production of her product, so she can increase her earnings. This is the first time she is taking a loan through MFP, and she wants to be a reliable member who contributes toward the overall well-being of her cooperative bank. The funds she is requesting will be destined for buying fabrics to make a greater variety of skirt designs.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Isael

texts.es: Isael tiene 30 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 6 años en su casa propia. Se dedica a las tareas agrícolas desde niño, ya que proviene de una familia netamente agricultora. En la actualidad siembra papa y maíz para el consumo familiar y para comercializar cultiva la alfalfa, la cual vende en la plaza de su localidad, asimismo alquila los surcos de sus chacras a sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene ingresos económicos extras. Como este trabajo no requiere de mucho tiempo durante la siembra y crecimiento de los productos, Isael aprovecha para ofrece su labor como albañil. Para un futuro cercano, desea adquirir más extensiones de terreno para seguir sembrando alfalfa y tener mayores ventas. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, es su primera experiencia de trabajo en un banco comunal y su compromiso es de ser una persona colaboradora para el desarrollo de su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado en la compra de fertilizantes y para mejorar algunas estructuras de su casa.
texts.en:
Isael is 30 years old, and lives in a house he owns with his wife and 6-year old son. He has dedicated himself to agricultural activities since he was a youth, given that he comes from a farming background. Currently, he plants potato and corn for his family’s consumption. He also grows alfalfa, which he sells in his town’s plaza. Concurrently, he leases sections of his farmlands to neighbors, which generates additional income. Isael takes advantage of the fact that there is less work to be done during his crops’ planting and growing stages by offering his services as a construction worker. In the near future, he would like to acquire more land to continue planting alfalfa and increase his sales. This is the first time he takes a loan with MFP as well as his first experience working with a cooperative bank. His promise is to work collaboratively to help his group progress. The funds that he requests will be destined for purchasing fertilizers and to make improvements to some of the structures of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan M. is a 46-year-old woman and is a single parent of four children. Susan remained strong and determined to raise her children and give them better life when her husband left her. She joined ASHI in 1999 and the loan she received from the institution was her capital to start up a business. She had been doing many different kinds of businesses until then just to have an income to sustain the needs of her children. Her eldest child is a college undergraduate and is presently unemployed. Her second child is a high school graduate and was not able to pursue his college degree. Instead he worked as a laborer and supports Susan financially now. Susan’s third child is in high school and her youngest is graduating in elementary this year.

Susan’s primary business now is buying and selling of herbal medicines and cosmetics. She sells them directly in different municipalities of the province. At times she also sells food in the neighborhood and even in offices within the municipality where she lives. To enhance further this business, Susan applied for a loan from ASHI. The amount she borrowed is the same as her previous loan, based on her capacity to pay and the needs of her business. Presently, Susan continues saving her profit for emergency needs of her business and children. She hopes that her children who are still in school will be able to graduate from college.

Susan has been a very good member of ASHI and a strong woman. She cares for her children and her group and center.

loans.use: Cosmetics, herbal medicines, and food for selling.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William tiene 29 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años cría ganado vacuno, específicamente toros, los cuales vende en las ferias ganaderas y a los más robustos los mantiene permanentemente para darlos en alquiler como toros para el arado, de esta manera obtiene los ingresos económicos necesarios para su familia. Dedicarse a la ganadería ha sido más beneficioso que la agricultura, pues las ganancias son con mayor frecuencia y con menos riesgo de pérdida. Para el futuro, William planifica tener un establo bien equipado para albergar a mayor cantidad de animales. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy entusiasmado por trabajar en su banco comunal, donde como nuevo integrante se compromete a ser muy activo y a aportar para el desarrollo común. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de  un torete para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
William is 29 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a house they own. He has been raising livestock for 2 years, specifically bulls, that he sells at the livestock markets. He keeps the larger bulls to lease out for plowing and, this way, generate the necessary income for his family. Dedicating himself to livestock has been more beneficial than farming, given that earnings are generated more frequently and there is less risk of loss. For the future, William plans to have a well-outfitted stable where he can house a greater number of animals. This is his first loan through MFP. He is very enthusiastic about working with his cooperative bank where, as a new member, he promises to be very active and work towards the common good of the members. The funds he is requesting will be destined for buying a bull and to increase his working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Los Girasoles De Compone Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal se denomina “LOS GIRASOLES DE COMPONE”, Este banco comunal está conformado por 18 miembros, los que viven en el distrito de Anta.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades con la agricultura y la ganadería, ellos llevan años con esta actividad, la que les rinde económicamente, los socios compran y crían ganados vacunos y ovino, ellos los hacen engordar y los venden, o también sacan los derivados de la leche para la venta, de igual modo son dueños de tierras donde cultivan, la papa y sus diferentes variedades, el maíz, las verduras, cebadas, trigo y otros. Por esta razón nuestros socios desean el préstamo para poder reinvertir en sus diferentes actividades.

Los socios agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago total de sus deudas.
texts.en:
This community group is called "LOS GIRASOLES DE COMPONE". This community bank is made up of 18 members that all live in the district of Anta.

Our members alternate their activities between agriculture and farming, and they have been doing this for many years. They do well financially and the members buy and raise young cows and sheep, fattening them and selling them as well as selling dairy products from their milk. They are the owners of the land where they cultivate potato and its different varieties, maize, vegetables, wheat and barley among other things. For this reason our members need a loan to reinvest in their different activities.

Our members are grateful for the loans given to them in this way, and they are committed to repaying their total debt in full.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals, seeds, and young animals in bulk/Comprar animales mayores, semillas, animales menores.

loans.name: Amarzaya

texts.en:
Amarzaya C. is 31 years old and single. She lives with her 9-year-old daughter and younger sister in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her daughter is a 4th grade student in a local secondary school.

Amarzaya has a small-scale convenience store situated in front of the local high school. She sells various food items, including snacks, chewing gums, soft-drinks, etc., at her store. Most of her customers are high school students. She started this small-scale food retail business in early 2008 and she has been doing well since then.

In the future, Amarzaya hopes to expand her retail business by offering more variety of food products that students like to buy. She says that she aims to save some money for her daughter from the business profits. Her dream is to see her daughter graduate successfully from a good university and pursue her dream. She requests a loan to purchase more food products for her food retail business.

loans.use: To purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Narmandah

texts.en:
Narmandah C. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and their youngest son in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Two of her daughters are college students in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Narmandah sells various secondhand accessories and parts for cars, trucks and motorcycles. She started the car accessories business with her husband when the first-ever black market for secondhand car accessories and parts opened in the town in the early 1990s. As many locals get rich enough to afford to buy cars, the market for car accessories and parts took off. While she sells the car products at the local market, her husband travels to Ulaanbaatar one to three times a month and brings back supplies for her business.

Narmandah’s business is the main source of income for the family. She says that she works hard with her husband to make sure that they are able to continue to support her children's education. She requests a loan to purchase more car spare parts and accessories for her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts at wholesale prices

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Tungalag D. is a 48-year-old single mother with two children. She lives with her 24-year-old daughter in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her son is a student in the Mongolian University of Science and Technology in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has a small retail business in pharmaceutical and beauty products. She rents a small stall at the local market and sells her pharmaceutical and beauty products. Depending on monthly sale amounts, she frequently travels to Ulaanbaatar and purchases more inventory products 2–3 times a month. She usually buys her products from Ulaanbaatar's wholesale markets. She aims to continue supporting her son's university education. She pays his tuition and living expenses with the business profit. Since her retail business is the only source of income for her family, she works very hard to meet all the financial obligations for her family as well as his son's education. She requests a loan to purchase more pharmaceutical and beauty products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic items at wholesale prices

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.en:
Nicasio S. is from the village of Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. He is 37 years old. Nicasio is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Nicasio owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari, or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products in the local community, such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc. Nicasio has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nicasio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicasio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nicasio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Inn

texts.en: Inn Y. is a married woman, 47 years old, who lives in the province of Siem Reap, in Cambodia. Here, she and her husband have been establishing their own small family and working as fishermen. This couple usually sells the fish that they catch in and around Tunle Sap Lake, and typically generate around $5 of income a day to contribute to feeding their six children, who are school-aged students. Two of their children work with them in fishing activities, which helps reduce the amount of hard physical labor. Inn Y. will be using her loan money to buy additional equipment for the purpose of fishing.

loans.use: To buy additional equipment for the purpose of fishing

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
There are four women who are jointly taking this loan. Mrs. Heng L., 30, has been chosen to be leader by the other group members.

Heng L. is a modest villager who earns her daily income by working as internal staff for a pure-water company. She is married with three children who are attending the local school. Her husband is a military policeman in the village. Because the family faces the fact that their house is cracking down frequently during heavy rains, Heng L. would like a loan in order to repair her old house.

The other three borrowers are:

Phi R. is age 57 and is a grocery seller who is asking for a loan to help increase her business capital.

Kon S. will be using her loan money to pay for repairing her house.

Toeuy B. sells porridge in the village and she requests a loan to repair her broken house.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Mirzomurod

texts.ru: Каримов Мирзомурод проживает в районе Шахринав. Возраст 49 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Мирзомурод более 15 лет работал строителем. В данный момент, он более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку, где торгует мясными изделиями. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mirzomurod K. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 49 years old, married and has 3 children. Mirzomurod used to work as a construction worker for over 15 years. Currently, he has been involved in sales for over 5 years. He has a store where he sells meat products. Client is requesting a loan to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Miss Sushila S. lives in Thikedewal which is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small businesses like grocery stores, small hotels, and stationery stores. 

Miss Sushila S. is engaged in her own small restaurant. She opens her restaurant to uplift the living standard of her family. Her mother also helps her in her restaurant.

She sells different types of food items in her shop. Especially, she sells Newari food in her shop because Newari food is very popular in this locality because the majority of the people in this region are Newars and Newari food is so delicious to eat. She also serves tea and coffee.

Now Sushila S. is requesting an Rs 15,000 loan to expand her business and to purchase necessary food materials.

loans.use: To expand her business and to purchase necessary food materials

loans.name: Abdusharif

texts.ru: Саломов Абдушариф проживает в районе Шахринава. Возраст 53 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Абдушариф более 27 лет работал крановщиком. Вот как более 5 лет начал свой бизнес. Он занимается торговлей, продает детские игрушки. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Abdusharif S. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 53 years old, married and has 5 children. Abdusharif spent 27 years working as a crane operator. He started his own business just over 5 years ago. He sells children’s toys. He is requesting a loan to increase his goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Narzikul

texts.ru: Умаров Нарзикул проживает в районе Шахринава. Возраст 54 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Нарзикул более 8 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном торгует продуктами питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота, а также прибыли.
texts.en:
Narzikul U. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 54 years old, married and has 5 children. Narzikul has been involved in sales for over 8 years. He primarily sells food products. He is requesting a loan to increase product turnover and profits.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Maiya S. is the owner of a small restaurant. She runs the restaurant with her daughter. Both Mrs. Maiya S. and her daughter equally contribute to the restaurant because they have no other source of income. They fulfill all the needs of family with the the income from the restaurant.

They sell different types of food items in their shop. Especially they sell Newari food in their shop because the demand for Newari food is increasing because Newari food is very delicious to eat. They also serve tea and coffee in their restaurant.

Now Mrs. Maiya S. is requesting her second loan of Rs 15,000 to expand her business and to purchase necessary food material for her business. She has cleared her previous loan. With her first loan she was able to purchase more food items and, since that time, her business has increased.

loans.use: to buy food materials for her little restaurant

loans.name: Yean's Group

texts.en:
There are three low-income people who have decided to join this loan group. Its leader, Yean S., is 31. Yean S. currently retails fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing. She also buys fish from other fisherman to continue selling when her customers still need more fish. She normally makes around US$ 3 in profit each day to be responsible for her family’s daily food.

Yean S. has given birth to three children who are now secondary students. Yean S. is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase more implements for fishing purposes.

The other group members who have joined are:

Srey S. who will use the loan to upgrade the size of her fish shop; and

Yean S. who will use her loan to purchase a bicycle which she will use to transport fish to the market for sale.

loans.use: to  buy fishing implements

loans.name: Reshma

texts.en:
Reshma M. is the owner of a small vegetable shop. She opened her vegetable shop a year ago to uplift the standard of living of her family. She sells green and non-green vegetables in her shop. She buys the vegetables from Kalimati which is one of the famous wholesale vegetable bazaars of the Kathmandu valley. She has already taken out a first loan and has cleared her loan. With her first loan she was able to raise the income from her shop.

Now Mrs. M. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 15,000 to buy various types of vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, onions etc. for her shop.

Mrs. M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two daughters. Her older daughter is studying in grade 2 and her younger daughter is only 20 months old. She wants to provide good education for her daughters but in Nepal the cost of good education is very high.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her shop

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Sabitri T. is a resident of Thikedewal. Thikedewal is located in Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in small business.

Mrs. Sabitri T. has five members including herself in her family. Her husband Mr. Brij man T. is an electrician. She has one son and two daughters. Her son studies in higher secondary school. Her older daughter is studying in grade 9 and younger daughter is studying in grade 8.

Mrs. Sabitri T. is the owner of a cosmetics store. She opened her cosmetics store four years ago for her family to run. In her shop, she sells different types of cosmetics such as cream, lipsticks, glass bangles, beauty soap, etc. 
Nowadays the demand for cosmetics is increasing. So Mrs. T. is requesting an Rs 15000.00 loan to buy different kinds of cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of cosmetics

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanchi M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district and the majority of the people living in this region are Newars. 

Mrs. Kanchi M. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband is a driver and her son passed his SLC (School Living Certificate) exam this year and is hoping to join higher secondary school soon.

Mrs. M. opened her sandal shop a year ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells different types of shoes. Now she is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy different varieties of sandals for her shop.

loans.use: To buy different varieties of sandals

loans.name: Nucha Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Nucha Maiya M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in agriculture.

Mrs. M. lives with her two sons. A few years ago her husband, Tulshi lal, died, so she has sole responsibility for her family.  Both her sons have left their education due to lack of money. Now her older son drives a bus and her younger son is engaged in wood carving work. 

Mrs. M. and her younger son are engaged in wood carving work. They get carving work from the dealers. Now Mrs. M. is requesting an Rs 10000.00 loan to buy wood for her work.

loans.use: To buy wood for her work

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Sarswati K. has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 7 and her son is in grade 3. Her husband, Mr. Shiva Ram K., is an electrician.

Mrs. Sarswoti has already taken her first loan from Kiva and has repaid the loan. She used her first loan for her goat-raising work. Now she has applied for another loan of Rs 30,000 to invest in a cow-raising business. She ready owns one cow and she has been selling milk in her area. In Nepal pure, fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for human nutrition.

Sarswati K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati and in that area the demand for milk is constantly increasing. She carries her milk in containers and sells door-to-door daily, in the morning and in the evening. Because of the rising demand for milk, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production. Sarswoti plans to use her loan to purchase a Jersey cow which produces more milk than other cows.

loans.use: To buy a young milk-giving Jersey cow

loans.name: Minyura

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Минюра , женщина которая занимается откормом и продажей скота. Ей 43 года, у неё четвера детей, муж работает разнорабочим по строительныи делам.Минюра вместе с мужем ухаживает, откармливает скот.Минюра хочет получив кредит купить ещё пару голов коров, а также корм для них.Минюра работает техничкой в областной больнице.В день мониторинга она была на работе, поэтому на снимке её дочь.
texts.en:
Minyura feeds and sells cattle. She's 43 years old, has four children, and her husband takes on odd jobs as a builder. Minyura, together with her husband, take care of and feed cattle. Minyura hopes, upon receiving credit, to purchase a couple more cows as well as some feed for them. Minyura works as a cleaner in the regional hospital. On the day of the monitoring, she was at work, and therefore, her daughter is in the photograph.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: feed and sale of cattle

loans.name: Ambica

texts.en:
Ambica K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishepati. Sainbu-Bhaishepati is located in Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural work.
Mrs. Ambica K. is engaged in the goat raising business. She sells goats and goat milk in the local market. She already owns five goats and sells goat milk in the local market. Now she is requesting an Rs 30000.00 loan to buy baby goats for her business. She raises baby goats and sells them in the local market.
Mrs. Ambica K. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Ram Kumar Bhushal, is an electrician. She is the mother of one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 9 and her daughter is in grade 6.

loans.use: To buy baby goats

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Sangita B. lives in Bhatkepati Village. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and daughter. Her husband, Mr. Ram Kumar B., is in the Nepali army. Her daughter is studying in pre-primary school.

Mrs. B. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Bhatkepati. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop such as rice, maize, noodles, snacks and cold drinks. Her husband also helps her in the shop. 
Now Mrs. B. is requesting an Rs 10000.00 loan to expand her business by purchasing different varieties of grocery items for her shop.

Mrs. B. uses her income to provide a good education for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock

loans.name: Aman

texts.en:
Mrs. Aman T. is a resident of Tangal. Tangal is located in Lalitpur district. Tangal is one of the busy bazaars of Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in small business.
Mrs. T. lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, brother-in-law, sister-in-law and husband. Her husband, Mr. Sujan, is engaged in his own small business. 
Mrs. Aman opened her sandal shop in the footpath in Tangal. She opened her shop in the footpath market because she cannot afford to pay the high rent in the Tangal area. She sells different types of shoes in her shop. 
Now she is requesting an Rs 30000.00 loan to buy different kinds of sandals for her shop.

loans.use: To buy shoes for her shop

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mrs. Mina S. is a grocery shopkeeper in the Town of Thecho. She opened her shop a year ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells in her shop different types of grocery goods like rice, bitten rice, maize, and snacks.

Due to the poor economic condition of her family she cannot invest in her business so she is unable to fulfill the demands of her customers So Mrs. S. is requesting an Rs. 20,000 loan to buy different varieties of grocery items for her shop.

Mrs. S. lives with her husband, one son, a daughter-in-law and one grandson. Her husband, Mr. Sunil S., is employed in a private office.

Mrs. S. wishes to use her income to provide better education for her grandson and to help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: To buys grocery items for her store

loans.name: Forkland Group

texts.en:
Hawa R., age 32, is married with two children aged 14 and 10 years. She has had a grocery business since 2008 and also sells food and chips in the same place. She works from 7 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of around $190.
 
This will be Hawa’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants a loan to improve on the place where she does her business.

Hawa will share this loan with her group, Forkland, which totals 21 members. The members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Hawa is in the middle in a blue and white dress, front row.

loans.use: To improve on the place where she does business

loans.name: Bimarziya

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Бимарзия уже шестой год кредитуется для расширения бизнеса откорма и продажи скота.Она на каждый полученный кредит обнавляет свой домашний скот.В основном у неё быки и коровы.за кредитный период она смогла расширить хлев где она смотрит скот.У неё сейчас три коровы и пара баранов.На следующий займ она планирует купить ещё пару бычков. В день мониторинга Бимарзии не было дома, поэтому на снимке её муж.На предыдущих фото Бимарзия была всегда сама.
texts.en:
For six years now, Bimarziya has been taking out loans in order to expand her business of feeding and selling cattle. With each loan, she has purchased new cattle for her herd. Mostly, she has bulls and cows. With one loan, she was able to expand the barn where she feeds her cattle. She now has three cows and a couple of sheep. With the next loan, she plans to purchase a couple of bulls. On the day of the monitoring, Bimarziya wasn't home, therefore, her husband in the photo. Bimarzia was always in the previous photos.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: feeding and sale of cattle

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Salma M. from Mwanza. She is married, with five children between the ages of 5 and 11 years old.

Salma has been running a café business since 2008. Her business is called Café/Mama Lishe. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces.

Salma works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. She currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase potatoes and wheat flour. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Salma thanks you for your support!


About SELFINA: 
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and wheat flour

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Farida O. from Mwanza. She is divorced, with three children between the ages of 14 and 19 years old.

Farida has been running a soda business since 2007. It is said that Pepsi is one of the most recognized symbols in the world, and it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of shop selling Coke, Fanta, and Guinness. The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing - a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture.

Farida works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week and currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to purchase more soda to sell to her customers. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Farida thanks you for your support!


About SELFINA: 
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more soda to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мавлюда женщина , которая кредитуется уже пятый год.Она берёт кредит на бизнес откорма и продажи скота.Мавлюда очень ответственная и пунктуальная .Она очень рада кредитоваться в организации, её устраивают условия Арванда.На следующий кредит она хочет купить ещё пару молодых коров.
texts.en:
Mavluda has been our client for the fifth year already. She obtains loans for her business of feeding and selling livestock. Mavluda is very responsible and punctual. She is very happy to be financing with our organization, and she likes Arvand terms. She wants to use her next loan to purchase one more pair of young cows.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a pair of young cows

loans.name: Norily

texts.en:
Norily is the 39-year-old mother of a boy, and the proprietor of a variety retail store. Her husband is a security guard but also helps part-time with the growing business operation through lending a hand in the business's logistics. They are partners not only in marriage, but also in business. Their family of three lives in a small urban area in the mountains of Montalban.

Norily's business is a retail variety store, selling basic goods and commodities such as rice, charcoal, and other grocery items to a poor community. "We are very happy to help the people. Sometimes they have no money for the day so we give them their needs anyway and ask them to pay it within the week," says Norily.

The business started in 1999 as a small store with a few packs of noodles and canned goods and now has expanded to even distributing government rice to the community. "The store's best asset, I guess, is its rice distribution. So many families in our area need food on their tables, but some can't afford to buy commercial rice because it is expensive (P30 per kilo). And it is just a great privilege for us to offer help by being a government rice distribution center." The government's social welfare department chose Norily's store as a distribution center to the poor in their community.

Having been a great help to the urban poor community in their town, they now plan to also expand their market by catering to the middle class residents in their area. They are hoping to open a balloon and party-needs business. They need around P50,000 to start the business, and have applied for a medium business loan from Center for Community Transformation (CCT).

Their recent loan with CCT, their 11th loan, amounted to P45,000 which put their retail store in a firm financial position. They never missed a loan and savings payment. 


About CCT
CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions.

loans.use: To invest in a new business: balloons and party needs

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Neema M. from Mwanza. She is married and has three children between the ages of 2 and 4 years old. Neema has been running a cosmetics business since 2007. She works at the business for 7 hours per day, 12 days per week. Neema currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase cosmetics in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Neema thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou F., 43, is wife to SPO2 Jeffrey F., 37, a law enforcer.  They have 5 children, 2 of whom are studying.  They live in Phase 1 of Barangay Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.  

Marilou manages a variety store where she sells grocery items and rice.  She also rents out 3 video-karaoke machines. Her combined income from the store and karaoke machines is PHP 1,000 per day.   

She has been in this business for 4 years.  After her first year of successful business, she joined the Center for Community Transformation.  Her current loan with CCT is PHP 17,000, which she used to purchase more grocery inventory and rice, as seen in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and rice.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn E., 39, owns a small eatery along the side streets of their community. Her store is located very near a local health center, so she caters to most of the centers' clients as well. Her husband, Rolando, 43, helps in their business by selling wood and charcoal for fuel (instead of expensive petrol gas). They also use wood and charcoal for their food business.

They live in Phase 7C, Package 7, Bagong Silang, Caloocan City. They have 4 children. 2 are currently enrolled in high school and the other 2 are in grade school. Their earnings go towards the children's education and the rest cover their family's basic daily needs.

Marilyn is on her 4th loan cycle with CCT. Her current loan is PHP 10,000. Part of her loan proceeds was used to purchase new pots and pans for her food business. She is looking into expanding her food business due to the increase in daily human activities in their area.

loans.use: To purchase cooking utensils and towards children's school fees.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Anna K. from Mwanza. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 4 months and 8 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because his parents did not take care of him. Anna has been running a clothing and shoes business since 2006. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Anna currently earns about 210 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Anna thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial status and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloths in bulk.

loans.name: Cristinita

texts.en:
Cristinita M., 49, is the tireless community leader of their fellowship group. Her husband Ricardo, also 49 years old, has been her business partner for years. They have 3 children and live in Barangay 176, Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.

Cristinita has a home-based department store. She brings home items from big supermarkets and department stores and sells them to her neighbors at affordable prices. She regularly joins auctions organized by mall operators and buys items, ranging from designer clothes to household grocery items, at fairly low prices. She also owns a rice retail store and the newest addition to her business, a community pharmacy, where she sells purely generic medicines the poor can afford.

She earns PHP 20,000 monthly from the combined operations of all her business activities. Her newly opened community pharmacy is where a large portion of her latest loan, amounting to PHP 34,000, was invested.  She's currently allotting part of their savings towards the renovation of their house.

CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions.

loans.use: purchase supplies for her drugstore, the newest addition to her enterprise.

loans.name: Elieth

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!  This is 25-year-old Elieth T. from Mwanza. She is married and has one child who is seven years old. Elieth has made a living running a flower shop since 2006. She works at this business for six hours a day, seven days per week and is assisted by one employee. Elieth currently earns about $200 a month from her business, and is applying for a loan of $400 to buy more flowers to resell to her customers. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Elieth thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more flowers to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane E., 40, lives with her husband Jose, 47, and their three children in the hilly portion of Phase 1, Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.  Jose makes a living as a taxi driver, and all of their children are in school.

Jane, as she is fondly called by her friends, makes a living selling cosmetics and shoes. She buys items from prominent providers in cash so that she can take advantage of rebates, and sells them to customers with payments due weekly or bi-monthly.

She joined CCT last year and is now on her third loan.  She used her most recent loan to build up her inventories.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and shoes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Stela

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Stela D. from Mwanza. She is married and has five children, who are between the ages of 9 and 15 years old. Since 2000, Stela has made a living running a grocery store where she sells  onions, tomatoes, chilli and cabbages. It is the kind of place that local people send their children running to when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and need a missing ingredient.

She works at this business for six hours per day, seven days per week. Stele earns about $100 a month from her business, and is requesting a loan of $200 to buy bananas, tomatoes and cabbages. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Stela thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy bananas, tomatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Rosemary Mshumbus from Mwannza. She is married and supports one dependent who is an orphan. Rosemary has run a beauty saloon since 2008 -- a place where customers can come to buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, or hair in various colors, and then have it attached to their heads, woven, cut, or braided so that it looks like their own. She works at her business for seven hours per day, seven days per week, and earns about $240 a month. She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy hair, weaves and other items. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Rosemary thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy hair and other items for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa T., 53, has made a living an entrepreneur for the last six years. Her husband Dante, 56, works as a paper stripper for a prominent publishing house in Manila and they have three children, all but one of whom have finished their schooling.

Luisa manages a fairly large variety store which started as a small stall but now features many different kinds of products, including a small snack cart. She also makes peanut butter, which she sells to her neighbors and nearby stores.

She used a recent loan to build up her store's inventories and expand it to include school supplies and "mami", a local hot-pot noodle soup.

Ma. Luisa is the coordinator for Fellowship-5, one of CCT's pioneer community groups, which she joined in 2004.  CCT is a Filipino family-oriented, Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell from her variety store

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita G. is the business owner of a tailoring shop that makes traditional Nepali clothing such as the sari and the kurta-salwar. She has two employees in her shop who help her to meet her regular orders.

Sita’s husband is currently employed as a taxi driver and the couple have one son who is ten years old and currently in school.

Sita is applying for a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase new fabrics for her tailoring business. She traveled to the BPW Patan office (Kiva's field partner in Nepal) to apply for this loan and hopes to receive the loan amount at the group loan meeting in her district of Kulashwor at the end of the month.

Sita explained that because it is monsoon season right now, her business is a bit quieter than usual. The loan will help to tide her over and allow her to make many new items of clothing until the business picks up again after the monsoon season.

Sita is proud that she can make a contribution equal to her husband’s to her family’s expenses and looks forward to gradually expanding her business with the help of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase new fabric for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Christina M. from Mwanza. She is married with one child, 9 years old. Christina has been running a beauty salon since 2003. This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. Christina works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. She currently earns about 250 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase long hair, blue hair and red hair. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Christina thanks you for her support! About SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase long hair, blue hair and red hair

loans.name: Bella Rose Ann

texts.en:
Bella Rose Ann M., 19, is single and works as a hairdresser in an established salon in Concepcion, Marikina City. She was trained by the owner of the salon when she was 13 years old and has been working there up to the present. She receives a regular income of P300-P500 per day. 

Every Tuesday and Sunday, when she is on her day off, she has her own beauty care service, where she does home service for her established clients and where she earns as much as P1,500-P3,000 a day.

Now she is requesting her loan of P10,000 with Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She will use her loan to buy her own blower, manicure set, nail polish and chemicals for hair treatment and coloring. Bella hopes to put up her own salon in the near future.
