Bella has been a member of CCT for a year now. CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions.

loans.use: To buy her own blower, manicure set, nail polish and chemicals for hair treatment and coloring

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in her vegetable-growing business

loans.name: Kharka

texts.en:
Kharka K. T. owns and runs a restaurant with the support of her husband. The restaurant serves typical Nepali food such as dal bhat (a platter of lentils, rice and curries) as well as popular Tibetan and Chinese foods including momos (circular pieces of dough gathered around a filling and steamed) and chow mein (stir-fried noodles).

Kharka has two children: a son who is 21 years old and a daughter who is 18 years old. Both of her children are currently studying and still live in the family home.

Kharka is applying for a Kiva loan of Rs 15,000 which she will use to expand her restaurant business by purchasing a new variety of foods. Kharka has been running her restaurant for thirteen years and is excited to be making some adjustments to the business. 

Kharka travelled to the office of BPW Patan (Kiva’s field partner in Nepal) to apply for the loan and hopes to receive the loan at the next group meeting in her district of Kulashwor.

loans.use: To purchase food for the restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken food

loans.name: Modinot

texts.en: Modinot sells tailoring materials and weaves cloth for tailors. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase a weaving machine and tailoring materials. Modinot is 34 years old and married with two children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials

loans.name: Abidemi

texts.en: Abidemi is 34 years old and married with four children. She sells cellophane bags. Abidemi hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more cellophane bags to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more cellophane bags to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Feeling uncomfortable and discontented with the mediocrity of their life, 47-year-old Susana R. decided to venture into hog-raising and utilize their backyard for that business. While her husband continues farming, Susana also grows her small business to contribute in providing for their family's needs, especially for the education of their two children. Aside from this, the couple is looking forward to doing some house renovations in the future.

Initially, Susana joined the Community Economic Venture Inc. (CEVI), a growing micro-finance institution in the Philippines, with a plain hope to borrow Php 9,000 as additional capital. But she was surprised to gain more than that from CEVI. Her membership in this institution enables her to spend more time reading some biblical reflections and to share her learning with other members.

loans.use: additional pigs

loans.name: Francis Thomson

texts.en:
Francis is 37 years old and married. They have three children. He owns a welding shop located in Old Uganda Road at Road-Block estate in Eldoret town.

His seven-year-old business of buying, repairing, and painting metallic items has been fairly successful. He joined KADET to access a business loan so he can grow his business. He will do so by purchasing a variety of metallic goods like plates, tubes and welding rods.With the profit he gets from the business, Francis intends to better educate his children and feed and clothe his family.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within the communities.

loans.use: To buy welding rods, additional paints, metal plates, and steel tubes

loans.name: Celine

texts.en:
Celine was born in 1948 and is married to Fru Jacob N.. They are blessed with nine children, and they have three grandchildren younger than 15. She lives in Musang, Bamenda, Cameroon.

Celine's husband is old and ill. She has to be vigilant about feeding and cleaning him and giving him his medication on time. This is a serious duty which does not allow her to extend her activities too far from home. Egusi and firewood sales have been her main business activities since she joined GHAPE in October 27, 1998. She peels egusi seeds and sells them both in wholesale and in retail. She is one of the founding beneficiaries in GHAPE. With her previous loans she succeeded in providing her community with egusi and dry firewood.

If she is given this tenth loan, she plans to buy a transportation motorbike and well as stocking up on egusi and firewood. Her son will be providing transportation on the motorbike. She will also re-invest part of the profit into her business for expansion and she will pay school fees for her children. She will also use part of her profit for food, clothing, and paying hospital bills.

About the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE):

GHAPE is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and provides poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a transportation motorbike and to buy egusi and firewood for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a small greenhouse to raise flowers

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo sells drinks and pepper soup. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. Titilayo is 49 years old and married to A. who is a motor mechanic; they have three children. Titilayo says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mbonjum

texts.en:
Born in 1948, J. is married and is the father of seven children. He has been a struggling father who has made every effort to educate his children and provide for their needs and necessities. He has lost so many lives in the family: his mother and dad, brothers, and a sister. This has forced him to take on additional burdens in taking care of their children and grandchildren. Faced with the these challenges, the need arose for him to join a financial institution from which he could borrow money and help make ends meet. Encouraged by his friends, and fueled by the need for more capital for his business, he joined GHAPE. Since then, he has benefited immensely from the organization.

If he is approved for his fourth loan, J. plans to invest in the selling of beer and the rearing of pigs. More specifically, he will buy piglets, pigs, and pig feed. Experience has taught him how to manage a business like this. The business site is located in a very good area, and pigs are in high demand as their meat is used for many social occasions such as marriages and funeral ceremonies

. J. loves GHAPE because of the low interest and the social interactions among members.

About the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE):

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and provides poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of beer for sale as well as pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in her agriculture work

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake is 35 years old and married with three children. She styles and braids hair for her customers within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She also sells hair cream and hair extensions. Folake hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase styling creams and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more styling cream and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Nirala

texts.en:
Nirala S. is the business owner of a small chain of beauty products. Nirala makes creams and lotions that are used by beauticians when they give facials. Nirala makes all of her products with herbal ingredients and learnt her skill when she was working at a beauty clinic.

Nirala is requesting a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase new ingredients and packaging for her lotions and creams.

Nirala currently supplies to a number of beauty parlours in her community but with the help of a Kiva loan, she is hoping to expand her business and begin supplying to beauticians beyond her own community.

Nirala’s husband works in an office for the government. The couple have one adult son who is now married with a son of his own. The whole family live together and Nirala’s daughter-in-law helps Nirala with her beauty product business.

loans.use: purchasing ingredients to make facial products

loans.name: Mulira Faith’S Group

texts.en:
Faith is the leader of a 5-member group. She is a 45-year-old single mother of four, aged between 30 and 22. Only one of her children goes to school The rest are working because they finished school. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she is living with four people. Faith takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Faith resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Faith owns a poultry farm and sells in Nalukolongo, one of Kampala's suburbs. She uses public transport to and from shopping and does her shopping once a week. She sells to an average of 10 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week.

Faith sells mainly on a retail basis and her garage functions as her business premises. Her major monthly expenses include school fees for the remaining child, electricity and water bills She has been in this business for the last two years. Besides the poultry business, she also owns a telephone booth.

Faith has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more chicken feed. Faith is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises. .

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed

loans.name: Betty Kabuye’S Group

texts.en:
Hadjah is the leader of a 4-member group. She is a 52 years old and married with nine children aged between 15 and 33 years. Four of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she lives with seven people. There is electricity and piped water at her home and the family gets three meals a day.

Hadjah resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She deals in local gin in Bakuli, one of the Kampala suburbs and has been in this business for the last eleven years. She sells mainly wholesale and sells to an average of twenty people a day. She sells to adults, excluding children. She works six days a week. She uses public transportation to and from shopping from Kampala city and goes for shopping twice a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for the business premises.

Hadjah has been with MCDT for over seven years and is servicing her eighteenth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local gin and to pay school fees for her children at higher institutions of learning. Hadjah is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Olorunto

texts.en:
B. sells newspapers. She is a young vendor who believes that success is a result of hard work and, with this in mind, she is determined to pull her family out of poverty. She is 24 years old and married with a child. She lives in Lagos.

B. is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more newspapers to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more newspapers to sell

loans.name: Adedeji

texts.en: V. sells kerosene. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. As a widow with 3 children, life is not easy for her, she pays their school fees, feeds and clothes them. V. is 61 years old and she lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. V. is requesting for the loan amount of $950 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Babi Berna’S  Group

texts.en:
Berna is a leader of 4 members of the group.  She is a 33 year married woman with three children between 10 and 16 years old.  She rents a two room house where she is staying with six people (Berna takes care of additional family members). There is electricity but no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.  Berna is a poultry farmer in Bakuli, one of Kampala's suburbs. She uses public transport to and from shopping from Kampala and goes for shopping twice a week.  She sells to about 20 people a day, mainly women .She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees for her children.  She has been in this business for the last seven years. Berna has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. Besides poultry farming, Berna sells second-hand clothes at her home and is a property agent She wants to use this loan to buy more chicken feed and chicks. Berna aspires to see her business grow bigger and also to complete her house which will also work as her business place.

.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 50 years old and married with four children. She hopes for a $350 loan to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She started this business eight years ago. She says thank you and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Gbajumo

texts.en: O. is a fashion designer and clothes seller. She is business oriented. She has been in this business since the year 1991. O. is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She has been with LAPO for 2 years and lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. O. is requesting for a $950 loan to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials. She thanks you, the Kiva lender.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina is married with one child. She sells agriculture produce at two markets in Nikopol city and at several food markets in the greater area.
Katerina has been in this business for 5 years. She grew up in a village and is used to growing and selling vegetables and other produce. She offers good quality at reasonable prices and thus has many loyal customers. A few months ago she purchased a car to help her in sales. Katerina would like to borrow $1900 to increase the assortment. She enjoys being in this business for it enables her to provide for her family.

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Egamkul

texts.en:
A. Egamkul is a very loving father, devoted to the needs of his children, whom he adores. He works raising livestock and every morning leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. His desire is to improve the quality of his animals but in order to do this, he would need to purchase livestock of better breeds, and these animals are very costly. He needs a capital of 1000 USD, and at the moment he does not have that much money so he is requesting this loan. Egamkul hopes that you trust in his hard work and honesty.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Davlat

texts.en:
G. Davlat is 28 years old. Together with his wife he has three children. Davlat is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 4 years. He is baking the traditional bread, “lepeshka,” at home. His wife helps him with his business.

Having many customers, Davlat is selling the majority of his products just from his home. He is also running a stand in the central local market for selling ”lepeshka”. Now Davlat requests 5000 Somoni in order to purchase flour wholesale, as required for his business. Davlat is grateful for all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Purchasing flour  wholesale for  “lepeshka”

loans.name: Ogunreme

texts.en: J. sells dry gin (ogogoro) and herbs (traditional medicine) and she has been in this business for the past 19 years. J. lives in Lagos State. She is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more dry gin and herbs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more dry gin and herbs to sell

loans.name: Zokir

texts.en:
M. Zokir is 31 years old. He is married with 3 children. For more than 10 years, Zokir has been working at baking “lepeshka”- traditional bread. He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. He gets up early and bakes the lepeshka and other bread so that people have the fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. All the input materials like flour, salt, and yeast he purchases in the local market.

Now due to high demand, Zokir wants to increase the number of his breads he bakes so he is requesting a loan of 6500 Somoni. The loan will be spend for purchasing flour and charcoal for baking the “lepeshka”. Zokir deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour wholesale for baking  “lepeshka”

loans.name: Abdufato

texts.en:
S. Abdufato has been in the bakery business for 10 years. So that he could provide for his family, he started working as a trainee in one of the local bakeries at the age of 16. For one work shift that usually lasted 17 hours he was only paid 6 to 7 loaves of bread, which was not enough for his family.

He started looking for a space so he could open his own business. Once he found one, he started his own bakery. In the beginning, Abdufato was only baking special orders for weddings because he was short of cash. After a period of time, when he accumulated more funds, he started producing bread for sale in the market. Currently, his father and two hired employees are helping him in the business. Abdufato is asking for additional funding so that he can increase his production.

loans.use: Purchasing flour  wholesale for baking “lepeshka”

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.en:
Abdurashid is married with four children. He bakes and sells the traditional bread “lepeshka”. He has been in this business for 12 years already. Abdurashid decided to start this particular business because bread and bakery products are always in demand. His business is successful because he tries to offer his customers a large variety of fresh products.

Abdurashid's business goal is to open a small food store. Abdurashid would like to get a loan to purchase more products to be able to fulfill all the demand. Abdurashid hopes to increase sales and better provide for his family.

loans.use: Purchasing flour wholesale for baking  “lepeshka”

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.en:
H. Mamurjon is 39 years old. He is married with 3 children of school age. Mamurjon has been in the business of selling cows for over 12 years. He buys them from villagers and from the nearby province to raise for reselling to abattoirs and farmers. His wife has been a fruit seller for two years.

Mamurjon is requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni to purchase additional cows to raise for resale. This loan will allow him to better provide for his family.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Khursiyat

texts.en:
K. Khursiyat is the humble mother of a family with two children and she works hard to educate them. She has worked in agriculture, along with her husband, for 18 years, to generate the family’s income. They work hard at growing potatoes, carrots and other vegetables, which they sell in the market. Last season was very good, and after much effort, they achieved a big harvest. Her husband went the market to the sell the crop they had worked so hard on.

Currently Khursiyat’s family has a financial problem and she needs the help of all of us. The family’s desire is to continue planting their crop and increase their capital to be able to invest more in seeds and fertilizer. For this purpose, Khursiyat and her family are requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni, with which they would be able to improve their quality of life. Let’s help this family to remain strong and united.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
K. Bahrom is 25 years old and is married. He owns a shop in which he sells spare moped engine parts, a business he has been running for the last 8 years. The income he earns allows him to support his family, including his parents, too.

To meet his customers’ constantly growing demand, Bahrom would like to increase his shop’s capacity. The profits from these sales will allow him to continue to improve his living conditions. The loan will greatly improve Bahrom’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for mopeds

loans.name: Wafic

texts.en:
Wafik is a 37-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Wafik has been working as a carpenter since 2004. Wafik has requested a loan of $1,000 from A. Majmoua in order to buy a car. This is his fourth cycle and he always paid on time. He works upon request which is better than preparing and waiting to sell.

Wafik is speciA. in his work because of his reputation and the fact that he knows what to do. His clients are his friends and neighbors. The tenuous situation of his country was the only obstacle he faced, but his business itself is successful. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy a car for business use

loans.name: Khairiniso

texts.en:
Khairiniso’s passion lies with her children. A married mother of two children, Khairiniso opened her business selling women’s clothing with the goal of providing a better standard of living for her family. For the past 6 years, Khairiniso has successfully operated her business at the market.

With her profits, she not only has improved the living standards for her children, but she has been able to support her elderly parents as well. Khairiniso has requested a loan of 12,000 Somoni to restock her clothing inventory. An optimistic businesswoman, Khairiniso plans to use the loan to continue developing her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for women

loans.name: Dima

texts.en:
Dima is a 27-year-old woman who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon.  She has owned a grocery store since 2004. Dima has requested a loan of $1200 from Al Majmoua to purchase groceries for her store. This is Dima's second loan cycle. 

One obstacle that she faced with the previous loan is that her store is a family business.  Her family is big, so it was hard to share the benefits among all and still concentrate on improving the business.  What helped her is that her father was the owner of the shop so there was no rent to pay. 

Dima's customers are friends and neighbors. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Анвар – мужчина , который занимается продажей жвачками «Орбит». Он покупает с фирмы и развозит по торговым точкам в районы Истаравшан, Спитамен,  Масча. Для увеличения товарооборота он хочет получить повторный кредит . Он заметил , что с периода первого займа у него увеличился оборотный капитал и прибыль.
texts.en:
Anvar is a man, who sells Orbit chewing gum. He buys from a firm and delivers the product to retail outlets in the districts of Istaravshan, Spitamen and Mastchoh. He wants to obtain another loan in order to increase his goods turnover. Anvar noticed that his working capital and profit increased since his first loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Илхом

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 Ильхом кредитор в организации третий год. Он занимается развозкой жвательных резинок « Орбит». Хочет увеличить свой товар на повторный кредит. Сам он имеет дополнительный доход с работы по европейскому ремонту квартир. За период кредитования он смог увеличить товарооборот  вдвое и планирует кредитоваться в дальнейшем.
texts.en:
Илхом Мухаммедов is the creditor in an organization for his third year. He is engaged in the distribution of the gum "Orbit". He wishes to increase the amount of his goods through the use of this loan. He himself receives additional revenue from his job in a European apartment repair company. For the period of this loan he will be able to increase his commodity circulation by double and he plans to use loans in the future as well.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of goods

loans.name: Agahuseyn

texts.en: Agahuseyn S. is 58 years old. He is married with 3 sons. Agahuseyn sells confections and other foodstuffs in the market. He has been in this business for 15 years. This activity generates the main income for his family. Since Agahuseyn is very popular in the market selling fresh and tasty foodstuffs, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today Agahuseyn requests $2,000 USD for the purchase of foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Babaseyid

texts.en:
Babaseyid S. is a young man of 55. Little by little, he reaches his goals through perseverance and dedication. Thanks to his personal strength and desire to provide a better future for his family, he has progressed from being a salesman to being his own boss. Approximately 15 years ago, Babaseyid rented a place which had deteriorated badly, with terrible conditions, and it was there he started his business. Since then, he has expanded his grocery and now it is one of the best known groceries in his community. 

Babaseyid is now requesting a loan of $2,000 USD to increase the stock of foodstuffs in his store. Babaseyid is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will be key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more food products

loans.name: İkram

texts.en:
İkram S. has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with 4 children.
 
İkram has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a starting capital of $30 (USD), thanks to his perseverance and dedication, İkram began this enterprise 3 years ago. Over time he expanded his business, and today his whole family is engaged in this business. 

Today İkram needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: purchase additional foodstuffs to increase the range of goods in his store

loans.name: Mirzaman

texts.en:
Mirzaman K. is 53 years old. He is married and the father of 3 children. Mirzaman owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated by the grocery store. He is requesting a loan to increase the stock of foodstuffs in his grocery store and also for construction materials. 

Mirzaman is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs for the store

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en: Hamza is a 42 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children. Hamza has owned a bakery for eight years. He does saj and mankoucheh. The saj is a metA. oven where you do the saj bread or a traditionA. Lebanese cooking dome used to make markouk (flatbread) and doughy confections or mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are za'atar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Hamza requested a loan of $2000 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase ingredients for his bakery and to pay his children's school tuition. This is his third loan and he has always repaid on time. His previous loans helped him to improve his bakery with the purchase of a new oven. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for a bakery and pay school tuition

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik S. is a successful entrepreneur, father and dedicated husband. He has one daughter who inspires him to work hard. Malik began a small grocery store 4 years ago with a small amount of capital from his savings. He is assisted by his wife who helps him with serving his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery has become more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he can expand the variety of goods sold in his store. Malik is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: purchase more goods

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 53-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa. She has owned a grocery store for twenty-four years and also sells sweets (candies), fruit, vegetables and home products. She requested a loan of 2,500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is her second loan and she has always repaid on time.

Mariam’s previous loan helped her expand her business and diversify her merchandise. She is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and you can find all you want in her store. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Mariam decided on her business because of her financial need. In the future, she plans on expanding her business by selling chickens.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 43-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children. He has been working as a car repairer and painter for twenty-six years. He requested a loan of 2,000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Mahmoud is special in his work because of his punctuality. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He decided on his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation but when he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital to purchase all the necessary tools. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Najwa has owned a clothing shop for five years. She mainly sells women's and children's clothes. Najwa is outstanding in her work because she has competitive prices. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and tourists. When Najwa first started her business, she had financial issues. Najwa decide on this business because of her experience in sales and because she always wanted to have a shop of her own.

Najwa requested a loan of $500 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase clothes for her shop for the summer. This is her second loan cycle and she has always paid on time. Her previous loan helped her improve her shop by diversifying her inventory. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 52-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mohamad has owned a grocery store for ten years. Mohamad requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

Mohamad is special in his work because of his store location since it is in the middle of the town. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mohamad first started his business, he had financial issues. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Daher

texts.en:
Daher is a 58-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Daher has owned a grocery store for ten years. Daher requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Daher has requested a loan.

Daher is special in his work because he knows how to treat his customers. His customers are people from his village. When Daher first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his financial need. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by diversifying his merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Aqdam

texts.en:
Aqdam B. is a 29-year-old single man. Aqdam owns a grocery store and provides for his extended family with the revenue generated by it.

He is requesting a loan to increase his stock. Aqdam is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more food items

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina N. sells groceries such as tinned products, sweets, soft drinks, and others. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a businessman. Amina has been selling groceries since 2000. She is responsible for paying for food for the family and the payment of their utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her grocery inventory in her store. Amina hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in a building project she has started with her husband.

loans.use: purchase more food items

loans.name: Shafaq

texts.en:
Shafaq H. is the mother of 3 children. Her salary as a schoolteacher wasn’t even enough to provide her children with basic needs. This fact motivated Shafaq to start her own business. And in 1996 she started selling office supplies from her home. A little while after, she decided to dedicate herself to expand her business and opened her own store near her house.

Due to the large demand for her typical office supplies, she wishes to increase number of items she sells. All this would allow her to generate a larger economic income for her family with the aim to elevate their quality of life and education. In order to carry this out, she is proposing to solicit a loan that will be invested in purchasing more supplies for her store.

loans.use: purchase more supplies for her store

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Selling office supplies is the only source of income for Rovshan A., a humble 33-year-old young man who's been doing this for 8 years. Rovshan is a married father of one son. His son is the reason that he works hard, in order to provide him with the best, brightest future. This young man has many projects for his own future. The main project is that Rovshan wants to open his own store where he would be able to sell not only office supplies but also a great number of books. His wish is to add more office supplies, therefore have more to offer to his clients. Rovshan would pay back this loan and with the money he makes he would be able to pay for his son's education. This young man waits for your help. Let's make his dream come true.

loans.use: purchase office supplies and books

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana Z. is 48 is years old, is married, and is the mother of three children.

Tarana is doing all the best to ensure the best future for her children. That is the reason that she has been running her own small business for 12 years already. She has a grocery store for selling foodstuffs such as sweets (candies), macaroni, oil, sugar, spice and other items. The business is stable, and that allows her to improve the level of the living conditions of her family.

Now Tarana needs a loan to increase the range of her goods. Tarana and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: purchase more food products

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La señora Máxima L. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Máxima trabaja como empleada en un restaurant de La Paz, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
Con sus ahorros pudo adquirir un lote de terreno, el mismo que ya tiene construido tres habitaciones, pero se encuentran en obra gruesa.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de dos habitaciones en obra fina para habitarlas.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Máxima L. lives in a house she owns in the Llajeta zone, on the western end of the city of La Paz. Máxima works as an employee at a restaurant in La Paz, generating income with which she supports herself. With her savings she was able to acquire a plot of land, on which she now has constructed three rooms that are still unfinished. The loan she is requesting is to build two rooms that are completed, so they can be used. This is the third time she solicits a loan, and the financial analysis conducted indicates she qualifies favorably for access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build two finished rooms in her house.

loans.name: Alim

texts.en: Alim

loans.use: purchase more home furniture

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La señora Valentina M. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, área suburbana de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus dos hijas.
La señora Valentina trabaja como cocinera en un centro de ayuda a su comunidad, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
Con sus ahorros pudo adquirir un lote de terreno, el mismo que ya tiene habitaciones en la planta baja, pero su familia crece y las habitaciones de las que disponen les resultan pequeñas.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de dos habitaciones en planta alta.
Esta es la sexta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Valentina M. lives in a house she owns in the Pasankeri district, a suburban section of the city of La Paz, with her two daughters. Valentina works as a cook in a soup kitchen in her community, generating income that supports her family. With her savings, she was able to acquire a plot of land and build some first-floor rooms. However, her family is growing and the rooms they have are small. The loan she is soliciting is two build two second-floor rooms. This is the sixth time she requests a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis realized qualifies her favorably for access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build some second-floor rooms to her house.

loans.name: Bremilda

texts.es: Bremilda tiene 44 años, es natural de la ciudad de Cajamarca, pero reside en la ciudad de Lima desde hace 22 años. Actualmente vive con su hijo Eurles de 19 años de edad en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de cerveza, actividad que le ha dado buenos ingresos a su economía y gracias a ello puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. En su trabajo, lo primero que hace es realizar el pedido a una distribuidora que le trae las cajas de bebida hasta su domicilio, que es desde donde ella las vende. A Bremilda le gusta su trabajo porque puede hacerlo desde su casa y siempre le arroja buenas ganancias, aunque algunas veces le resulta muy cansado porque acomodar las cajas y despacharlas es un trabajo pesado que realiza sola. Pero lo más gratificante es que gracias a su negocio se considera una mujer independiente y trabajadora, sabe que si sigue poniéndole empeño a lo que hace, en un futuro podrá agrandar su negocio e implementarlo con mesas entre otros muebles para que sea más cómodo y así obtener más clientela. Este es el sexto préstamo de Bremilda con Microfinanzas PRISMA, siendo muy puntual en todos sus pagos, es por eso que se ha ganado el cariño de los demás miembros de su grupo solidario. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de cajas de cerveza para poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Bermilda is 44. She is from Cajamarca city, but she has lived in the city of Lima for 22 years. She currently lives with her 19 year old son, Eurles, in her own house. She has been selling beer for three years. This business has given her a good income. Thanks to her sales, she can pay the household expenses. The first thing she does in her work is go to a distributor to fill her order. The distributor takes the cases of beverages to Bremilda’s house, which is where she sells them. Bremilda likes being able to sell from her house, and she gets good earnings. Sometimes she is very tired because arranging the cartons and selling them is heavy work that she does alone. The most gratifying thing is that, thanks to her work, she considers herself to be a hard working, independent woman. She knows that if she keeps putting effort into what she does, in the future she can expand her store. She can then put in more tables and other furniture to make it more comfortable, and she can get more customers. This is Bremilda’s sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is always very punctual with her payments, and because of this she has won the affection of the other members of her united group. She will use the money to buy more cases of beer to be able to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
El señor Elías V. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Elías es chapista, realizando arreglo de vehículos accidentados en el taller que se encuentra en su propio domicilio, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un muro de cerramiento en la fachada de su vivienda, ya que por el pasar del tiempo el actual muro de adobe se encuentra deteriorado y es ya un peligro, tanto para el señor Eloy, como para los vehículos con los que trabaja.
Esta es la sexta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Elías V. lives in his own house in the Llojeta area, which is on the west side of the city of La Paz. Elías is an auto body repairer. He fixes vehicles that have been in accidents. His shop is in his home. The income supports him. The loan he is asking for is to build a wall enclosing the front part of his house. With the passage of time, the current adobe wall has deteriorated. It is a danger for Elías and for the vehicles that he works on. This is the sixth time he has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a wall in the front of his house, the old adobe wall has deteriorated

loans.name: Cervandicia

texts.es: Cervandicia tiene 58 años, vive con sus hijos Omar de 20 y Katy de 27 años, sus hijos mayores Simeón de 38 y Joel de 23 ya son independientes. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades, las cuales aprendió asistiendo a unos talleres de capacitación y desde el primer momento le gustó esta labor, pues se siente muy contenta con la libertad de horarios que tiene, además de distraerse mucho realizándolo. Actualmente está trabajando en un pedido de vestidos para fiesta, que le hicieron para el centro comercial “Gamarra”, uno de los más conocidos de la ciudad de Lima. Su principal actividad consiste en adornar con mostacillas los vestidos que le dan a trabajar, lo bueno es que Cervandicia no trabaja sola, ya que tiene a 6 personas que la ayudan a bordar, pues sola no se daría abasto para terminar con la gran cantidad de vestidos. Además esta labor requiere de muy buena vista y paciencia para lograr encajar cada mostacilla en la aguja y darles un bonito acabado, con cada vestido se demora una hora, tomándole casi todo el día lograr una buena cantidad. Pero Cervandicia piensa seguir trabajando duro, como hasta ahora, para lograr expandir su negocio y tener un taller más grande. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos, sin tener problemas en cancelarlos a tiempo. Con el dinero solicitado comprará tela y mayor cantidad de materiales en mostacillas, hilos, etc., ya que cada vez aumentan su precio y es mejor comprarlos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Cervandicia is 58. She lives with her children; Omar, 20; and Katy, 27. Her older children; Simeón, 38; and Joel, 33; are independent. She has been making handicrafts for four years. She learned how to do this by going to a training shop. From the first moment, she liked the work. She is very happy with the scheduling freedom that she has and the enjoyment she gets from doing the work. She is currently working on an order for party clothes for the Gamarra business center, which is one of the most well known centers in the city of Lima. Her primary job is decorating the clothes with beads. The good part is the Cervandicia do not work alone. She has six people who help her embroider; she could not finish the large quantity of clothes by herself. This work requires good eyesight and patience to be able to put each bead on the needle and give it a pretty finish. Each outfit takes an hour, and it takes almost all day to complete a good quantity. Cervandicia will continue to work hard to expand her business and have a larger shop. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She has always been very punctual with all of her payments, and she has not had problems paying on time. She will use the money she is asking for to buy fabric and a larger quantity of beads and threads etc. Every time their price increases, and it is better to buy them wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Flaivienne

texts.en:
Flaivienne T. lives with her husband in CoT., the largest city in Bénin. Her husband makes a living as a carpenter, and she runs a beauty salon. They do not yet have any children. Flaivienne's activity consists of selling hair care products, cutting hair and doing braids. Many women come to her salon to have colorful streaks woven into their hair. Braiding hair is a lengthy process and is often a social gathering for women in the neighborhood.

Flaivienne has been working in her salon for four years. Before opening shop, she was trained under another hairdresser, not far from where she works now. Feeling competent in the trade, she decided to open her own business. Flaivienne is seeking a loan from Alidé in order to expand her operations. She would like to be able to fully stock her salon with hair products.

loans.use: Purchase of hair care products

loans.name: José

texts.es: José tiene 64 años, vive con su esposa Sabina y sus hijos Aldo de 17 y Fernando de 11 años en su casa propia. Junto a su esposa trabajan vendiendo carne de pollo y condimentos en un pequeño puesto en el mercado de su localidad. Como las ventas son constantes y diarias, José debe estar frecuentemente comprando mercadería, por ello quien está permanentemente atendiendo el puesto es su esposa (en la foto). Sabina es muy carismática y no hay momento que tenga libre, puesto que siempre hay clientes esperando ser atendidos, a ella le gusta mucho su negocio porque es muy rentable, pero a veces le resulta muy cansado ya que tiene que permanecer durante todo el día en su puesto. Al lado de su esposo hacen el complemento perfecto, ya que ambos tienen las mismas metas para progresar en bien de sus hijos y poderles ofrecer lo mejor. José, junto a Sabina, siempre ha trabajado con los préstamos de Microfinanzas PRISMA, este es su sexto crédito y le ha ido muy bien con su grupo, el cual es muy puntual. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de carne de pollo y condimentos para tener toda la mercadería necesaria para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
José is 64 years old and owns his own home where he lives with his wife Sabina and his sons Aldo, 17, and Fernando 11. Together with his wife, he sells chicken and spices in a small stand in his town´s market. Because sales are continual every day, José has to buy his merchandise often, which is why his wife (in the photo) is the one who has to attend the stand. Sabina has a lot of charm and doesn´t have a free moment as there are always customers to attend to. She likes this business because it is very profitable but it is sometimes very tiring as she must be at the stand all day. She and her husband make the perfect couple; both have the same goal to get ahead for the good of their children and to be able to offer them the best. José, along with Sabina, has always worked with loans from Microfinanzas PRISMA. This is his sixth loan and he has done well with his group, who are very punctual with repayments. With the money he requests he will buy a larger quantity of chicken and spices so that he has the merchandise necessary to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz tiene 32 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos en su casa propia, donde está instalada su tienda de comestibles. Desde hace más de 6 años vende diferentes productos alimenticios para saciar la demanda de su vecindario, la cual es bastante, ya que es la tienda más cercana en toda su cuadra. Usualmente Liz trabaja sola, pero las veces que tiene que salir a comprar más mercadería la apoyan sus hijos en la atención. Su trabajo le gusta mucho, ya que puede realizarlo en su propia casa y se siente cómoda vendiendo desde ahí, lamentablemente a veces le resulta cansado ya que tiene que abrir desde las 6 de la mañana y quedarse hasta las 9 o 10 de la noche, siendo una larga la jornada. Sin embargo, gracias a sus vecinas y vecinos que siempre visitan su tienda, puede conversar y muy amablemente realizar su trabajo. Liz espera seguir expandiendo su negocio y comprando cada vez más mercadería. Con Microfinanzas PRISMA ya tiene 16 préstamos y todos le han servido para progresar poco a poco, además el trabajo en su banco comunal siempre ha sido muy bueno, sintiéndose satisfecha de ser parte de su grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Liz is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the home they own, where they have a small convenience store. For the past 6 years she has sold different products to meet the demand in her neighborhood, which is heavy since her store is the closest one in the area. Liz usually works alone, but when she has to go our to buy more goods her children help out. She likes her work because she can do it from home and she is comfortable selling there. Unfortunately sometimes it is tiring as she has to open at 6 in the morning and stay open until 9 or 10 at night, which makes for a long day. However, thanks to her neighbors who always visit the store, she can chat with them while she works. Liz hopes to expand her business and to keep buying more goods. She has had 16 loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA and each loan has helped to to get ahead bit by bit. Also, working with her communal bank has been good and she is pleased to be part of the group. With the money she is now requesting, she will buy a larger quantity of products with which to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Susan Jebet

texts.en: Susan is 32 years old and married to David Lagat who is a policeman. They are blessed with two children. Her business is located in a suburb of Eldoret town. Susan has run a beauty and cosmetics store for the past four years. She was introduced to KADET by her neighbour who is already a KADET client. Susan intends to use this loan from KADET to add more stock to her business, such as tins for hair treatment, jelly, chemicals, and cosmetics. One day she hopes to grow her business enough to diversify to a wholesale shop. In future, she also wants to be able to buy zero-grazing cows (where land is scarce, keeping cows in a stall, and bringing fodder to them instead of allowing them to graze outside) and build a house for her family. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy tins for hair treatment, jelly, chemicals, and cosmetics

loans.name: Susan Wairimu

texts.en: Susan is 26 years old, married to Lawrence Gachago, and the proud mother of two children. She owns a clothing business which is located along the Eldoret-Malaba highway. She has been in this business for the last four years. She expects that this loan will enable her to expand her business into a wholesale operation by allowing her to purchase more stock. She also hopes to diversify her business by opening a sausage shop, which she thinks will see high demand in the area. Susan was introduced to KADET by fellow business people who are already KADET clients. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for men and women

loans.name: Edwige

texts.en:
Edwige H. lives with her husband in Cotonou, Bénin. Their eight children (three boys and five girls), are already grown. Her husband makes a living as a welder.

For a long time, Edwige has been selling various goods in a small boutique in front of her home. Her home is close to a busy Cotonou street, which helps her sales. She started off selling only flour and corn but, in order to increase her revenues, she added charcoal to the list. As the primary fuel for cooking, charcoal is a highly sought after item in Bénin.

With the help of a loan, Edwige would like to buy twenty sacks of charcoal at the Dantokpa Market, the largest market in Cotonou. She hopes that by replenishing her supplies, she will be able to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris W. is 25 years old and married to Milton Obote with whom she has one child. She has been selling clothes for about two years now. This will be her first loan from Kiva partner KADET. Damaris was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a long-time KADET client. Her business is located at Huruma estate in Eldoret town. Damaris sells ladies' handbags, ready-made clothing, and men's and women's shoes. She intends to use this loan to buy more stock to expand her business and make more profit. She hopes to be able to someday expand her business to a wholesale operation, and diversify into other business activities and hence maximize her income and profits. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy men's and ladies' shoes, ready-made clothing, and handbags

loans.name: Joseph Mwema

texts.en:
Joseph Mwema is married to Judith Achieng and is the proud father of one child. He has been selling secondhand clothes for the last three years. 

Joseph was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a client. Joseph operates his business in Huruma estate in the outskirts of Eldoret town and near to bigger towns as well. With this first business loan from KADET, he intends to purchase assorted men's, ladies' and children's wear.

In future, Joseph hopes to grow his business to a wholesale outlet fully equipped and diversified with even school-boarding facilities. He also wishes to improve his living standards by buying a permanent residential plot for his family.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase assorted men's, ladies' and children's wear

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo trabaja de transportista, tiene una movilidad de servicio publico inter- ciudad La Paz El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su esposa. Viven en casa de su suegra ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará para la conversión de combustible de gasolina a gas licuado vehicular, lo cual le permitirá un ahorro del 50% de gasto en combustible, con lo que incrementarán sus ingresos familiares.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado por Teofilo.
texts.en:
Teofilo works as a driver. He has a vehicle which provides transportation service to the public between La Paz and El Alto. This is the main source of income with which he supports his wife. They live in his mother-in-law´s house located in the Pasankeri section of La Paz. The loan will be used to convert his vehicle from gasoline to liquid gas, which will enable him to save 50% of the cost of fuel and increase his income. This is his first loan with Impro and an evaluation qualifies him for the loan he requests.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To convert his vehicle from gasoline to liquid gas.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha trabaja vendiendo comida; tiene un puesto donde todo los días a partir de las 10:00 de la mañana vende almuerzo; Martha es madre soltera, el esposo lo abandonó hace 2 años y tiene un hijo que depende de ella. Ella vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Franz Tamayo de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la refacción de su vivienda; le falta el terminado de obra fina  de dos habitaciones.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación  del préstamo solicitado por Martha.
texts.en:
Martha works selling food. She has a stand where she sells lunch every day starting at ten in the morning. Martha is a single mother. Her husband abandoned her two years ago. She has a dependent son. She lives in her own house in the Franz Tamayo zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to refurbish her house. The work on two of the rooms has not been finished. This is her first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies Martha for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for finishing two rooms in her house in order to live more comfortably

loans.name: Mujeres De Amor Group

texts.en:
Amancia G. acts as the group coordinator for ten women from Los Nunez, a neighborhood on the outskirts of Puerta Plata.  She, like many of the women in her group, is unhappy with the poverty which her family lives in.  A few years ago Amancia’s husband died leaving her struggling to support herself and her three kids.  Although she has recently remarried, she remembers the hardships she experienced as a single mother and wishes to secure a future for her family.

After Amancia’s first husband passed away she provided for her children by selling clothing in Puerto Plata.  Amancia says that she used to buy clothes at a discount from a warehouse in Santiago and then sell individual items of clothing in her neighborhood.   Now, she hopes to use Esperanza to help her to start selling clothes again.  Amancia believes that with the help of Esperanza she will be able to make her business a success.  She says that Esperanza’s loan will allow her to obtain an additional discount from the warehouse because she will be able to buy in bulk.

Amancia’s hope is to spend the income from her clothing sales to provide her children with a good education.  She says that she wants to help her children to learn English and dreams that she will be able to send them all to college.  Amancia is particularly interested in helping her youngest son Rafael to pursue an artistic career. Although he is only ten, Rafael has demonstrated musical talent.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela es comerciante de papeles reciclados, comprando de la Empresa “La Papelera” para comercializar en la feria popular de la 16 de julio; el esposo es chofer asalariado del transporte publico. Así se compone su fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos que depende de la pareja.

Viven en alquiler ubicado en la zona de Loreto de la misma ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (papel reciclado) por cantidad para  satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Pamela deals with recycled paper. She is a buyer for the company “La Papelera” (the Trash Bin) and trades her goods at the 16 de Julio market. Her husband is a salaried public transit driver. Both incomes help support the couple’s two dependent children. They live in a rental property located in the Loreto district of the city of El Alto.

Her loan will be used to purchase additional inventory (paper for recycling) to meet the market demand. This is Pamela’s second loan with IMPRO. The excellent payment history she has demonstrated with our institution qualifies her to access another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy large quantities of recycled paper for resale

loans.name: Cynthia Paola

texts.es:
La señora Cynthia Paola Q. M. tiene 21 años de edad, vive en el distrito de moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad – Perú.
La empresaria actualmente se encuentra estudiando enfermería en el VIII ciclo de la Universidad Nacional de Trujillo.
Cynthia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes tales como: azúcar, aceite, arroz, fideos en la tienda de su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles, compró mas abarrotes y logró surtir su tienda. 
Con este crédito de S/ 600 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su negocio en la compra de mas abarrotes, como: leche azúcar, arroz, fideo, aceite, atan, galletas, chocolates,  gaseosas, jugos, etc.
Cynthia sueña con hacer crecer su negocio para generar dinero y poder apoyarse económicamente para culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Cynthia Paola Q. M., 21, lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is currently studying nursing in the eighth cycle at the Universidad Nacional de Trujillo. Cynthia sells groceries like sugar, oil, rice, and noodles in the store in her house. With her first loan for 300 PEN, she bought more groceries to stock her store. With this loan for 600 PEN, she will invest in her business and buy more groceries like sugar, rice, noodles, oil, tuna, crackers, chocolates, soft drinks, and juices, etc. Cynthia dreams of expanding her business to generate money and be able to economically support finishing her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more food products to sell in her store

loans.name: Philomène

texts.en:
Philomène L. lives in Cotonou, the largest city in Bénin. She is married and has two children. Her son went to college and is now an accountant. Her daughter is currently an apprentice to a hairdresser. 

For five years, Philomène has been running a boutique in front of her house, where she sells various goods. Her merchandise includes rice, corn, alcohol, eggs, candy, and cigarettes. She sell these goods by themselves and she also prepares hot food to purchase. She buys her goods at the Dantokpa Market, the largest market in Cotonou.

With the help of the loan, Philomène would like to buy vegetable oil, corn, beans, and cassava. She will use these products to prepare meals. She says that the loan will enable her to buy in bulk thus saving her money.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable oil, corn, beans, and cassava

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es comerciante de ropa para niños, que comercializa en distintas ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto; el esposo trabaja de albañil y de esta manera reunen sus ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos que depende de la pareja. Viven en casa propia ubicada en la zona de German Buchs 1-1-2 Alto Lima de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (ropa para niños) por cantidad para  satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Paulina is a children's clothing retailer in the various markets in the city of El Alto. Her husband works as a bricklayer and both of their incomes help cover the living expenses for their three dependent children. They live in their own home located in the German Buchs 1-1-2 district of the city of El Alto.

Her loan will be used to buy a large quantity of merchandise (children’s clothing) to meet the market demand. This is Paulina’s second loan with IMPRO. The excellent payment history she has demonstrated with our institution qualifies her to access another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil casada y es madre de 07 hijos (3 fallecidos).  Ella tiene estudios de primaria completa y vive en la Parcialidad de Quicañamaya.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado mayor para engorde.

Su deseo es continuar con su negocio y poder comercializar al por mayor.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana belongs to the communal bank group "Manuela de Hoy" which is located in the Ilave District of El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of 7 children (3 of whom are deceased). She completed her elementary school education and lives in the Quicañamaya area.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase small animals. Right now, she needs 3000 soles to buy cattle for fattening.

She hopes to continue her business and become a major force in the marketplace. She enjoys saving money and the companionship among the communal bank members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle for fattening

loans.name: Geoma

texts.es:
Geoma trabaja con su esposo; tienen un carro de carga, comercializan arena, piedra para construcciones, con cuyos ingresos cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos que dependen de la pareja, tiene su casa propia que esta ubicada en la zona de Villa German Busch 1-1-2 de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de llantas para la movilidad con que trabajan, pues es su herramienta de trabajo.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Geoma works with her husband. They have a freight car, which they use for sand and rocks for construction. With their income from this, they can support their three children, who are dependent on the couple. They have their own house, which is located in the area of Villa German Busch 1 – 1 – 2 in the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to buy wheels for the vehicle they use for work. This is her second loan from Impro. She was able to get a second loan from Impro because she displayed good behavior with her repayments for the first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheels for her freight car

loans.name: Edelmira Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Edelmira Leonor G. V. tiene 56 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene 1 hija de 32 años de edad, quien no depende económicamente de ella.
Edelmira se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro mas cajas de cerveza.
Este crédito de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mesas para implementar un pequeño restaurant en su casa para la venta de piqueos y también comprará cerveza.  Con este crédito podrá adecuar un ambiente en su domicilio. Edelmira sueña con tener un bar y restaurante en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edelmira Leonor G. V. is 56 years old, and she lives in the district of Moche, in the province of Trujillo, in La Libertad, Perú. This businesswoman has completed school until the fifth year of secondary school. She has a 32-year-old daughter, who is not financially dependent on her. Edelmira sells beer in her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought more boxes of beer. This loan of 1500 soles will be invested to buy tables so that she can have a small restaurant in her house, where she will sell snacks. She will also buy beer with the loan. With this loan, she will be able to have a good setting in her house for a restaurant. Edelmira dreams of having a bar and restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To have a restaurant and to buy beer

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina trabaja con su esposo; tienen un taller de carpintería donde elaboran puertas, mesas y sillas de madera que comercializan en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingreso con que cubren la manutención de sus 6 hijos que están en los últimos años de la secundaria; tiene su casa propia ubicada en la zona de German Bush 1-1-2 en  la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (madera, cola, clavos, tornillos) para poder satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que existe en su mercado.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Marina works with her husband. They have a carpentry workshop, where they produce doors, tables, and chairs from wood, which they sell in the 16 de Julio area in the city of El Alto. This activity provides them with income to provide for their 6 children, who are in their final years of secondary school. She has her own house, located in the German Bush1-1-2 area in the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to buy raw materials, such as wood, glue, nails, and screws, so that she is able to satisfy the demand that exists in the market. This is her second loan with Impro. She was able to get a second loan because she displayed good behavior in repayments with her first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, glue, nails, etc for her carpentry workshop

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera, sin hijos y  tiene estudios de secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 06 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual inicio su negocio de venta de comida. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de insumos para la preparación de comidas, ella nos comenta que  comprará papas, arroz, chuño, quinua, etc.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando en su negocio y mejorarlo.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones en el Banco Comunal
texts.en:
Sonia belongs to the Medalla Milagrosa Community Bank, which is located in the Pomata district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 28 and single. She does not have children. She has a high school education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years. With her first loan for 300 PEN, she started her business of selling food. She now needs a loan for 500 PEN to buy ingredients for food preparation. She will buy potatoes, rice, dried potatoes, and quinoa, etc. Her wish is to keep working in her business and improve it. She likes the savings and the meetings in her Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, rice, dried potatoes, quinoa, etc.

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
Yola trabaja como vendedora de comida; tiene un puesto de venta ubicado en su misma zona donde vende almuerzos.
