El esposo trabaja de ayudante albañil estas dos actividades son sus fuentes de ingresos con lo cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo de dos años y su madre de la tercera edad. Viven en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la Zona Villa Cooperativa de  la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de insumos por cantidad (fideo, arroz, papa), para ahorrar en los costos y mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el Primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del crédito solicitado por Yola.
texts.en:
Yola works as a food seller. She has a stand located in her own zone; she sells lunches. Her husband works as an assistant bricklayer. These two activities are their source of income to support her small two year old son and her elderly mother. They live in a rented house in the Villa Cooperativa zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy quantities of ingredients (noodles, rice, potatoes) in order to save on costs and improve income. This is her first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation shows that Yola qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy noodles, rice, potatoes, and other ingredients for her food selling business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Pomata, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 53 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y es madre D. 05 hijos (01 a su cargo).  Tiene estudios D. primaria completa, vive en la av. Panamericana s/n.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 04 años,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para invertir en su negocio D. venta D. comida. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. fideos, arroz, papa, chuño, aceite y condimentos para la preparación D. comida.

Su deseo es comprar una casita en Puno.

A ella le gustan las charlas, los encuentros y las reuniones entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luisa is a member of the Medalla Milagrosa (Miraculous Medal) village bank located in the Pomata district of the Chucuito province of Puno, Peru. She is 53 years old, married and is the mother of 5 children (one of whom still lives with her). She completed her elementary school education and lives on Panamerican Avenue. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for the past 4 years with an initial loan of ~$100 which she used to invest in her business selling food. Now, she is requesting a loan of $675 in order to purchase noodles, rice, potatoes, oil and condiments to prepare her food. She hopes to one day purchase a home in Puno. She enjoys the discussions, the interactions and the meetings of the village bank.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase noodles, rice, potatoes, oil, and condiments to prepare her food

loans.name: Daphne

texts.en:
Daphne T. runs a bar called “Chez Horace” in Cotonou, Bénin. She has four children, one of whom helps manage the bar. She also employs a cashier, several waitresses, and a woman to purchase beverages at a local market.

Business is going well but could be better. Daphne thinks that her sales have diminished somewhat due to the rainy season when there is less social activity. Daphne normally sells food in front of the bar but cannot do so when it is constantly raining. She hopes business will pick up again when the rain lets up towards the end of the summer. Daphne is seeking a loan from Alidé in order to restock her beverages, which she hopes will increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages

loans.name: Yanire

texts.es:
La señora Yanire S. G. tiene 32 años de edad, vive en el distrito de las Delicias , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta tercero de secundaria, tiene 1 hijo de 8 años de edad quien depende económicamente de ella.
Yanire se dedica a la venta de huevos en el mercado y en la tienda de su casa. También distribuye en distintas tiendas de Moche y las Delicias
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles compro mas huevos, jabas y bolsas para despachar los productos.
 Con este crédito de 1,300 soles, lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra de huevos y productos de abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, entre otros; los cuales vende en la tienda de su casa.
Yanire   tiene como sueño comprar un puesto en el segundo piso del mercado de Moche.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yanire Sanchez G. is 32 years old and lives in the Las Delicias district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Peru. This businesswoman finished her studies through the 3rd year of high school; she has one son who is 8 years old and depends on her for his well-being. Yanire sells eggs in the market and in the small shop in her home. She also distributes the eggs to various shops in Moche and Las Delicias. With her first loan of ~$100, she purchased more eggs, beans, and bags to distribute her products. With this $450 loan, she will invest further in her business, purchasing eggs and other groceries like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc., which she sell in the shop in her home. Yanire would like to eventually have a stall on the second floor of the Moche market.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of eggs and other groceries: rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc. which she sells in the shop in her home

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y con 1 hijo.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa y vive en el Jr. Odria s/n.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con los cuales inicio su negocio de venta de comida. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de arroz, fideos, papas, chuño, verduras, etc. para la preparación de comidas.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y agrandar su negocio.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas que dan en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is a member of the Medalla Milagrosa (Miraculous Medal) village bank located in the Pomata district in the Chucuito province in Puno, Peru. She is 47 years old, singles and has one child. She has a high school education and lives on Odria Street. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for the past 5 years; her first loan of ~$100 helped her to start her business selling food. She now is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase rice, noodles, potatoes, vegetables, etc. to prepare her food. She would like to keep working and expanding her business. She enjoys the savings and the classes that are provided through the village bank.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, noodles, potatoes, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Elodia

texts.es:
Elodia, trabaja como empleada domestica y sus esposo tiene un taller de electricidad de autos y soldadura.
Vive en la Zona de Irpavi II de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa como cuidadora.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de material de trabajo (soldaduras, repuestos) en el taller que trabaja con su esposo.
Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la cuarta vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago se de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elodia works as a maid and her husband runs an auto electric repair and welding workshop. She lives in the Irpavi II zone in La Paz where she takes care of a home. The loan will be used to purchase working capital (welding materials, spare parts) in the workshop where she assists her husband. This is the 6th loan she has received from Impro and the 4th time she has requested assistance through Kiva. Her history qualifies her as a punctual, responsible woman in paying her installments.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of welding materials and spare parts for her husband's electric repair workshop

loans.name: Dora Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Dora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil casada, y es madre de 07 hijos (1 a su cargo), tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en la av. Panamericana s/n.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio de venta de comida. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para comprar, arroz, papas, pescado, queso, sal, aceite, etc., para la venta de comida el cual es su negocio actual.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para salir adelante.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dora is a member of the Medalla Milagrosa (Miraculous Medal) village bank located in the Pomata district in the Chucuito province of Puno, Peru. She is 60 years old, married and the mother of 7 children (one of whom still lives with her). She has an elementary school education and lives on Panamerican Avenue. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for the past 4 years; her first loan of ~$100 was used to invest in her business selling food. She is now requesting a loan of $175 to purchase rice, potatoes, fish, cheese, salt, oil, etc. to be able to sell food in her current business. She would like to keep working in order to keep progressing. She enjoys the savings and the classes provided by the village bank.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, potatoes, fish, cheese, salt, oil, etc.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
Avelina compra botellas y recoge botellas de plástico de todas las zonas de la ciudad de La Paz, y esas mismas lo vende por kilo a las empresas de reciclaje.
Su esposo es albañil.
El crédito requiere para aumentar su capital y comprar mas botellas.
Vive en la Zona de Irpavi II de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa alquilada.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la tercera vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago se de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Avelina purchases bottles and gathers plastic bottles from all areas of the city of La Paz and sells them by the kilo to recycling businesses. Her husband is a construction worker. This loan will increase her capital and allow her to purchase more bottles. She lives in the Irpavi II zone in La Paz in a rented home. This is the 3rd loan she has requested through Impro and the 3rd time she has requested the support through Kiva. Her history qualifies her as a responsible woman in paying her installments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic bottles for her business selling them back to recycling companies

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
Placida, se dedica a la elaboración de mantas polleras y centros para cholita. 
Es una mujer luchadora ya que con su actividad económica apoya en los gastos de alimentación de sus familia.
Vive en la Zona de Irpavi II de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa propia
Requiere el crédito para el capital de trabajo (compra de de tela Hilo y forro).
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la tercera vez que requiere el apoyo de kiva, su responsabilidad le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito ya que es un cliente con calificación 1 es decir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas
texts.en:
Placida earns her living making traditional clothing such as shawls and skirts. She is very hardworking as she helps pay for her family’s food out of her earnings. She lives in her own home in the neighbourhood of Irpavi II in La Paz. She needs this loan to buy material, thread, and lining. This is her third loan with Kiva partner, Impro, and the responsibility she has shown in the past means that she has qualified to take on another loan. She always makes repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material, thread and lining to make traditional clothing

loans.name: Mujeres Dispuestas Group

texts.en:
Belky F. is the group leader for a team of young women from the town of Mamey, a city just south of Puerto Plata. At the age of 36, she is a single mother struggling to raise three kids by herself. She is able to send her children, Rafelina, Jorge-Luis, and Madeline to a nearby school and hopes that next year she will be able to afford to send Rafelina, her eldest, to a university. Unfortunately Belky is short on money. Rent for her apartment is only 500 pesos (15 dollars) a month but, even so, between the cost of rent and the cost of educating her children, she doesn’t have the funds for much else.

In an effort to improve her situation Belky joined a group of other women from the town of Mamey and came to Esperanza for help. By borrowing funds from Esperanza she will be able to operate a small clothing business in Mamey. With her micro-loan, she will buy clothes at a discounted price from a manufacturer in Santiago. She says that once she returns from Santiago with clothes, she will be able to sell them out of her house for a profit. Although her business is just beginning, it seems promising because it follows the same business model as many other successful Esperanza clothing vendors.

Belky hopes that by reinvesting the profits of her clothing sales she will be able to expand her business enough to send her children to college, own her own house, and buy some luxury items such as a cellphone. She says her ultimate goal is to one day own her own clothing store.

loans.use: To buy shirts and pants for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 48 años, es soltera, vive con su hijo Arnold de 14 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de comestibles en la tienda que instaló en su casa, donde ofrece gran cantidad y variedad de productos para la clientela asidua a su tienda. Maria se distrae mucho con su trabajo, ya que mientras vende su mercadería conversa con sus clientes, siendo una persona muy carismática. Pero no todo es fácil, ya que a veces le resulta muy cansado tener que permanecer durante todo el día atendiendo, pues abre desde las 6 de la mañana y se queda aproximadamente hasta las 9 de la noche porque siempre tiene clientes en ese horario. Para un futuro cercano, a Maria le gustaría implementar su tienda colocando un mostrador con otros artículos no comestibles, teniendo así un mini bazar. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y siempre ha sido muy responsable con todos sus pagos al igual que sus compañeras de grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita empezará a comprar aquellos productos no comestibles para ir implementando su bazar y sus clientes no tendrán que ir más lejos de su vecindario en busca de estos artículos.
texts.en:
48-year old Maria is single and lives with her 14-year old son Arnold in their own home. For the last three years she has earned her living by selling groceries from the store located in her house. She offers a wide variety of products to her many regular customers. Maria enjoys her work very much as while she sells her merchandise, she chats to the customers—she is a very charismatic person. But it isn’t an easy life. Sometimes she gets very tired as she has to work the whole day long serving customers; she opens up at 6am and remains in the store until up to 9 pm at night as there are often customers at that time. In the near future, Maria would like to equip her store with a counter displaying non-grocery items, like a mini hardware store. This is her third loan with Kiva partner, Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she has always been a responsible person with her repayments—just like everyone else in her group. With the money she will start to buy products to stock her hardware store so that her customers won’t have to go out of the neighbourhood to buy these items.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy hardware items

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 1 résident à Bèssana, un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, relevant de la préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. Elles sont toutes mariées, ont en moyenne  47ans, 6 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames.
Filles et femmes de cultivateurs, elles pratiquent l’agriculture dès le bas âge à coté de leurs parents. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage.
Après plusieurs années de prêts solidaires avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, ces femmes, paysannes, sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne. Tous les prêts précédents ont été bien  remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt, pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles  cultivent  8 hectares  avec comme spéculations  l’arachide et le riz.
Ces femmes espèrent sur une production moyenne 3 tonnes par hectare soit 24 tonnes.
Une partie de  la récolte sera consommée  et l’autre partie sera stockée dans un premier temps avant la vente aux revendeurs venant des grandes villes surtout au comptant .
Le bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, prendre en charge les frais de scolarité, de santé des enfants et acheter les trousseaux  de mariage des filles.
Ce groupe de femmes ambitionnent ouvrir un magasin de céréales dans le village dans le futur.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi 1 group live in Bèssana, a village in the Fakola subprefecture, part of the Kolondièba prefecture in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. They are all married and live in polygamous families. They average 47 years of age and 6 children. Daughters and wives of farmers, they've been growing crops with their parents since their younger age. They got acquainted through bonds of kinship and neighborhood.

After several years of solidarity loans (group loans) with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, these farmer women are seeking their third farming loan. All previous loans were repaid without problems. They intend to use this loan to pay for the cost of tillage and hoeing, and to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides. They cultivate 8 hectares, and mostly grow peanuts and rice.

These women hope to achieve an average yield of 3 tons per hectare, for a total of 24 tons. Part of the harvest will be eaten, and the remainder will firstly be stocked, before being sold, mainly for cash, to resellers coming from the larger cities. The profits will be used to repay the loan, to pay for the school and health expenses of the children, and to buy trousseaus for their daughters. In the future, the women of the group ambition to open a cereals store in the village.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the cost of tillage and hoeing, and to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 37 años, vive con su esposa Ana y sus hijos Jean Carlo de 13 y Rosmery de 8 años de edad. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi y ha ganado mucha experiencia en esta labor, la cual le gusta realizar puesto que es un trabajo independiente que puede interrumpir para estar con sus hijos. Aunque no todo siempre es fácil, hoy en día las papeletas de los policías y las averías en su vehículo hacen que el negocio de los transportistas sea más difícil, felizmente su familia le da ánimos para que día a día trabaje incansablemente. Roberto comienza su jornada desde muy temprano en la mañana y siempre se queda hasta altas horas para lograr los ingresos necesarios para el día. En un futuro cercano a Roberto le gustaría comprar otro carro con el que trabaje algún familiar o amigo y así comenzar una pequeña empresa de transportes. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está muy acostumbrado a pagar a tiempo sus cuotas porque todo su grupo es muy estricto en ese sentido. Con el dinero que viene solicitando refaccionará su carro y también apoyará a su esposa en la compra de productos de belleza que es el negocio al que ella se dedica, para que así, ambos salgan adelante.
texts.en:
37-year old Roberto lives with his wife Ana and their children 13-year old Jean Carlo and 8-year old Rosmery. For the last eight years he has earned his living by providing a taxi service and is now an experienced taxi driver, a job he enjoys because as a self-employed person, he can spend time with his children. However it isn’t always an easy job because of tickets from the police and wear and tear on to his vehicle. Fortunately having a family gives him the will to work hard every day. Roberto starts work very early and always works long hours in order to bring in enough money. In the near future, Roberto would like to buy another car so that a family member or friend could drive it and he could start a small transportation business. This is his third loan with Kiva partner, Microfinanzas PRISMA, and he is quite used to making regular repayments because his group is very strict about this. With the money he has asked for he will repair his car and also help his wife buy beauty products for her business—in this way both of them will come out ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair his car and help his wife with her business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo Emilian y sus hijos Kenji de 18, Carol de 11 y Jahir de 2 añitos en su casa propia. Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, su labor consiste en mostrar sus revistas y catálogos a sus posibles clientas para ofrecerles los productos que se ofertan, obteniendo así diferentes pedidos, los cuales realiza a la empresa con la que trabaja. La ganancia que ella obtiene es que tiene un catálogo personal con precios más bajos, entonces ella compra grandes cantidades de esa revista para luego venderlos a su precio original, consiguiendo aproximadamente el 25% por producto. Teresa es muy ingeniosa, es por eso que le va bien en su negocio y por otro lado puede ayudar en los gastos de  hogar, pues su esposo es comerciante de choclos en uno de los mercados de su localidad y las ganancias que no siempre cubren todos los gastos. Es por eso que Teresa está contenta con su trabajo y espera en un futuro poder tener una tienda donde ofertar en una vitrina sus productos cosméticos. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual con sus cuotas de devolución, además le gusta mucho el trabajo con su grupo. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock y así obtener mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Teresa is 50 years old. She lives with her husband Emilian and her children, 18-year-old Kenji, 11-year-old Carol and 2-year-old Jahir, in their own house.
She has sold catalogue cosmetics for 9 years. Her work involves showing her magazines and catalogues to potential customers, so that they can see the products on offer, and receiving different orders, which she then makes through the company that employs her. She has her own discount catalogue, so she makes a profit by purchasing large quantities using this catalogue and then selling products at the original price. She gets approximately 25% per product. Teresa is very resourceful, which is why her business is going well and why she can also contribute to household costs. Her husband sells corn in one of the town’s markets and his earnings don’t always cover all their expenses. This is why Teresa is happy in her work and hopes to someday have a shop with her cosmetics products in the window.
This is her third loan with MFP and she has always been punctual with her repayments. She also enjoys working with her group. She will use the requested money to purchase a larger quantity of cosmetics to have them in stock, and thus make more sales.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  sept femmes du groupe Benkadi  2 sont toutes mariées et  résident à Bèssana un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. Elles ont  une moyenne d’age de 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Ces femmes ont travaillé avec Soro Yiriwaso  l’institution de microfinance dans le prêt  solidaire commerçant dont elles ont fait plusieurs cycles et tous ont été bien remboursés. Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne (prêt agricole) de Soro Yiriwaso, qui correspond avec leur activité car paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne dont les  deux précédents ont été bien  remboursés.
Ce prêt servira à assurer, les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles cultivent  une surface de 6 hectares  avec comme spéculations l’arachide et de riz.
Ces femmes espèrent avoir une  production moyenne de 3 tonnes par hectare soit 18 tonnes.
Une partie de  la récolte sera consommée et l’autre stockée puis vendue dans les différentes foires des villages de Fakola et environs, au comptant et surtout aux revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Le bénéfice  sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du  prêt, prendre en charge les frais scolaire, de santé des enfants et acheter les trousseaux  de mariage des filles.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Benkadi 2 group are all married and live in Bèssana, a village in the Fakola subprefecture, part of the Kolondièba prefecture in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. They average 38 years of age and 5 children, and live in polygamous families. They got acquainted through bonds of kinship and neighborhood. These women benefited from several business loans from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, and all loans were repaid without problems. They are now seeking their third farming loan, a category matching their businesses, and the previous two loans were repaid without problems.

This loan will be used to pay for the cost of tillage, hoeing, and to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides. They cultivate an area of 6 hectares, and grow peanuts and rice. These women hope to achieve an average yield of 3 tons per hectare, for a total of 18 tons. Part of the harvest will be eaten, and the remainder will be firstly stored, and then resold for cash at the fairs in Fakola and in the surrounding villages, mostly to resellers coming from the larger cities. The profits will be used to repay the loan, to pay for the school and health expenses of the children, and to buy trousseaus for the daughters.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the cost of tillage, hoeing, and to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 54 años, está casado con María de 45, ellos viven con sus hijos Daniel de 18 y Brayan de 16 en su casa propia. Esta es una pareja sumamente trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 6 años, tiempo en el cual María ha optado por viajar al país de Chile donde la ropa está mucho más barata y traerla para que la venda su esposo en la ciudad de Lima. El negocio que les ha traído buenas ganancias, pero a base de mucho sacrificio, ya que no es nada fácil tener que viajar a un lugar tan lejano para traer tanta mercadería, bueno es que les resulta rentable y gracias a esos ingresos han logrado sacar adelante a su familia, puesto que su clientela conoce la calidad de las prendas que ofrecen. Para el futuro, Roberto quiere comprar un minibus donde puedan ofrecer el servicio de transporte interurbano en la ciudad de Lima, ya que piensa que será un negocio muy lucrativo. Este es su primer préstamo individual con MFP, pero anteriormente trabajó en bancos comunales, de los cuales obtuvo mucha experiencia para organizar sus ganancias y ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita su esposa viajara a Chile para traer mayor cantidad de ropa.
texts.en:
Roberto is 54, and he is married to María, 45. They live with their 18 year old son, Daniel, and their 16 year old son, Brayan, in their own house. This is a hard working couple that has been selling clothes for six years. During that time María decided to travel to the country of Chile where clothing is much cheaper. She brings the clothing back for her husband to sell in the city of Lima. The business has brought them good income. But, there has been much sacrifice because it is not at all easy to have to travel to a place so far away to bring back merchandise. It does turn out to be profitable, and thanks to this income they have been able to get ahead with their family. The customers know the quality of the clothing that they sell. In the future, Roberto wants to buy a mini bus so that he can offer urban transportation in the city of Lima. He thinks that would be a very lucrative business. This is his first individual loan with MFP, but he has previously worked with community banks. In community banks he gained much experience about organizing his earnings and being punctual in his payments. With the money he is now asking for, his wife will travel to Chile to bring back a greater quantity of clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Gwantwa

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Gwantwa M. from Mbeya. She is married and is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Since 2008, Gwantwa has been running a business purchasing and selling cereals. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and currently earns about 50 USD a month. She is requesting a loan order to purchase additional stocks of cereals in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her business. Gwantwa thanks you for your support! About SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of cereals in bulk

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo Cayo de 42, quien es ayudante de cocina y sus hijos Rosmery de 20, Erika de 17, Elvis de 15 y Jimena de 4 años. El trabajo siempre ha significado para Teodora una fuente de fuerza para salir adelante, ella piensa que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajando duro se sale adelante, es así que siempre a realizado diferentes actividades para el progreso de su familia. Ahora, luego de haber salido de un negocio no favorable decidió volver al negocio de la comida, vendiendo salchipapas (papas y salchichas fritas), en el cual le fue muy bien años atrás. Para ello debe comprar un carrito salchipapero de segunda mano, pues temporalmente vende por las tardes fuera de su casa y con esa actividad aporta dinero para hogar. Pero Teodora necesita mejorar su negocio y obtener mejores ventas para lograr su meta de tener un gran restaurante. Este es su segundo préstamo individual con MFP, ella siempre ha sido muy responsable en todos sus pagos y se compromete a seguir siéndolo. Lo que comprará con el dinero que solicita es un carrito salchipapero de segunda mano para poder preparar con mayor comodidad y más porciones de este rico platillo y así obtener mayor clientela.
texts.en:
Teodora is 41 years old and lives with her husband Cayo, who is 42. They have 4 children: Rosmery – 20, Erika – 17, Elvis – 15, and Jimena – 4. She is a kitchen assistant. Teodora’s work has always been important to her because it allowed her to become successful. She believes persistence and hard work are qualities one must have to move forward.

She has pursued various lines of work in order to improve her family’s living situation. After leaving a previous venture that failed, she decided to return to the food business. She now sells “salchipapas” (fried potatoes & sausages), an enterprise that has been doing well for many years. She thinks she should buy a secondhand vending cart so that she can sell food away from her home in the evenings on a temporary basis. This will help her earn some extra income.

Teodora needs to improve her business and increase her sales so that she can achieve her goal of opening a large restaurant. This is her second individual loan with MFP. She has been very responsible with her payments and promises to remain on time. The loan will be used to buy a secondhand “salchipapero” cart that will help her prepare food more comfortably and allow her to offer larger portions of her rich dish to attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a mobile food cart

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 32 años, vive en la casa de su suegra junto a su esposo Juan de 29 años, el cual es electricista y sus hijos: Luis Enrique de 13 años y Ángelo de 5 meses. Ella es una mujer muy esforzada que siempre ha trabajado desde que era adolescente ayudando a su madre en las actividades que realizaba, posteriormente trabajó en la venta de lencería hasta que se conoció con a Juan, su pareja, y conformó su propia familia. Desde entonces se viene dedicando a la venta de zapatos y zapatillas, los cuales son muy demandados, por lo que le gusta su mucho su trabajo y la hace sentir independiente y realizada. A futuro, Vilma quiere viajar a provincias cercanas a la ciudad de Lima, para ahí vender su mercadería, puesto ya que ahí hay más demanda y puede obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Vilma se siente contenta de trabajar y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que con su pequeño Ángelo ahora tienen más necesidades que cubrir y pensar en su futuro. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. El dinero que obtenga lo usará para la compra de mayor cantidad de zapatillas, Vilma está muy ilusionada con su negocio y confía en que le dará buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Vilma is 32 years old. She lives in her mother-in-law’s house with her husband Juan, 29 years old and an electrician, and their two sons: Luis Enrique – 13, and Angelo – 5 months.

Since she was a teenager, Vilma has always worked hard. She started by helping with her mother’s business. She sold lingerie prior to meeting her husband and starting a family. At the moment, she sells shoes and slippers which are in high demand. She greatly enjoys her work because it gives her a sense of independence and accomplishment. In the future, Vilma wants to travel to nearby provinces around the city of Lima to sell her products. She believes there is more demand in those areas and opportunity for larger profits. Vilma is happy to work and help her husband with the household expenses, especially now that her little Angelo has many more needs and she is concerned about his future.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time. The money she received will be used to purchase more slippers. Vilma is very excited about her business and hopes it will result in good returns.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase selection of merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil and soda.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Sara N. from Mbeya. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 18.  Sara has been running a local restaurant and rice business since 1993. A mama lishe (local restaurant or café) in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantains (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. She works at the business for 9-12  hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by 2 employees.  Sara currently earns about 50 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional stock of rice.  In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her business. Sara thanks you for your support!

About Sero Lease and Finance Limited (SELFINA):
SELFINA is a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly es una mujer de 33 años que lucha por sus 3 hijos, ya que es padre y madre para ellos y gracias a su trabajo logró comprar un terreno donde construyó su casa propia. La venta de ropa de bebé es la actividad que ha realizado por más de 8 años, teniendo la posibilidad de vender su mercadería en los puestos de sus amistades a quienes deja un porcentaje de sus ganancias. De esta manera obtiene ingresos económicos en diversos puestos del mercado; por ello, desde muy temprano por la mañana, visita cada puesto para dejar su mercadería y posteriormente realiza las cobranzas. Adicionalmente; los fines de semana, vende sus prendas de forma ambulante en las diferentes ferias de su localidad, caminando desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Pero este sacrificio tiene su recompensa en las gratificantes ganancias que obtiene con sus ventas. El deseo a futuro de Kelly es tener un puesto de venta estable donde venda sus prendas con mayor tranquilidad y comodidad. Este es su 13avo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y lo que más valor de su banco comunal es el trabajo en equipo que realiza con todas sus compañeras. La compra de prendas durante estos meses es muy beneficiosa debido a la temporada de invierno, pues la demanda de ropa abrigada se incrementa y los 1500 soles que solicita le servirán para la compra de esta mercadería.
texts.en:
Kelly is a 33-year old woman who fights alone to support her 3 children, as she plays the role of both mother and father to them. Thanks to her work, she managed to buy a plot of land where she built her own house. She has realized the activity of selling baby clothing for more than 8 years, having the opportunity to sell her merchandise from friends’ stalls in the market. For this, she pays them a percentage of her earnings and she generates income from various locations at the market. She visits each post very early in the morning to deliver her products, and later collects her profits. Additionally, she sells her wares on weekends at the different markets in her area walking from 9 am until 6 pm. However, this sacrifice has its reward in the income she earns with her sales. Kelly’s wish for the future is to have a set site where she can sell her clothes more easily and comfortably. This is the 13th credit with Microfinanzas PRISMA and what she most appreciates about her cooperative bank is the teamwork she has with the other members. Buying clothes during these months is very beneficial given that it’s winter, therefore the demand for warm clothing goes up and the 1,500 soles she requests will help her buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Avita

texts.en:
Avita A. is a 43-year-old native from Talibon, Bohol. She lives with her husband and their only child. She strongly believes that great things start from small beginnings simply because it is exactly happening to her. 

She has always dreamed of becoming a successful businesswoman, managing her own grocery or, who knows, a big department store someday! This has become her strong driving force to do her best in her present small business.

Presently, she is an active member of a growing microfinance operation in the Philippines, which is the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). This institution helps her by lending her Php 21,000 as her additional capital. Not just that – Avita is also benefited by CEVI’s other offerings like savings and insurance.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Ma. Bella

texts.en:
42-year-old Ma. Bella L. is truly an ambitious woman. But her dreams always focus on providing a good life for her husband and four children. So to support her husband in earning, she opened a small grocery store in their locality with only 5,000 Philippine Pesos as starting capital. As she paired her hark work with prayers, she was able to sustain her business, which is presently doing well.

She is currently applying for a loan at the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) amounting to 25,000 pesos. This will be used in the expansion of her business by purchasing additional stock for the store.

Although she often gets occupied with her business, she is grateful that CEVI is giving her the opportunity to learn from other people through their group meetings wherein everyone is given the chance to share his/her ideas while others are listening.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
With only Php 5,000.00 as a starting capital, 29-year-old Julieta L. was able to open a small grocery store beside their house in Talibon, Bohol. She formerly had a fishing business, but it turned out that the income from her fishing venture could not suffice for her family’s needs. Although her husband is earning money as well, Julieta fears that in the future, they might not be able to send their three children to college if she lets him earn alone.

Her store is presently operating at the average. But Julieta refuses to remain in this status. She wants to expand the business, which made her decide to ask for this loan through the Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI). She is happy that she can not only use this service, but also meet with her fellow members during their cluster meetings.

loans.use: To expand the business by purchasing more inventory

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Fish vending was 53-year-old Lorna A.’s previous livelihood. Later on, she found herself unfit to this field, since she experienced loss from fish vending. Instead of getting discouraged, she shifted her attention to sewing bridal dresses. Soon she was able to save enough capital to open a boutique. From this, she gets to support her husband in feeding their three children and providing their family needs.

Although her business is presently stable and growing, Lorna is requesting the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) to grant her a loan to expand her boutique. She aspires to have a tailoring shop in the future. Based on what she has learned at CEVI, this goal is just close at hand if she continues her hard work and pairs this with faith in the Almighty.

loans.use: materials for her boutique

loans.name: Winfrida

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Winfrida Mwipwelesa from Mbeya. She is widow with 2 children, ages 16 and 22. Winfrida has been running a shop since 2005. She sells items for use in the home, like rice, maize flour, cooking oil, salt, etc. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Winfrida currently earns about $100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil and soda. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her business. Winfrida thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by many other financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil and soda

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
With only one pumpboat, 49-year-old Virginia O. and her husband were able to start their fishing business. From here the couple was able to provide food on their table for their seven children and will hopefully be able to send them all to college. In the meantime, this is their source of income for meeting the family’s basic needs. But in order to realize their dream of having their children finish school, the couple sees the need to expand. Virginia hopes to acquire additional pumpboats towards this goal.

Her membership in the country’s growing micro-finance institution, the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) is benefiting her a lot. Presently, she is applying for a loan of Php 15,000.00. With this amount, she will be able to have their current pumpboat repaired, and buy fishing nets.

loans.use: pumpboat machine repair and purchase of fishing net

loans.name: Weleto

texts.en:
With only Php 3,000.00 starting capital, 48-year-old Weleto C. opened a small store in their area in 2006. His previous livelihood was farming. Although he was happy being a farmer before, he shifted to having a store in order to have an income that will meet the daily needs of the family. He wants to send their only child to school. 

Weleto is an active member of the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI), a growing microfinance institution in the Philippines. He is impressed with CEVI’s programs and the variety of services they’re offering to their clients. He is applying for this loan to be used as additional capital for his store. He is also blessed by the institution’s Biblical integration.

loans.use: Additional supplies

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Like most of the businessmen, Arlene A. also started her small store with only a minimal capital. Despite her young age (she’s 37), Arlene has a big dream for their family. She wants to be her husband’s partner in everything and that includes earning. She always envisioned her family living a more comfortable life in which, as parents, she and her husband can provide for both the needs and wants of their two children. Thus, she strives hard to increase her income so that she can open another business in the future. 

Arlene is an active member of the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI), a growing micro-finance institution in the Philippines. It is known for its wide variety of services, which includes the loan services that Arlene gets to enjoy at present. She is asking for this loan from CEVI to buy additional stocks for the store.

loans.use: To purchase stocks

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz es una mujer muy empeñosa en su rol como esposa y madre de 4 hijos, quienes son su mayor tesoro y a quienes trata de brindarles los mejores cuidados. Junto a su esposo, tener una casa propia donde habitar en familia fue algo que consiguió con mucho sacrificio. Apoyar a su pareja en los gastos del hogar fue determinante para ella, ya que trabajó en diversas actividades, pero desde hace 6 años se dedica a la administración de los motocarros que lograron comprar para alquilarlos a las personas que realizan transporte público. Debido a la delincuencia que hay su zona, cada vez que alquila uno de sus vehículos trata de fijarse muy bien en cada una de las personas que le soliciten el alquiler. Otra de las actividades que realiza es estar pendiente de los mantenimientos mecánicos de sus motocarros cada fin de mes para que estén permanentemente en óptimas condiciones. Los ingresos que recibe diariamente son de gran beneficio para su hogar, y por tal motivo, Luz desea adquirir otras movilidades para incrementar sus ganancias. Este es su 13avo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y en este tiempo ha trabajado con suma responsabilidad, al igual que sus compañeras de banco comunal. Los 1500 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de repuestos para uno de sus motocarros que necesita reparaciones para seguir con su normal funcionamiento.
texts.en:
Luz is a hard-working woman in her role as wife and mother of 4 children who are her greatest treasure and for whom she tries to provide more. With her husband, they have a home of their own which was obtained with much sacrifice. Supporting her partner with the household’s expenses was a deciding factor in her current occupation, as she had worked in various arenas before deciding to dedicate herself to public transportation 6 years ago. They managed to buy some vehicles that they rent to people who are in the transportation business. Due to the delinquency that abounds in her zone, each time she leases out one of her vehicles she examines each potential renter very carefully. Another activity she realizes is tending to the mechanical repairs and maintenance of her motocars at month-end to make sure they are operating at their best. The daily income she generates is very beneficial to her family and, for this reason, Luz would like to acquire more vehicles to increase revenue. This is her 13th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and, over this time, she has worked very responsibly like her other colleagues at the cooperative bank. She will invest the 1,500 soles she is requesting into repairs for one of her motocars that needs some work in order to continue to run.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts for her motocar.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
63-year-old Lucita D. understands the responsibilities of having a family. Although she and her husband were not blessed with a child, she still feels the need to have a stable job and business. Thus, she started a small grocery store with the help of her sister. Presently, the store has a good status, but Lucita won’t settle for the average. She wants to have additional capital to expand her business.

This is the reason why she joined the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI), a growing micro-finance institution in the Philippines known for its client-friendly services. Lucita is currently asking for a loan from CEVI. And as a member, she actively attends their meetings wherein she gets to mingle with her fellow members in sharing some Biblical reflections.

loans.use: goods for the store

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 29 years old. She is a married woman with two children. Both of her children are currently in school. She lives with her family at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. She is a baker who uses flour for her production, and has done so for eighteen years now, in spite of the challenges she faces. She bakes bread and other pastries frequently requested by her customers. She brings them to customers herself, in the market center. People also come to her to buy. Her only problem now has to do with a lack of adequate funds to buy raw materials, which are needed in order to meet the demand of her customers. She requests a loan support to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family and most especially her children's education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Despite her age, 21-year-old Julieta R. already knows the importance of taking responsibilities seriously. She got married and became a mother of one at a very young age, yet she knows her obligations very well. 

In order to contribute additional income in the family, Julieta used her experience in farming to start her own business. She confessed having only Php 2,000.00 as starting capital. But no one can really guess where one is heading, especially if that person exerts a lot of hard work and has unwavering determination. This is true of Julieta, who has a growing business at present.

Now, she actively participates in the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) and enjoys its quality services. Julieta is applying for a loan which she will use in purchasing fertilizers. She also finds CEVI to be a good avenue for improving her knowledge on handling business, through the institution’s free training and seminars.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 37 años, está casada, tiene un hijo y actualmente vive con su familia en la casa que con mucha dedicación y empeño lograron conseguir junto a su esposo. Ella siempre pensó en tener un negocio y gracias a su pareja logróinstalar una farmacia que es de gran apoyo en su distrito. Desde hace 10 años viene atendiendo a sus clientes con suma responsabilidad, tratando de brindarles los mejores medicamentos para el restablecimiento de su salud. Sin embargo no siempre contó con los medicamentos necesarios, ya que en sus inicios sólo tenía las medicinas básicas, lo que limitaba sus ventas, pero con el tiempo aprovechó la demanda y adquirió exhibidores y vitrinas, viéndose en la necesidad de alquilar un local amplio en la plaza de su distrito donde atiende hasta el día de hoy. Desde entonces, su negocio sigue ampliándose y Marlene espera pronto instalar otra farmacia, tiene la esperanza de que con el esfuerzo que realiza junto a su esposo lograrán alcanzar sus metas. Con parte de un banco comunal, la responsabilidad y orden que hay dentro de su grupo es lo que más le agrada, ya que puede confiar en cada una de sus compañeras. Este es su crédito número 13 con Microfinanzas PRISMA. Los 3000 soles que ahora solicita los usará en la compra de los medicamentos que requiere para instalar su nueva farmacia.
texts.en:
Marlene is 37 years old, married, has one child, and currently lives with her family in the house that she and her husband managed to buy with much hard work. She always thought about having a business and, thanks to her partner, she managed to install a pharmacy that provides services for her district. She has been attending to her customers very responsibly for more than 10 years, trying to provide the best medications to help restore health. Regardless, she didn’t always have all the necessary items in her inventory. At the onset of her business, she only carried basic medicines and this limited her sales. Over time, however, she took advantage of the demand and acquired display cases and windows and saw the need to rent a large enough space in her district. This is where she works to this day. Her business has been expanding, and Marlene hopes to open another drugstore soon. She hopes that, through her and her husband’s efforts, they will manage to reach their goals. The responsibility and order that exists within the group is what she most appreciates about being part of a cooperative bank, and she has confidence in each and every one of her colleagues. This is her 13th credit with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She will use the 3,000 soles she is now requesting to buy the medications she needs to open her new pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kelly Norca

texts.es:
La señora Kelly pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, estado civil casada, tienw 1 hijo.
Kelly cuenta con estudios superiores (profesora de Ingles), vive en el Jr. Lima Norte.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 01 año,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de azúcar, arroz, leche, gaseosa, etc. para surtir su tienda, además con parte del dinero quiere aumentar para la implementación de un nuevo negocio de servicio de Internet.

Su deseo es ampliar su negocio a un mini market, en el futuro comprarse una casita.

A ella le gustan las reuniones donde le dan buenas ideas, también le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Kelly belongs to the "Medalla Milagrosa" Communal Bank, which is located in the Pomata district, Chucuito province, Puno state. She is 27 years old, married, and has one child. Kelly has completed college coursework (English instruction). She lives in Jr. Lima Norte. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 1 year. Her first lone was for 500 soles, which she used to purchase groceries. She is now requesting a loan of 1,700 soles to purchase sugar, rice, milk, soft drinks, etc. to stock her store. With part of the money she would like to expand to put in a new business offering Internet service. She hopes to grow her business to a mini-market, and to purchase a home in the future. She enjoys meetings where good ideas are shared and she also likes savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, milk, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is 33 years old. She is divorced, and a mother with two children. Both of her children are in school in the community where they live. She lives with the children at Sefwi, in the western region of Ghana. Faustina works hard to provide food and school fees for the children as a single parent. She is a baker who uses flour for her production. She has been a baker for twelve years now, in spite of the challenges she faces. She prepares pastries like cake, meat pie, chips, etc., and sells them to her customers. She sells them to her customers by herself, in the market center. People also come to her to buy these goods. Her only problem now has to do with a lack of adequate funds to buy raw materials, as prices are going up. She requests this loan support in order to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family, and most importantly, the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites O., 39 years old, is very optimistic about life. She started a fishing business with a single unit pumpboat. Together with her husband, they pursued this venture despite the odds. Today, their business is growing and they hope to have more units of pumpboat soon. 

The driving force making the couple strive harder is their five children. They want to see all of them finish their college degrees and have a better life in the future.

Presently, Marites is asking the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) for a Php 10,000.00 loan that will be used to purchase fishing net. She trusts CEVI because this institution offers their clients a variety of good services.

loans.use: To purchase fishing net

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
In 1990, Benedicta V. started farming in her locality with only PHP 10,000.00 as her starting capital. Aside from that, she also has a store that still exists today and is growing. This is where Benedicta gets her source of income aside from her husband’s earnings from farming. She is now 54 years old but is still very active in her business because of her inspiration—to see their five children finish their studies and have a better quality of life someday.

This is the very reason why Benedicta keeps on striving to improve her farm and store. She is applying for a loan of PHP 7,000.00 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) and plans to purchase fertilizer and additional merchandise out of this amount. She finds confidence with CEVI since the institution offers insurance and savings for its members. Aside from these, there are a number of other services that CEVI offers to clients like Benedicta.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and additional merchandise

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 35 años, es una mujer que siempre trata de que su familia sea unida y viva de una forma armoniosa. Desde muy joven trabajó en diversas actividades con la finalidad de tener un negocio propio y desde que se casó tuvo la oportunidad de instalar una tienda dentro de su casa, la cual viene funcionando hace 5 años y donde ha puesto toda su dedicación. Pero a pesar todos sus cuidados no dejó de ser víctima de un robo, lo que la perjudicó mucho y para no pasar por la misma situación está modificando su casa para tener una mayor seguridad, pues ella atiende sola su negocio mientras sus hijos salen a estudiar. Con esta remodelación logrará alcanzar otra de sus metas que es de instalar un bar donde venda diversas bebidas, brindando así una mejor atención, tanto en su tienda como en su bar. Encontrarse en el treceavo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA le ha ayudado a desarrollar sus habilidades, puesto que dentro de su banco comunal las actividades y reuniones que desarrollan son de gran aprendizaje personal y social. Con los 3000 soles que solicita comprará algunos materiales de construcción para la remodelación de su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosario is 35 years old. She is a woman who always tries to have a close-knit and harmonious family. Since she was very young she has worked in various areas with the goal of having her own business. Upon getting married, she was able to set up a store inside her home. It has been in operation for 5 years and she is fully dedicated to it. Despite her taking precautions, her store was robbed. To prevent this from happening again, she is making improvements to her house so that it is more secure, as she takes care of the business alone while her children are in school. With this remodel she will also achieve one of her other goals which is to put in a bar where she can serve a variety of drinks, and provide better customer service, both in her store and in her bar. This is her thirteenth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA which has helped her develop her abilities. As part of her communal bank, she participates in activities and meetings that provide great personal and social learning. With the 3000 soles that she is requesting, she will purchase construction materials for her store remodel.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband and the children. Currently all her children are schooling in the junior and the primary level. She is a local manufacturer of soap. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to obtain her soap. She is not able to produce in large quantities due to lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to increase her income to support her children's education. It is her desire to provide a quality education for the children and would be grateful for that support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and processing equipment

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia A., 34 years old, is a native of Getafe, Bohol. She is married and is the mother of four. Her former experience as a saleslady has somewhat inspired her to start her own business. With PHP 6,000.00 as starting capital, she was able to establish a small store of goods. Along with this, she also has a videoke (singing) machine and computer games to meet her neighbors’ short time leisure. 

Since she wanted to expand her business, Cresencia applied for a PHP 12,000.00 loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI), a growing micro-finance institution in the Philippines. This amount will be used to purchase more goods for the store.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for the store

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Since 64-year-old Silvestra B. and her husband are childless, the couple spends most of their time earning to be able to extend help to their relatives. Though they never fail to spend quality time together, the couple is also determined to earn more to have their house renovated. 

In 1990, Silvestra started raising pigs with only PHP 3,000.00 as her starting capital. She has been able to sustain it so far. But she needs more money to buy more feed. Because of this, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000.00 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI), a growing microfinance institution in the Philippines. She is very positive that CEVI is her best partner in having a better life.

loans.use: To purchase feed and fertilizers

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is 30 years old, married and the mother of two children, who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking woman and because of her hard work, she is so loved by her husband and the children. She prepares and serves porridge in the community where she lives. Her porridge is enjoyed by many as breakfast and supper. Kate prepares a large quantity, and before the day ends, it all will be finished.

Recently she complains of a high increase in stock at the market, making it very difficult to meet the daily demand of her customers. She is requesting a loan to buy an increased stock of bread, eggs, milk, tea bags, etc. She believes her resources support her husband in taking care of the children. It is her dream to save more, to expand her business and to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To buy bread, sugar, tea, Milo, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica es una mujer muy alegre de 40 años, vive con su pareja en la casa de sus padres, donde habita en compañía de sus seres queridos. Sus ganas de trabajar la llevaron a aprender la elaboración de panecillos y con mucha práctica y dedicación pudo conocer nuevas formas para producir diversos bocaditos. Al principio fue difícil, sobre todo venderlos de forma ambulante, ya que la mayoría de las personas tienen desconfianza de comer en la calle, pero al probar el dulce sabor de sus pasteles comenzaron a ser muy demandados y Verónica aprovechó esta oportunidad atendiendo todos los pedidos que le hacían. Ahora es muy conocida en su localidad y su empeño de salir adelante la sigue llevando cada fin de semana al mercado central de su ciudad donde obtiene mayores ganancias. Esta dinámica de trabajo le da la oportunidad de ahorrar con el fin de instalar una panadería y una fuente de soda donde pueda atender a sus clientes y seguir distribuyendo sus pedidos. Ella se encuentra en su treceavo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y aprecia mucho el trabajo dentro del banco comunal que conforma, pues todas las actividades son realizadas con interacción de todos los miembros. Los 2500 soles que viene solicitando los invertirá en la compra de ingredientes y utensilios para seguir elaborando sus deliciosos pasteles.
texts.en:
Verónica is 40 years old and a very cheerful woman. She lives with her partner in her parents' home in the company of their loved ones. Due to her willingness to work, she learned how to make bread rolls, and through lots of practice and dedication, started to find new ways to produce various snacks. She found it difficult being a traveling saleswoman because most people have a distrust of eating food sold on the street. Once customers sampled the taste of her sweet pastries, demand for her products increased and Verónica took advantage of this opportunity. She is now well known in her community and her commitment to success continues. She sells her products in the central market every weekend in order to maximize her profits. Her work provides her with the opportunity to save towards starting a bakery and installing a soda fountain where she can continue fulfilling her customers’ orders.

Verónica is now on her thirteenth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She appreciates the work of her communal bank group because the activities require the interaction of all members. Her loan of 2500 soles will be used to purchase ingredients and utensils needed to make her delicious pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 68 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en el Barrio las Peñas.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 06 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de incienso, copal (palitos de madera), dulces y figuras, estos se utilizan en los rituales de agradecimiento a la tierra (creencias de la zona). 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de Incienso, copal (figuras de dulces), dulces, mesas de salud (figuras de personas, animales, otros elaboradas con dulces), etc.  Este negocio solo lo lleva a las ferias de las comunidades cercanas a Pomata.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando. A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos y las reuniones de Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the "Medalla Milagrosa" Communal Bank, which is located in the Pomata district, Chucuito province, Puno state. She is 68 years old, widowed, and has not completed elementary education (3rd grade). She lives in Barrio las Peñas. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 6 years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to buy incense, copal, sweets, and figurines, which are used in rituals to thank the land (local beliefs). She is requesting a loan of 500 soles to purchase incense, copal (figures of sweets), sweets, "mesas de salud" (figurines of people, animals, and others, made with sweets), etc. She only operates this business in the fairs of the communities close to Pomata. Her hope is to continue working. She likes the ease of the loans the meetings of the Communal Banks.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of incense, copal, sweets, mesas de salud, etc.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.en:
Abelardo Y., 41, is a native of San Miguel, Bohol. He is a farmer. He was happy with farming yet he also felt the need to have a daily income to provide for his wife and four children. That’s why in 2006, he acquired a motorcycle and started transporting people in their locality and in neighboring towns as well.

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers for his farm. It’s been three years since his acquisition of the motorcycle and he needs Php 8,000 now for its maintenance. He is asking for this amount from the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) as a loan. He is satisfied with his membership in CEVI because aside from loans, part of his income is set aside as savings and kept safe by the institution for Abelardo.

loans.use: Fertilizers and motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Zamda

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Zamda S. from Mbeya. She is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 25. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent who is an orphan because her parents died of HIV. 

Zamda has been running a “genge” business since 2002. A genge (grocery store) is usually a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof, where general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice and dried fish are sold. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, seven days per week. Zamda currently earns about $90 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional stock of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil and soda. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her business and to open the same business at new location.

Zamda  thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil and soda

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Her dream of having a big grocery store encouraged 28-year-old Hazel S. to apply as a sales lady. However, she felt so unhappy and bored, she resigned. Her dream continued to chase her so she decided in 2000 to open a small store beside their house in Talibon, Bohol. It may sound impossible, but Hazel opened her store with only Php 4,000 as capital. Because of this, she was able to support her husband in paying their two children’s school fees and paying for their basic needs as well. 

Hazel is an active member of Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) and is applying for a loan of Php 8,000. She will use this to purchase additional stock for the store. 

In CEVI, Hazel is able to mingle with her fellow members. During their meetings, she always feels refreshed by God’s word in their biblical reflection.

loans.use: Additional stock

loans.name: Guinda

texts.en:
Guinda B., 52, has a stable farming business. Yet she admits that the process of getting to her present status was very tough. She faced the ups and down of farming. But her big struggle was being unable to support every need of their two children. Thus, together with her husband, Guinda strives to improve their business. 

She joined a growing microfinance institution in the Philippines called Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) and observed what assistance this MFI could extend to her and to other striving business-fellows. Finally, she found out that she’s on the right track because CEVI offers a variety of good services to clients like her. That includes the granting of loans, which Guinda is applying for now. She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She also enjoys the insurance benefits.

loans.use: Fertilizers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 54, married and a mother with six children. Among the children, one is schooling and the rest are currently working. Margaret is a resourceful mother who works very hard to provide food for the children. She is a petty trader who sells in the community market of Sefwi Bekwai, where she lives. She sells items like cassava, spices, vegetables, yams, etc., and she has been in business for 30 years. She requests a loan to buy more foodstuffs like cassava, yams, vegetables, etc. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like cassava, yams, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
With a Php 3,000.00 starting capital, 34-year-old Rowena O. was able to start her lamination business. Although her first love is music, she did not pursue it because she was not contented with her income. In her present business, she is able to help her husband with their spending including the school fees of their two kids. 

In order to improve her business, Rowena joined the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) and started to avail herself of its wide variety of services. In fact, she is currently applying for a Php 10,000.00 loan from CEVI that will be used in purchasing equipment for lamination.

loans.use: For lamination equipment

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Feeling unhappy and bored, 53 year-old Tita D. had to stop her previous work as a sales lady and shift to the things she’s more interested in. She opened a small store beside their house in Getafe, Bohol with only Php 4,000.00 as the starting capital. She also ventured on fish vending and finds she is interested in it. She even dreams of having a fish farm someday. This enables her to support her husband in providing for their needs especially for the education of their child.

Tita is applying for a loan from the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) to improve her businesses. Php 9,000.00 will be enough to purchase more fish and stock for her store. She also appreciates CEVI’s advocacy to promote the importance of saving to their clients.

loans.use: For fish and stock

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a 42 year old woman. She is married and a mother of five children. Through hard work, she has managed to send her children to school. She is a food vendor who sells banku and rice with stew in her neighborhood. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper or soup and fried fish.

She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy banku as breakfast, lunch and supper. Faustina wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her children especially in their education.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is 36 years old and married with five children. For the past ten years she has been a trader in maize cereals, and very resourceful to her family. She treks to farming communities to buy cereals and then sells them to her customers.
