They own their own minibus and keep their registration documents in order so that they can operate their travel route with minimal restrictions. Leoncia is responsible for collecting payments from passengers while her husband is in charge of driving. This is a family business because their son has accompanied them ever since he was a baby. Their days off only occur when maintenance is performed on their vehicle or if drivers undergo training, in which her husband’s attendance is mandatory. All these years of work have been very profitable for her family because this business is not only their livelihood but it has also strengthened their relationship. Their future plans include acquiring a new vehicle to increase their profits.

This is Leoncia’s sixth loan with MFP. She is recognized by her communal bank group for her perseverance and entrepreneurial attitude. For her part, she promises to continue working for the welfare of the group. Her loan will be used to pay for maintenance, paint and replacement of the seats of her minibus.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of her minibus

loans.name: Armando José

texts.es:
Armando R. F. es un señor de 26 años de edad. Vive con su esposa y su hija, en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros  sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Desde los 18 años Armando se ha dedicado al transporte. Su labor es viajar alrededor del país entregando mercadería con su camión, sus jornadas de trabajos son muy largas y atareadas. 

Debido a tanto desplazamiento en su camión, este ha sufrido diferentes daños y no está en muy buenas condiciones, por lo cual Armando requiere un préstamo de ¢685,000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para la reparación y compra de repuestos para su vehículo, ya que si no esta en condiciones apropiadas no puede realizar de forma efectiva su trabajo.

Armando forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo pero Armando destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Armando R. F. is 26-year-old man. He lives with his wife and daughter in a rural community in Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones is a community located 150 kilometers south of the province of San José, the capital of Costa Rica. It is 850 meters above sea level. Vegetables and coffee are cultivated here, and they also carry out other activities such as raising cattle and pigs to fatten. There are also some organic agriculture projects and hydroponic vegetables. In addition to agriculture, there are also mechanic shops, a supermarket, small restaurants (called ‘sodas’), and a furniture store in the community.

Armando has worked in transport since he was 18 years old. His job is to travel around the country delivering merchandise with his truck. His work hours are very long and busy.

Because he has used his truck so much to travel, it has suffered different damages and it is not in very good condition. As a result, he is asking for a loan of 685,000 CRC for the repair and purchase of spare parts for his vehicle because if it is not in appropriate condition, he cannot do his job effectively.

Armando is part of the Bancruce Communal Finance Institution, one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, but Armando emphasizes that thanks for this type of organization and their means for facilitating loans, he can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of truck spare parts

loans.name: Lui

texts.es: Lui tiene 31 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a pintar autos en un espacio que alquiló de un taller de mecánica; su trabajo es diario y sólo descansa los domingos, pues cada labor dura varios días para que el acabado sea lo más perfecto posible, ya que de eso depende la recomendación de sus clientes para adquirir nuevos contratos. Esta actividad le resulta rentable porque las personas pagan un buen precio por el servicio que les brinda y esto anima a Lui a planificar su futuro arrendando un local amplio donde cuente con espacio necesario para mejorar el servicio que brinda. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, en su grupo destaca como una persona colaboradora y perseverante. En esta oportunidad, Lui renueva su compromiso de seguir trabajando con responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de esmalte para carros y de una pistola para pintar.
texts.en:
Lui is 31 years old and lives in a rented house with his wife and son. He has painted cars for the past 3 years in a space that he has rented at a mechanic shop. He works everyday and only rests on Sundays. Each job takes several days to complete so that the finished product is as perfect as possible. He depends on customer recommendations to acquire new contracts. This work is profitable for him because people pay a good sum for the service that he provides. This encourages Lui to plan his future renting a spacious place where he has the necessary space to improve the service he provides. This is his sixth loan with MFP. In his group he stands out as a collaborating and perseverant person. With this opportunity, Lui is renewing his commitment to continue working responsibly in repaying his loans. The money that he is asking for will be used to purchase paint and a paint gun.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of car paint and tools for his work

loans.name: Zapatito Veloz Group

texts.es: “Zapatito veloz” es un grupo de señoras que trabajan alegremente junto a su asesora de crédito y cuentan con 12 integrantes. Marcelina A. es una de las más antiguas socias, ella cuenta que hubo un tiempo en que decidió dejar a su grupo, pero con el pasar del tiempo extraño a sus amigas y decidió regresar, además dice que en otras entidades financieras les piden garantías reales para acceder al préstamo y en  Pro Mujer solo piden la garantía solidaria. Todas las integrantes tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de refresco, ropa, pastelería, muebles, fruta, cafetería, carnicería, ellas necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería o instrumentos de trabajo como licuadora, carrito para llevar las frutas, mueble para exponer los pasteles.
texts.en:
“Zapatito veloz” is a group of ladies who work happily together with their credit assessor. There are twelve members of the group/ Marcelina A. is one of their oldest members, and she remembers that there was a time when she decided to leave the group, but as time went by she missed her friends and decided to go back to the group. She also says that in other financial groups they ask for cash guaruntees in order for the loan to be processed, but in Pro Mujer there only ask for a verbal one. All the members have different businesses like selling soft drinks, clothes, confectionary, furniture, fruit, coffee, meat, and they need the loan to buy merchandise or instruments for work like blenders or a cart to carry fruit in or a table to put display their cakes on.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchanise and work tools/COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y HERRAMIENTAS DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 10 años trabaja como comerciante, pero hace un año atrás decidió comenzar a  vender chupetes (de hielo) de fruta, utilizando como sus principales herramientas de trabajo a su refrigeradora y licuadora. Se levanta temprano por la mañana para la comprar la fruta fresca que pelará, licuará y envasará en delgadas bolsitas de plástico que dejar congelar un promedio de 3 horas. Aproximadamente a las 11am sale a vender en las principales calles de su ciudad, ofreciendo sus sabrosos chupetes a los pasajeros de las diferentes líneas de transporte y demás personas que estén transitando. Marisol aprovecha cada luz roja, cuando se detienen los carros para ofrecer sus productos a los choferes y pasajeros de los vehículos de transporte público. Ella considera este negocio muy rentable porque obtiene las ganancias diarias y para más adelante desea incrementar su producción contratando a personas que repartan y vendan en otros lugares. Esta es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal y se compromete a seguir trabajando por el bienestar común. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de frutas al por mayor y la reparación de su refrigeradora.
texts.en:
Marisol is 49 years old and lives with her husband and her 2 children in a rented house. She has worked as a merchant for 10 years, but one year ago she decided to start selling fruit popsicles, using her refrigerator and blender as her main work tools. She gets up early in the morning to buy fresh fruit to peel, blend, and pack in small plastic bags that she leaves to freeze for an average of 3 hours. At around 11am she leaves for the main streets of her city, offering her delicious popsicles to the passengers of different public transportation and to the rest of people that are traveling. Marisol takes advantage of every red light when the cars stop so that she can offer her products to the drivers and passengers of the public transportation vehicles. She considers this business to be very profitable because she has daily income. In the future she wants to increase her production, hiring people to distribute and sell in other places. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy to be part of her communal bank and she is committed to continue working for the communal well-being. The money that she is asking for will be used to purchase wholesale fruits and for the repair of her refrigerator.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and the repair of her refrigerator

loans.name: Mejalbeth

texts.es: Mejalbeth tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 años tiene un taller donde fabrica muebles; junto a su esposo realizan los diseños de acuerdo al pedido del cliente y también realizan el cambio total y reparación del forro de los sillones dejándolos como nuevos. Su esposo es el encargado de hacer las estructuras de madera y ella se encarga del relleno y tapizado, dándoles el acabado final. Mejalbeth realiza este trabajo generalmente por las tardes, ya que por las mañanas realiza las labores domésticas. Debido a la calidad de los servicios que brindan los clientes han aumentado y son estables, eso es muy favorable para la sostenibilidad de su negocio, por lo que están planificando para el futuro ampliar sus horizontes de venta. Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella se siente muy comprometida y está dispuesta a seguir colaborando para el desarrollo de su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de telas para tapizado y pegamento industrial.
texts.en:
Mejalbeth is 33 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home. She has been operating a furniture workshop for more than 5 years. Together with her husband, they design pieces based on customer specifications and also reupholster armchairs, making them look like new. Her husband is in charge of the wooden framing, while she takes care of the upholstery, trim and finishing details. Mejalbeth generally works on furniture in the evenings and reserves her mornings for household chores. Due to the quality of services they offer, she and her husband have developed a reliable client base that is growing. To promote the sustainability of their business, they plan to increase their sales in the near horizon.

This is Mejalbeth’s seventh loan with MFP. She feels very committed and is prepared to continue the development of her communal bank group. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase upholstery cloth and industrial adhesives.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and industrial adhesives

loans.name: Elizabeth Benita

texts.es: La Sra, Elizabeth Z., cliente que trabajo en grupo solidario Sureñas, desde al año 2004, durante diecisiete secuencias, ahora solicita credito individual, ya que por el monto decidieron individualizarse cada una de las integrantes del grupo, ella solicita para aumentar capital en su negocio, la Sra. tiene dos hijas en edad escolar que ella las mantiuene, ya que se separo de su esposo y vive en la casa de sus padres, solo trabaja con credito en Emp`render y es una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Z. has been a client since 2004, working with the Sureñas solidarity group for 17 loan cycles. Now she is asking for an individual loan because the group members decided to apply for loans individually because of the sum of the loan. She is asking for a loan to increase the capital of her business. Elizabeth has two school-age daughters that she supports because she separated from her husband and lives in her parents’ house. She only works with loans from Emprender and she is a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of acrylic thinner and hardware merchandise

loans.name: Heydi Sugey

texts.es: Heydi Sugey G. T. tiene la edad de 32 años. Es una mujer casada. La actividad económica de Heydi es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio esta actividad por la necesidad de obtener un medio de vida, debido a la situación económica que ella enfrentaba no pudo seguir estudiando, ella ha luchado mucho por salir adelante, además de ofrecer estos productos también ofrece un poco de granos básicos. La ubicación de su negocio en es un pequeño establecimiento en el mercado, es aquí donde ofrece leche, cuajad, queso y mantequilla. El dinero que  está solicitando es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como leche y granos básicos. El sueño de Heydi es ampliar su negocio para tener el espacio suficiente para sus productos.
texts.en:
Heydi Sugey G. T. is 32 years old and married. Heydi sells milk products, and has been doing this for over 10 years. She started this business because she needed to make a living; due to the economic situation she was faced with, she was not able to pursue studies. She has fought much to keep herself afloat. In addition to offering these products, she also stocks a small amount of basic grains. Her business is in a small establishment at the market, which is where she sells milk, cuajad, cheese, and butter. The money she is requesting is for working capital so that she can buy raw materials, like milk, and basic grains. Heydi's dream is to grow her business to so that she can have enough space for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ramona Justina

texts.es: Ramona Justina F. P. tiene la edad de 59 años. Es una mujer viuda. Tiene 2 hijos.  Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ramona se dedica a la venta de carne. Ella da inicio a este negocio porque su esposo distribuía la carne en una bicicleta a sus clientes, por lo que decide establecer su propio negocio en su vivienda. A pesar de que su principal desafío es su salud por lo que algunas veces no podía atender su negocio, y fue uno de los problemas que supero. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de carne. El sueño de Ramona es que sus hijos continúen con esta actividad económica para que el día de mañana puedan sobrevivir con esto.
texts.en:
Ramona Justina F. P. is 59, and she is a widow with two children. She has been in this business for over 15 years. She sells meat. She started this business because her husband delivered the meat to their customers on his bicycle. She decided to set up her own business in her home. In spite of the fact that her biggest challenge is her health, and there were times she could not tend to the business, it was one just one of the problems that she overcame. The loan she is asking for is to buy meat. Ramona’s dream is that her children continue on in this business so that they can survive by it in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Media Luna Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal Los Andes se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Media Luna”, cuenta con 12 integrantes que tienen negocios pequeños tales como vender dulces, comida, juguetes, ropas, perfumes, pasteles y tejido de chompas. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería o para comprar instrumentos de trabajo como, carrito para llevar su mercadería a las diferentes ferias, máquina de tejer y  mueble para exponer los pasteles. Lidia C. es la presidenta de la Asociación y vende pasteles, ella espera que a todas las integrantes les vaya bien en sus negocios  y cumplir puntualmente con los pagos.
texts.en:
The association "Media Luna" is located in the center of the Andes mountains. The association consists of 12 members who own small businesses and sell items such as sweets, food, toys, clothes, perfumes, pastries, and sweaters. All the members need this loan to buy merchandise or business items such as a cart to take merchandise to various street markets, a sewing machine, or a table for the display of pastries. Lidia C. is the president of the group. She sells pastries. She hopes and expects that all members will be successful in their businesses and will make their loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and tools for work

loans.name: Esperanza Aurora

texts.es:
La sra. Esperanza pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 2 están a su cargo.  Tiene estudios de primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 06 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de harina para la preparación de pan. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de harina, azúcar, e insumos para la preparación de pan, ella luego los vende en el mercado de Pomata.

Su deseo es comprase una casita en Puno.

A ella le gusta la forma de trabajo y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Esperanza belongs to the Medalla Milagrosa Community Bank, which is located in the Pomata district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 50, married, and has five children. Two of her children are dependents. She has an elementary school education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy flour to make bread. She now needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy flour, sugar, and ingredients to make bread. She will then sell the bread in the Pomata market. Her wish is to buy a small house in Puno. She likes the way they work and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos Manuel M. tiene la edad de 39 años. Es un hombre muy trabajador y dinámico. Y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Desde muy joven se dedico al trabajo, Carlos inicio este negocio por su esposa, pero debido a las difíciles circunstancias económicas que atraviesan su esposa tuvo que emigrar a otro país para sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que ahora él se dedica a cuidar de la pulpería. Carlos tiene muchos clientes que recurren a su pulpería porque ofrece los productos más necesarios, para el hogar. El destino del dinero será para la compra de granos básicos y un poco de cosméticos. El sueño de Carlos es que  reunir a su familia y estar feliz con su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel M. is 39. He is a very hard working and dynamic man. He is raising two children. He has been working since he was very young. Carlos started this business for his wife. But, due to their difficult economic circumstances, his wife had to migrate to another country to help her family get ahead. Now he tends the mini market. Carlos has lots of customers who come to his mini market because he carries the products that are most necessary for the home. The money is to buy basic grains and a small amount of cosmetics. Carlos’ dream is to reunite his family and to be happy with his wife and children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Asunción

texts.es:
La señora Asunción tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el distrito de las Delicias , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta quinto de primaria, tiene 4 hijos, ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
Asunción se dedica a la venta de pescado en el mercado y en la tienda de su casa, en los meses de verano vende cervezas y gaseosas. 
Este es su primer préstamo, ella requiere 300 soles que piensa invertirlo en la compra de javas de pescado que los congelará en su nevera.
Asunción  tiene como sueño compraraproductos alimenticios como:  arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite, etc  para implementar la tienda en su casa y vender todos los meses del año, y comprar un puesto en el primer piso del mercado de Moche.
texts.en:
Asunción is 51. She lives in the Delicias district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She has a fifth grade education. She has four independent children. Asunción sells fish in the market and in the store in her house. In the summer months she sells beer and soft drinks. This is her first loan. She needs 300 PEN to buy fish that she will keep in her refrigerator. Asuncion’s dreams are to buy food products like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and oil, etc. to set up a store in her house; to sell every month of the year; and to buy a stand on the first floor of the Moche market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish

loans.name: Mayra Luisa

texts.es: Mayra Luisa tiene 46 años y es madre de 2 hijos que aun dependen de ella y que están estudiando. La ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda, por lo que ha sido difícil salir adelante con esta situación que enfrentamos y además hacerse cargo de los pagos de la escuela de sus hijos, pero Mayra es una mujer muy responsable y sobre todo muy emprendedora y a pesar de esto ha sabido sacar adelante a su familia, todos los días se levanta muy temprano para dedicarse a los quehaceres del hogar y además atender su negocio. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, jabón y golosinas en general. Su deseo es preparar a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien para la vida.
texts.en:
Mayra Luisa is 46 years old and is a mother of two children that are students and still dependents. The location of her business is in a modest dwelling, which has made it difficult to get ahead in this situation that we are facing and additionally be in charge of paying for her children's schooling. However, Mayra is a very responsible and, above all, enterprising woman and in spite of these difficulties she has known how to keep her family going. Every day she gets up very early to do household chores and to tend to her business too. The money that she is requesting is for working capital in order to buy staple grains, detergents, soap and sweets. Her desire is to prepare her children to be good people.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy staple grains, detergents, soap and sweets.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dina Rebeca

texts.es: Dina Rebeca Téllez M. tiene la edad de 28 años. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Por lo que cada día, busca como proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día, Dina realiza las visitas por medio de catálogos sus vecinos son muy buenos clientes, y también sus familiares para ofrecerles diversos productos, durante su horas de trabajo distribuye sus pedidos y realiza las cobranzas, pero lo que más pide es obtener el crédito con otras casas comerciales para ofrecer una variedad de productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para adquirir varios productos como perfumes, cremas y pintura de uñas. Su deseo es incrementar su negocio y extenderlos a otras zonas de su municipio.
texts.en:
Dina Rebeca Téllez M. is 28 years old. She is a very hard-working woman and lives with her husband and three children. As for her work, she sells cosmetics. As for her everyday life, she seeks to provide her family with its daily bread. Dina makes visits with catalogs to offer her neighbors and family members various cosmetic products. They are very good customers and during her work hours she distributes their orders and collects payments. But what she would like most is to obtain a loan to use with other commercial distributors in order to offer a variety of products. The funds that she is requesting are for working capital in order to acquire various products such as perfumes, lotions and nail polish. Her hope is to expand her business and extend it to other parts of her city.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es: José Tomas M. M. tiene la edad de 48 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de José es la ventad e granos básicos. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que fue con capital propio, por que tenía la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia, su familia tiene muchas dificultades económicas, pero esto no impide que José sea un hombre responsable y cariñoso con su familia, a pesar de las circunstancias él ha hecho de todo para salir adelante. Por lo que el dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de detergentes, jabón, arroz, frijoles, jugos y gaseosa. El deseo de José es mejorar sus ingresos para propiciarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
José Tomas is 48 years old. He is a married man and has four children that he is responsible for. José works selling staple grains. He has been dedicated to his business, which he began with his own capital because he needed to generate income for his family, for over 20 years. His family has many economics difficulties but this doesn't stop José from being responsible and loving with his family. Despite the circumstances, he has done all he can to get ahead. As far as the money that he is requesting, it is for working capital for buying detergents, soap, rice, beans, juice and soft drinks. José's wish is to improve his income in order to provide his family with the necessities of life.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Jeaneth Del Socorro

texts.es: Jeaneth del Socorro S. P. tiene la edad de 30 años. Tiene 1 hijo y depende de ella. Jeaneth se dedica a la venta de joyas. Su negocio inicio hace 7 años en esta actividad. Por lo que sus amigas son sus principales clientes, actualmente ha aumentado sus clientes por lo que tiene más pedidos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pulseras, cadenas, aretes y tobilleras. El deseo de Jeaneth es que nunca le ocurra nada malo ya que muchas veces viaja a lugares muy largos con todos sus productos.
texts.en:
Jeaneth is thirty years old and has one son that is dependent upon her. Jeaneth sells jewelry. She has had this business for seven years. Her friends are her main customers. Her customer base is growing as she has had more requests for her product lately. The financing that she is asking for is for working capital in order to buy bracelets, chains, earrings and ankle bracelets. Jeaneth hopes that nothing bad will happen to her because she travels long distances with all her products.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo A. M. es un señor de 35 años el cual vive con su esposa y  cuatro hijos en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros  sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Desde hace poco más de dos años que don Guillermo se dedica a la ebanistería. Construye muebles de diferentes diseños y para diferentes usos. Dice que desde que inició el proyecto los resultados han sido buenos, ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación en su comunidad y los ingresos que ha generado lo han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.
 
En estos momentos lo que desea don Guillermo es solicitar un préstamo  por ¢685,000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar más madera y otros materiales que necesita para la elaboración de los muebles. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida. 

Don Guillermo forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socio ha recibido un  microcrédito que le han permitido crecer como microempresarios.
texts.en:
Guillermo A. M. is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and four children in a rural community in Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones is a town located 150 kilometers south of San José Province, the capital of Costa Rica. It is 850 meters above sea level. Vegetables and coffee are farmed there and people also engage in other economic activities such as fattening cattle and hogs. There are also some organic agriculture projects, such as hydroponic vegetables. In addition to agriculture, the community has mechanic shops, a supermarket, small restaurants, and a furniture workshop. Guillermo has been working as a carpenter for a little more than two years. He makes furniture in a variety of styles and for different uses. He says that since he started this business, things have gone well for him. The business has been well accepted in his community and the income it has generated has helped him to support his family. At this time Guillermo is requesting a loan of 685,000 CRC to buy more wood and other materials that he needs to make the furniture. With this, he hopes that his small business will grow and that it will generate enough income for him to improve his living conditions. Guillermo is part of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce, one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. As a member, he has received a small loan that has allowed him to grow like other small business owners.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is from the village of Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare food for sale. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Josephine plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Ma. Carmen

texts.en:
Ma. Carmen P. is from the village of Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, and is married with seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Carmen owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Ma. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ma. Carmen joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Carmen has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her manicure and pedicure business

loans.name: Teosan

texts.en:
Teosan S. is from the village of Gango, Ozamis City. She is 49 years old, and is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Teosan owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Teosan has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Teosan joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teosan has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP, which she will use to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her general store business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora R. is from the village of Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, and is widowed with one adult-aged child. To make a living, Leonora owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Leonora joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda D. is from the village of Kinuman Sur, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, and married with one young child. To make a living, Merlinda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Merlinda joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Sara M. from Mbeya. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 1 and 10. Sara has been running a clothes shop since 2002. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Sara currently earns about 80 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothes for her business. In the future, she plans to increase the size and range of her business. Sara thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a small entrepreneur from Pavlograd where she sells furniture in one of the local malls. She is married and has two daughters who are 22 and 7. Olga’s little store is known for its nice selection of good quality furniture pieces. Moreover, it has a favorable location which makes it very convenient for potential customers. Olga has been in the trade for three years. Her business has grown up to 70,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her monthly profit amounts to 6,000 Grivnyas.  

Olga is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to open her second vending location. She has proved to be a reliable borrower as she has promptly repaid all previous loans without any delinquencies. Olga is hoping to keep her business sustainable and grow it consistently as she seeks to provide for her family’s needs and make sure they have everything they need.

loans.use: To open a new vending location

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is married with a grown daughter. She is a small entrepreneur from Belaya Tserkov selling children's footwear and clothing from two vending locations in her hometown. Lubov has been in business for three years. Presently, she has about 60,000 Grivnyas invested in her business. Her net profit amounts to 6,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Lubov is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to increase her inventory. She is hoping to purchase school uniforms in bulk for upcoming school year. Financial assistance will help Lubov generate additional profit as she sells this seasonal merchandise. Lubov is hoping to use the generated profit to help her daughter financially and get a more stable standing in life. She can be characterized as a very energetic, enterprising and friendly person, which helps her a lot in her business endeavors.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Sergyi

texts.en:
Sergyi is married with a toddler son. His family lives in Drogobych. Sergyi sells men's and women's clothing items in the local marketplace of his hometown. He started this small venture four years ago. Currently, his business has grown up to 10,000 Grivnyas in inventory. 

Today Sergyi is seeking a 6,000 Grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise. Fellow businessmen always characterize Sergyi as a hard-working, reserved and determined entrepreneur. He sets challenging goals and always achieves them -- even at very high cost. We believe these personal characteristics will assist Sergyi in his further endeavors to expand his trade and grow his small business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Christina M. from Mbeya. She is single. Christina has been running a used clothes store since 2002. Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Tanzania to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets and in the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost, and the general appeal of anything modern. 

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Christina currently earns about US$90 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothes for her business. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her business. Christina thanks you for your support!

They sell different designs of ready-made clothes for both ladies and gents. They fulfill all the needs of the family with the shop’s income.

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Mrs. Jamuna K. is a tailor in the town of Patan. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies long dresses, Makhshi and others. 

Before starting her own business, Mrs. Jamuna took a year training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her locality.

She plans to use the loan of 10,000NPR to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to use the shop's income for self-improvement and for her son's education. In Nepal, the cost of good education is very high. 

Her husband, Mr. Raju K., is a driver. Her son is in primary school.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Mercy K. from Mbeya. She is married with a 5-year-old child. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. 

Mercy has been running a tailoring business since 2002. She purchases vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and makes them into clothing mainly for women.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Mercy currently earns about US$80 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase tailoring material for her business. In the future, she plans to improve the quality and range of her product. Mercy thanks you for your support!

loans.name: Mohan Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Mohan Maiya R. lives in Tangal, located in Lalitpur district, an area where most people are engaged in small business. Mohan has two sons, one currently studying in grade 12 and the other passing his SLC (School Leaving Certificate) exam this year.

Both she and her husband operate a small restaurant, a business they started nine years ago. They sell a variety of items, including tea, coffee and Newari food for which there is a high demand. Now Mohan is requesting a loan of Rs 30,000 loan to both expand her business and purchase necessary food materials.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her business.

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Mrs. Jamuna S. lives in Sundhara. Sundhara is located in lalitpur district, where most people are engaged in small businesses. Jamuna lives in a single family unit with her husband and their two sons. Her husband, Mr. Dhruba S., works at his own motorcycle workshop. Her older son is studying in grade 9, and her younger son is studying in grade 5.

Jamuna is engaged in the business of weaving wool sweaters, caps, gloves, socks, and other such clothing items. She accepts orders from dealers, and then she sells her goods to the local people. At present, due to the summer season, there is less demand for her wool goods, but she sells enough to cover her family's household expenses. Jamuna is now requesting a loan in the amount of $275 (20,000 NPR) to buy wool for her weaving work.

loans.use: To purchase additional wool for her weaving business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional goods

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Sophia C. from Mbeya. She is married and has two children. One child is 11 years old, and the other child is 17 years old. In addition, she is responsible for supporting 20 dependants (they are orphans).

Ever since 1992, Sophia has been operating an agriculture (crop) business. In particular, she purchases and sells crops for a profit. She works at her business 9-12 hours per day and 6 days per week. At present, Sophia currently earns approximately $110 per month from her business operations. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $775 to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a new location. Sophia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing, which helps to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. You see, customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral, women in Tanzania are not considered credit-worthy by financial institutions. As a result, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support; further, such women only have limited access to basic needs and services. SELFINA engages in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania when it buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional crops in bulk

loans.name: Ganga Devi

texts.en: Ganga Devi M. is engaged in the business of weaving wool sweaters, caps, gloves, socks, bags, and other such wool items.  To illustrate, she accepts orders for dresses from her customers, and then she makes them according to their demands.  She has been in this line of work for the past 6 years, but she also works for the government.  Now, she is seeking a loan in the amount of $275 (20,000 NPR) in order to buy wool for her business operations.  She notes that she has one daughter, and that she got married one year ago.

loans.use: To purchase additional wool for her weaving business

loans.name: Susma

texts.en:
Susma M. lives in Sundhara, which is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses. She lives with her extended family, which includes her mother-in-law, sister-in-law, husband and one daughter, who is eighteen months old. Her husband works in a snack-making factory.

Susma is engaged in the weaving of woolen sweaters, gloves, caps and similar items. She takes orders from the dealers and she gives work to the local people. She took two months of training for this work. Now she is requesting a loan of 20000 NPR to buy wool for her business.

loans.name: Narayan Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Narayan Devi K. lives in Sundhara, which is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses.

Mrs. K. lives in a single family dwelling with her husband and three children. She has two sons and one daughter. Her younger son and her daughter are studying in high school. She opened her meat shop six months ago, selling buffalo meat. Her husband and older son help in the shop. Now she is requesting a loan of 20000 NPR to buy a deep freeze for storing meat.

loans.use: To buy a deep freeze

loans.name: Grover Gerardo

texts.es:
"Don Grover, trabaja de barman en el café La Terraza, del cual recibe un sueldo y propinas, a parte de esta actividad trabaja en sociedad con su hermano con la venta de café capuchino, jugo de naranja en las diferentes ferias importantes que se realizan en todo el país a través del alquiler de stands.

El destino del dinero está dirigido a la compra de una cafetera más grande de una maquina para hacer espuma para la preparación del capuchino."
texts.en:
Don Grover works as a bartender in the cafe "La Terraza" where a base salary and tips. Aside form his work at the cafe he works among society with his brother, selling capuccino and orange juice by renting stands in the different fairs that occur all over the country. This money will be directed to the buying of a larger coffee maker and a machine for making the foam necessary for capuccino.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing capital

loans.name: Lena Karen

texts.es:
"Doña Lena,es ingenierá que trabaja como consultora individual presentando proyectos relacionados con la instalación de gas natural y elaborando planos para diferentes instituciones. La otra actividad que realiza es la de dictar clases en el instituto tecnológico Boliviano Suizo.

El destino del crédito está dirigido a la compra de tubos para instalación de gas, los mismos que son necesarios para adjudicarse una obra de instalación de gas domiciliario.

Doña Lena trabaja en sociedad con otras empresas a las que tambien les brinda el servicio de proyectista, realizando los calculos necesarios para que la empresa realice solo la instalación."
texts.en:
Doña Lena is an engineer that works as a private consultant. She works on projects related to natural gas installations. She provides plans for different institutions. She also teaches classes at the “Boliviano Suizo” technical institute. The purpose of the loan is to buy pipes that are used for gas installations. They are the same type of pipes that used for natural gas installations in a home. Doña Lena works with a group of other companies as a project manager. She provides the necessary calculations for the company’s installations.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pipes for natural gas installations

loans.name: Estrella De Mar Group

texts.es:
"Estrella de Mar es el Grupo constituido por don Tito y doña Dunia, los mismos que son primos y viven el la misma zona pero en casas distintas.
Doña Dunia, tiene por actividad la elaboración de joyas tanto de oro como de plata, a parte de esa actividad prepara chicharron de pollo y fricase los fines de semana. El crédito está dirigido a la compra de dos recipientes para preparar chicharron de pollo y ademas de comprar oro y piedaras preciosas para la elaboración de joyas.
Don tito es técnico en computación, su actividad esta relacionado con el arreglo de computadoras, la instalación de redes, la digityalización de videos, etc. El crédito está dirigido a la compra de una computadora personal."
texts.en:
The Estrella de Mar (Ocean Star) Loan Group consists of Don Tito and Doña Dunia, who are cousins living in the same neighborhood but in different houses. Doña Dunia works at producing gold and silver jewelry. Aside from this activity she prepares chicken, fried or fricasseed, on the weekends. The loan is intended for the purchase of two containers for preparing fried chicken and also to buy gold and precious stones for making jewelry. Don Tito is a computer technician who works at setting up computers, installing networks, digitalizing videos, etc. His loan is intended for the purchase of a personal computer.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials, containers and a personal computer.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
"Doña Beatriz L. tiene 26 años de edad, trabaja con la venta de ropa en la feria de la zona 16 de Julio, está casado con don Daniel Pucho Choque, el mismo que es chofer de taxi con el que tiene un hijo pequeño, doña Beatriz vive en la casa de sus suegros.
Doña Betriz tiene la misma actividad que su suegra, la forma de vender es en distintas ferias de la ciudad del Alto como ser la feria de la 16 de Julio los días jueves y domingo, los miercoles en Pcota, los dias ordinarios en la Ceja del Alto. El credito solicitado es para la compra de mercaderia, la misma que lo compraran por docenas por esta temporada."
texts.en:
Beatriz L. is 26 years old and works selling clothes at the flea markets in the region. She is married to Daniel Pucho Choque, who is a taxi driver, and together they have a small son. Beatriz lives in her in-laws' house, and does the same job as her mother-in-law, selling at the different markets in the city of Alto. She's at the July 16 market on Fridays and Sundays, in Pcota on Wednesdays, and in Ceja del Alto on other days. She is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise, buying items by the dozen for the summer season.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Juanito Genaro

texts.es:
"Don Juanito tiene 27 años de edad, es chofer propietario de un radio taxi, el señor está casado con doña Marcela Añamuri, la misma que trabaja como contratista en la construccion en los puentes trillisos, tienen un hijo.
Don Juanito está solicitando el crédito para realizar un mantenimiento preventivo de su vehículo, pues tiene mucho cuidado con el mismo, ya que se constituye en su fuente principal de trabajo."
texts.en:
Juanito is 27 years old and makes a living driving a radio taxi he owns. He is married to Marcela Añamuri, who works as a construction contractor in Puentes Trillizos, and together they have a son. Juanito is requesting the loan so he can perform preventative maintenance on his vehicle; he is very careful with it because it represents his main source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perform preventative maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia N. is thirty-six years old and divorced with three children, a boy and two girls, who are currently in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the western region of Ghana. Wiawso is a farming and commercial town in the region. Felicia is a trader, selling cereals such as maize at the local market in her community. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days, and she supplies some vendors as well. Felicia has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy maize in bulk to expand her business. She wants to give her children a quality education and also to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora O. is forty-nine years old and married with five children, two boys and three girls, who are all currently in the senior high, junior high and primary schools. Dora lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the western region of Ghana. Wiawso is a farming and commercial town in the region. Dora runs a grocery store, buying her supplies in Kumasi. Her store is in the front of her house, and she also sells vegetables on a tabletop in front of her store. Dora has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk to expand her business. She wants to give her children a quality education and to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is forty-six years old and married with five children, a boy and four girls, who are currently in the senior high, junior high and primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in their town. Georgina trades in second hand clothes. She buys the clothing from cities and with "hawk" selling strategy, reach her loyal customers to sell. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy all bales of used clothing in bulk to expand her business. She wants to give her children a quality education and to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes in bulk

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is twenty-two years old and married with a daughter who is currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in their community. Ama trades in jewelry, buying from the big cities and then engaging the strategy of "hawking" (door-to-door) to sell to her loyal customers in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Ama has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy assorted jewelry in bulk to expand her business. She wants to give her child a quality education and to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy jewelry in bulk

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta is twenty-three years old and single with one child, a boy who is currently in primary school. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in their community. Alberta bakes bread for the past three years, a skill she learnt from her mum. She supplies to other retailers and beverage sellers in her community and also hawks to sell. Alberta buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Kumasi. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour in bulk to expand her business. She wants to give her son a quality education and to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy flour in bulk

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is thirty-three years old. She is married and has three daughters, who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in their community. Francisca trades in soft drinks and pastries. She buys the drinks from big towns and sells them in her community. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy drinks and pastries in bulk, in order to expand her business. She desires to give her children a quality education and support would be much appreciated.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Saadatu

texts.en:
Saadatu is twenty-three years old.  She is married and has one child, a daughter who is currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in their community.   Saadatu is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She prepares the food in her house and sells it at the market square. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients in the cities.  

She has been in business for five years.  She is seeking a loan to buy bags of rice in bulk to expand her business. Saadatu desires to give her child a quality education and to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is forty-two years old.  She is married and has four children, one boy and three girls. All are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in their community. Christiana trades in soft drinks and pastries. She buys the drinks from big towns and sells them in a kiosk in her community. She has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to buy soft drinks and pastries in bulk, in order to expand her business. Christiana desires to give all of her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is forty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, a boy and a girl. Both of her children are still in school. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. 

Mary trades in smoked fish. She buys from the northern part of the country and sells at the local market square. She says she supplies to food vendors, to people in her community and treks to other communities to sell on their market days. Mary has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Próceres”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 46 años y es madre de 01 hijo, ya independiente.Elizabeth, una mujer trabajadora y luchadora decidió vender comida, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicado al frente del policlínico de su Distrito, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, es conocida por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados y sus principales clientes son los mismos trabajadores de este centro de salud y moradores.En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza día a día, en las mañanas de 10:00 am a 1:30 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the “Los Próceres” (The National Heroes) Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, province of San Martín, Peru. She is a 46-year-old married mother of one son, who is now grown up. Elizabeth is a very hard-working woman with a fighting spirit who decided to sell food at a well-conditioned location in front of her district's general hospital. She tells us that her daily sales are very good and that she is known for her meals' tasty seasonings. Her main customers are the hospital works and local residents. She continues working with the business and is very satisfied with her work day to day from 10 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. She personally tends to her customers with the charisma she is known for. With the 1,000 soles loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase ingredients to prepare her daily meals, such as rice by the kilo, sugar, oil by the gallon, potatoes, chicken, vegetables and also some utensils to add to her business to give her customers better service. Elizabeth fills fill of life with a strong desire to get ahead, and she still has many dreams and goals in her life. She is grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her daily meals

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: La señora Emerita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Próceres”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es una mujer soltera, tiene 52 años y 02 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes y con familia.Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Emerita, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emerita belongs to the “Los Próceres” cooperative bank in the district of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martin, in the department of San Martin. She is single, 52 years old and has two children who are independent with families of their own. Her character and the longing to achieve her dreams motivated her to undertake her own business. She sells groceries whose earnings contribute to the maintenance of her home. From the beginning she has grown her customer base. Today a fixed group of customers depend on her store to make their purchases. Her store has all the products a housewife would need. Mrs. Emerita serves her customers with the warmth of her character. With this loan of 1,000 soles she will buy rice, sacks of sugar, cookies, noodles, packages of salt, milk, many varieties of canned fish, cartons of eggs and personal hygiene items. She will purchase these items in order to continue giving the best service to her customers. Emerita would very much like to continue working and is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement that gives assistance to women like her so that she has the opportunity to develop and the means to do it.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, sacks of sugar, cookies and noodles.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia B. is a mother of five and a 46-year-old manager of her own business. She is married to Herminio, who is 47 and her partner in business. She lives in the island village of Malacaban in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province, in the Philippines.

She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in1996 with an aspiration to rise above poverty. During her membership, she has been noted for her excellent performance and ability to pay off her previous loans accordingly. Her previous secondary business was a fishing boat but she opted to shift her business. Now on her eighth loan, she proposes to invest it in the making of bamboo sets. She proposes to make 20 bamboo chairs, beds and other bamboo products with a loan request of 35,000 pesos.

With the help of her children, she is positive that her business would be in demand at the town market and in the other neighboring towns. She dreams of having enough money for the medication of her husband and for her younger children to go to school and continue schooling. She also dreams of having a more durable and spacious house and to get out from behind the wall of poverty.

loans.use: To make 20 sets of bamboo chairs and other bamboo products

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 27 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.Con la seguridad y optimismo que siempre le ha caracterizado, por iniciativa propia implemento su propio negocio de venta de golosinas, ubicada en el tercer piso de la Municipalidad Provincial de Tarapoto, donde cuenta con un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo de negocio y esta muy contenta con lo logrado, ya que le va muy bien.En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada, siendo sus principales clientes los mismos trabajadores de la Municipalidad,  que a diario acuden a su puesto, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará golosinas como: paquetes de galletas en diferentes sabores, keres, chifles en docenas, chocolates como: cañonazos, sublimes,  para aumentar sus productos y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Gladys, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Gladys belongs to the Esmeralda Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, province of San Martín, Peru. She is a 27-year-old mother of three children and lives with her partner. With the confidence and optimism that has always characterized her, she started her own business selling snacks on the the third floor of the municipal building in Tarapoto, where she has a well-conditioned place to serve her customers. She has made a living in this type of business for a number of years and is very satisfied with what she has achieved since it has gone very well. Currently, despite the passage of time, she continues working with the same business and relies on a faithful customer base. Her main clients are people who work in the building where she daily takes up her post and whom she tends to with the charisma she's known for. With the loan of 2,000, she plans to purchase snacks such as, different kinds of packaged cookies, chifles (fried banana slices covered in caramel), and various chocolates, to increase her supplies and better serve her customers. Gladys feels very prepared for everything and still has a strong desire to continue working and making headway. She is grateful for Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing snacks

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia A. is a mother of strong faith and determined to get her four children out of the spiral of poverty. She is 46 years old and married to Marino, also 46 years old, and her business partner. She lives in the island village of Malacaban, Binangonan, Rizal Province.

In 1995, Remegia joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with a bagful of hope to step out of poverty. She has maintained a very good performance during her entire membership. Now on her sixth loan, she wishes to borrow 27,000 pesos as additional capital for her fish cage business. She has been in this business for 15 years and acknowledges the proceeds the business had brought to them. This loan will be used to pay for the construction of two fish cages including materials, bamboo, fingerlings, fishnets and payment for human labor costs. Some money will be used for bamboo crafts as a secondary business.

Remegia is hopeful that with this loan she will be able to expand and have additional fish cages that will give her more fish to be sold in the market during harvest seasons. She also dreams of sending her children to school up to college and on to finding jobs. She wants to have a more spacious and durable house.

loans.use: To construct two fish cages and for bamboo crafts

loans.name: Hirma Bessi

texts.es: La señora Hirma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Próceres”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 69 años y 03 hijos, que ya son independientes y son su gran orgullo.Hirmita, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, se inicio vendiendo cosméticos de diferentes líneas como Unique, Esika, Leonisa y Avon, negocio con el que en la actualidad continua. Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.Hirma, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Hirma belongs to the “Los Próceres” (The National Heroes) Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, province of San Martín, Peru. She is a 69-year-old widow and a mother of three children, all of whom are grown up and are the source of her biggest pride. Hirma is a woman who has been able to overcome many difficulties in her life, and her desire to get ahead paid off with good results. She feels very satisfied today with what she has achieved with her business. She started out selling different lines of cosmetics such as Avon, Unique, Esika and Leonisa, and she's still doing it today. With the loan of 2,500 soles, she plans to purchase beauty products to increase her stock, such as perfumes, cologne, lotions, powders, lipstick, nail polish and another display case to show off her products. Hirma is an example to follow for many women who start a business and with perseverance achieve their dreams. She is very grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for helping her start her own business and other bank members for helping her grow as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina G. is a native of the island village of Buhangin, Buhangin, Rizal province. She is still single and living with her old parents. She is 58 years old and fighting against poverty for her family.

In 2005, she joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She was motivated to join ASHI by the hope of bringing her family out of poverty. She is a busy fish vendor in their village and in the town market. But she is getting old now to still be doing the fish vending business. Currently on her fifth loan, she wants to borrow 25,000 pesos to use in the resale business. This loan will pay for 10 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of sugar and 50 sacks of charcoal--all for resale.

With this new business of hers, she is hoping to have more time to stay at home to take good care of her parents and still keep her business. She wants to renovate their house and make it more durable.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of sugar and 5 sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es: La señora Llerme, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Próceres”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y es madre de 06  hijos, 04 que aun dependen de ella.Llerme es una mujer alegre, perseverante y capaz. nos cuenta que poco a poco ha ido logrando algunos de metas y sueños que quería realizar,  en la actualidad se dedica a venta de ropas y le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene clientes que la conocen y saben de su negocio que se  encuentra ubicado en el Mercado Nº 02 de la cuidad de Tarapoto.La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su mercadería de ropas como: pantalones, shorts, snikers, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para niñas. Ella manifiesta que siente mucho orgullo por ella misma, por lo que logrò y lo hizo con mucho entusiasmo y optimismo.Dice: Agradezco la oportunidad que me da  Manuela Ramos  de  contar con los  préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Llerme belongs to the “Los Próceres” (National Heroes) Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, province of San Martín, Peru. She is a 40-year-old married mother of six children, four who are still dependent upon her. Llerme is a happy, perseverant and capable woman. She tells us that little by little she has been fulfilling some goals and dreams she wanted to realize. Currently she makes a living selling clothing and it is going very well since she has customers who know her and know her business, which is located in the a local market in Tarapoto. Her strength and perseverance have helped her grow as an independent woman, and she is very proud of what she has achieved. With the loan of 2,200 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase more products to stock her clothes inventory, such as pants, shorts, sneakers, blouses of every style and fabric, polos, and children's clothing.
