She says she feels very proud of herself and what she has accomplished with a lot of enthusiasm and optimism. She says, "I am grateful for the opportunity that (Kiva partner) Manuela Ramos gave me by providing the loans that helped my small business grow and myself grow as a woman."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes to supply her store

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: La señora Ángela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Jerusalén II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 50 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 01 que  es estudiante y depende de ella.El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de Cosméticos de la línea Oriflame, agregando a estos la venta de aretes, anillos, collares y pulseras que ella misma los confecciona, poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio  ubicado en su misma casa donde vende todo el día también sale  a ofrecer casa por casa los productos que vende  a sus amistades. Tiene años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará materiales como: argollas, perlitas de diferentes modelos y colores, hilo nylon y ganchitos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos como: perfumes y colonias refrescantes, cremas corporales y de rostro, labiales y polvos compactos, así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.   Ángelita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ángela belongs to the Jerusalem II cooperative bank, located in the Tarapoto province of San Martín. She is single, 50 years old, and the mother of 4 children; 1 is still in school and dependent on her financially. She has always been characterized by her fighting spirit and desire to get ahead through her own means. She started her own enterprise selling cosmetics from the Oriflame product line, and added the sale of earrings, rings, necklaces and bracelets to her business. Little by little, she became well-known among her customers and she tells us that today things are going very well for her. She is still in the same business currently, located in her own home. She always travels door-to-door selling her products to friends and neighbors. She has been in this line of business for years, and feels very gratified with her earnings. She plans to use this loan of 1,000 soles to buy materials such as: rings, different style and color stones, nylon thread, and hooks. She will also invest part of the money into cosmetics such as: perfumes and colognes, deodorants, body and face creams, lipsticks and powder compacts, so she can maintain a happy and satisfied client base. Angelita, as she is nicknamed, feels very content with what she does and is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her successfully work toward meeting her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials such as:  rings, different color and style stones, nylon thread and hooks.

loans.name: Margarita Enriquez

texts.es: La señora Margarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Próceres”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 03 hijos y 01 que aun depenD. D. ella.Margarita, es una mujer eficiente, que viéndose en la necesidad D. generar sus propios ingresos, decidió implementar su propio negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, empezó D. poco a poco y ahora ya se encuentra mejorada y con productos surtidos, al alcance D. sus clientes y amas D. casa, donD. el ama D. casa encuentra lo que necesita. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.  Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, utensilios D. aseo para el hogar y D. higiene personal paquetes D. gaseosas D. diferentes sabores y marcas para D. esta manera satisfacer y brindar una mejor  atención a sus clientes. Margarita, se siente una mujer muy satisfecha con lo que ha  logrado. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y a cumplir sus sueños y metas y otras  mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita belongs to the communal bank group “Los Próceres” (The Great Ones), which meets in the Tarapoto District of San Martín Province, Department of San Martin. She is married and has 3 children, one of whom is still a dependent. She is an efficient woman, generating income by selling groceries out of her home. She started slowly, but now her business has improved and offers an assortment of products. Her customers, especially housewives, can find anything they need at her store. Margarita continues with her business and says she is doing well.

She will use her loan of 3000 soles to buy rice, bags of sugar, packaged noodles, cases of canned fish, household cleaning supplies, personal hygiene products and different flavored sodas of various brands. This will help satisfy her customers’ needs and allow her to proviD. better service. Margarita is very satisfied with what she has achieved. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business, fulfilling her dreams and goals, and assisting other women who want to grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more groceries

loans.name: Maria Bertilda

texts.es: La señora María Bertilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Próceres”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella, estudiantes y es por ellos que María, trabaja muy duro día a día.Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de Abarrotes que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  En la actualidad tiene sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con alegría y entusiasmo. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. María Bertila, anhela ampliar e implementar mas su bodeguita y manifiesta que lo va a hacer realidad,  porque es una mujer que cuando se propone algo lo cumple.
texts.en:
Sra. María Bertilda belongs to the communal bank group “Los Próceres” (The Great Ones), which meets in the Tarapoto District of San Martín Province, Department of San Martin. She is 38 years old and married. She has 2 dependent children who are students, and for this reason she works hard every day. Her entrepreneurial spirit and love for her family motivated her to start her own business selling groceries. As she gradually obtains more business and becomes more experienced, she is becoming widely known and beloved by her clients. She currently has regular customers who visit her store on a daily basis and can find anything a housewife would need. María Bertilda personally attends to each one with much joy and enthusiasm.

With her loan of 1000 soles, she will buy rice, bags of sugar, packaged noodles, canned fish, cartons of milk, eggs and personal hygiene products. This will help her continue to provide excellent service to her customers. María Bertilda is eager to expand her grocery store and hopes that it will become a reality one day. She is a determined woman who carries out what she intends to do.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to increase her assortment of products

loans.name: Eldefonsa

texts.en:
Eldefonsa S. is a 54-year-old woman of industry and courage. She believes that everyone has an equal right to live a normal life far from poverty. She is a mother to four and all of the children are already of legal age. She is married to Efren, a 58-year-old fisherman. She lives in the island village of Kinabaogan, Binangonan, Rizal province.
In 2004, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with the hope of having access to capital to strengthen her business. Among her secondary businesses are fishing, general store and resale of peanuts. But just recently, she focused on the resale of ready-to-wear products as her primary business. Now on her seventh loan, she proposes a loan of 20,000 pesos as additional capital for the resale business. The loan will be used to pay for 36 pieces of slacks, t-shirts, pants, and many other ready-to-wear products.
She is hopeful that her business will grow and will catch the public demand. With the profits that she can earn from her business, she plans to help her grandchildren with their school fees and be able to save for their future.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: La señora Mariela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Próceres”, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 35 años y 05 hijas, que aun dependen de ella.Mariela, es una mujer joven, con ganas de seguir adelante, se considera una mujer luchadora y eficiente.Lleva 10 años dedicándose a la venta de comidas, como vio que le genera buenos ingresos, decidió abrirse mas en el campo, así que con su esfuerzo estableció un local acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa, para atender a sus clientes; con ese carisma y alegría que tiene.En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que es muy conocida y tiene buena acogida.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará insumos para preparar sus alimentos  como: kilos de arroz, azúcar y papas, racimos de plátanos, pollos vivos en javas. Y algunas herramientas de cocina, para remplazar a los antiguos.Mariela, se siente una mujer tranquila y contenta con lo logrado, y desea asegurarse una vejez tranquila por lo que agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sueños y metas, así como a otras   mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the community bank Los Proceres, in Tarapoto, San Martin. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children, all dependants. Mariela is a young, motivated woman; she thinks of herself as a hard worker and a fighter. For ten years she has been selling food, and this provides her with a reasonable income. Mariela has decided to expand her business into a local catering service. In order to best serve her customers, she will run her new business from her current location-- all with her characteristic zeal. Mariela says that business is good these days; she and her food are well-liked and have a good reputation. With this loan, she'll be able to purchase plenty of ingredients, including rice, sugar, potatoes, bananas, and chickens. She'll also be able to purchase some new kitchen tools. Mariela is a happy woman; she's pleased with the progress her business has made, and hopes things continue to go well for years to come. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos group for helping her fulfill her dreams and grow her business-- and for helping other women do the same.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food ingredients and kitchen tools

loans.name: Milagro De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Milagro de Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 39 años y 03 hijos, que todavía dependen de ella.Anteriormente Milagro, se dedicaba a la venta de abarrotes, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su taller de confección de vestidos y teniendo habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo Manuela Ramos decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos anticipados de sus clientes .Uno de sus sueños y metas por lograr, es implementar su propio taller de confección de vestidos con mas maquinas de coser y una remalladora  para mostrar a sus clientes las confeccionadas que son hechas por ella misma.En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su casa para solicitar  sus servicios y  es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300.00, comprará telas en metros de diferentes tipos y diseños, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones y adornos diversos.Milagro, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Milagro de Jesús is a member of the Esmeralda Microfinance Institute, located in the Tarapoto district of the province and department of San Martín. She is a 39-year-old single mother with 3 dependent children. Milagro previously owned a general store, but littly by little she saved up her money until setting up her own dressmaking workshop in her house with the help of Manuela Ramos and her sewing skills. She states that her business is prosperous. Her customers pre-order her garments. One of her goals is setting up her own dressmaking factory with more sewing machines and overlock machines to display to her customers the dresses that she makes herself. She currently has this same business and has a fixed clientele that visits her house daily to solicit her services. She personally attends to them with the kindness for which she is noted. With this 2,300.00 PEN loan, she will purchase different cuts and designs of fabric, tools that she uses, like scissors, needles, sewing machine needles, pins, buttons, and an assortment of appliqués. Milagro now feels like a fulfilled woman with the desire to reach the rest of her dreams. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her own business, as well as for helping so many women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. hails from the island village of Buhangin, Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 46 years old and mother to six. Three of her children are of legal age already and three are still minors who are still studying. Her husband, Maximino, is a carpenter and is 50 years-old.
In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, full of determination and aspirations to rise above poverty. Her primary business is making of kaing (Big baskets used as storage for various products).  She proposes a loan of 20,000 pesos as additional capital for making kaing. She has regular customers and she also accepts orders.
She is optimistic that with her regular customers and with the orders she receives, she can make a sound and strong business. She also aspires to send her younger children to college and find jobs so they don't experience the same life that she has.

loans.use: Additional capital for making "Kaing" (large baskets used for storage of dry goods and products).

loans.name: Norith

texts.es: La señora Norith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Jerusalén II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus 02 únicos hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Las ganancias que genera a diario, la ayuda al ingreso económico  en su familia. Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Norith, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y prepararse para hacer frente a las adversidades de la vida  y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Ms. Norith R. is a member of the Jerusalen II Microfinance Institute, located in the Tarapoto district of the province and department of San Martín. She is a 34-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 2 dependent children. Her strength and her desire to help her children get ahead motivated her to set up her own general store, which is located in her own house in an area that is well-suited to attend to her customers. Her daily revenues contribute to the household income. Ever since she got started, she has been gaining customers. She now has a fixed clientele that visit her store daily to shop, and she personally attends to them with the charm for which she is noted. With this 800.00 PEN loan, she will purchase sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, crates of milk, boxes of canned fish (in a variety of brands), eggs, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue to give the best customer satisfaction. Norith feels strong enough to continue working and to prepare herself for life’s difficulties. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have the opportunity to grow in their line of work.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Jerusalén II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 21 años y no tiene hijos.Rosita, una mujer que se siente capaz de cumplir sus metas y sueños, por lo que decidió implementar su propio negocio, con el apoyo de su mamá. Nos cuenta que poco a poco fue ahorrando y juntando su propio capital y con el primer préstamo, implemento su negocio de venta de abarrotes, ubicada en su misma casa es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su bodega a comprar todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Rosita, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa P. is a member of the Jerusalen II Microfinance Institute, located in the Tarapoto district of the province and department of San Martín. She is a 21-year-old single woman with no children. Rosita is capable of realizing her goals and dreams, which is why she set up her own business with the help of her mother. She states that little by little she saved up enough capital, and with her first loan, she established her own general store, located in her house. She is well-known and loved by her customers. She currently has faithful customers who frequent her store daily to purchase everything that the homemaker needs. She personally attends to them with the charm for which she is noted. With this 800.00 PEN loan, she will purchase sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, crates of milk, boxes of canned fish (in a variety of brands), cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products to continue providing the best customer service. Rosita now feels like a fulfilled woman with the desire to get ahead and make her dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her own business, and for helping many women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 41 años y 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella.Nos cuenta que se inicio con la venta de abarrotes, ya son años que se dedica a este tipo de actividad.Estableció su negocio, ahorrando poco a poco, vendiendo  productos de belleza de la línea Esika y Oriflame. Aparte de contar con su negocio, también trabaja como vendedora en una tienda de ropas.Como vemos, Rosita genera sus propios ingresos de diferentes formas, para sacar adelante a su familia. Hoy sus vecinos y amigos ya le conocen y tiene mucha acogida, todos los días sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará abarrotes como: arroz y azúcar en sacos, paquetes de leches y aceites; también paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y tamaños e insumos para la limpieza del hogar e higiene personal. Así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa T. is a member of the Esmeralda Microfinance Institute, located in the Tarapoto district of the province and department of San Martín. She is a 41-year-old woman with a live-in partner and one dependent son. She states that she started out by selling provisions in her general store, a business that she has been managing for several years now. She got started by saving money little by little, selling Esika and Oriflame beauty products. Aside from this business, she also works as a salesperson at a clothing boutique. As we can see, Rosita generates her own income through different jobs in order to help her family get ahead. Her friends and neighbors know her well, and since she is very welcoming, business is booming. With this 2,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase goods like: sacks of rice and sugar, crates of milk, cooking oil, crates of soft drinks (different sizes and flavors), household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products. Thus, she can keep her customers satisfied. She feels good about the work that she is doing, and she believes that the sacrifice is worth it because she can reach her life goals and dreams. She would also like to thank the Manuela Ramos Movement for giving support to her and to other women who wish to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella.Con la seguridad de tener muy buena clientela, por iniciativa tanto de ella y de su esposo, emprendieron su propio negocio de venta de agregados (arena, piedra)   que son los insumos necesarios para la construcción de casas, edificios que son extraídos de la cantera de los ríos, autorizados y vendidos por la municipalidad del distrito.  En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario realizan sus pedidos de agregados, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que siempre le ha caracterizado. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200.00, comprará agregados como: 100 sacos de arena, 10 volquetes de piedras, así implementar su negocio y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante, Teresa de Jesús, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Esmeralda Microfinance Institute, located in the Tarapoto district of the province and department of San Martín. She is a 39-year-old married mother with one independent son. Certain that she would have a solid client-base, she and her husband took the initiative and started their own construction aggregate business, selling sand and gravel. These materials, which are needed for constructing houses and other buildings, are extracted from the river quarry, authorized and sold by the municipality. She currently has this same business despite all the time that has gone by, and she has faithful customers who buy from her everyday. She attends to them with the charm for which she has always been noted. With this 2,200.00 PEN loan, she will purchase aggregates like: 100 sacks of sand and 10 truckloads of gravel so that she can restock her business and fill her customers’ orders. She is prepared for everything and feels the strong enough to keep working to get ahead. Teresa de Jesús gives thanks to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the realization of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction aggregate

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: La señora Yadira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y 01 hijo, ya independiente y con su propia familia.Yadira, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas y refrescos, en el kiosco que se encuentra ubicada en el tercer piso de la Municipalidad Provincial de la Ciudad de Tarapoto. Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 03 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas.En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son los mismos trabajadores y personas que van a ser algún tramite en la Municipalidad.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará mas bebidas como gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas. Yadira, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Ms. Yadira L. is a member of the Esmeralda Microfinance Institute, located in the Tarapoto district of the province and department of San Martín. She is a 56-year-old married mother with one son who is now independent and has his own family. Yadira is a woman who likes to work, so she decided to set up her own carbonated drink and beverage business in a kiosk on the third floor of the Provincial Municipality of the City of Tarapoto. She manages the business herself, without having a fixed work schedule or a boss. She states that she started out with 300.00 PEN and bought three crates of soft drinks. She saw that business was good and that she needed more drinks, so little by little she invested in more. She currently has the same business and is well-known by her customers, the same workers and people who go to the municipality to fill out paperwork. With this 2,000.00 PEN, she will purchase more drinks, such as different flavors, brands, and sizes of soft drinks, as well as carbonated/non-carbonated mineral water. Yadira has many goals ahead of her, and she feels motivated to do what she sets out to do. She is very grateful with the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed it. She is responsible with her payments and plans to stay that way.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more drinks like different-flavored soda

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es: La señora Yrma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen D. ella.Su impulso  y empeño D. ver a sus hijos profesionales, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Con las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico D. su familia. Es muy querida por sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque; ella cuenta con todo los productos  que el ama D. casa necesita y es quien les brinda su atención con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,800.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, huevos en javas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Yrmita, como le dicen D. cariño, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, día a día agradece a la vida, por brindarle una gran oportunidad D. salir adelante como mujer, igualmente al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por   iniciarla a convertirse en una mujer empresaria.
texts.en:
Yrma belongs to the Communal Bank “Esmeralda”, in the District of Tarapoto, Province of San Martin, Department of San Martin. She is married, 50 years old, and has 2 children that still depend on her. Her desire and determination to see her children become professionals have motivated her to start her own business in the sale of groceries; this business is located in her own house, which provides a very well equipped environment in which to attend to her clients. The earnings that she generates help with her family’s income. She is very loved by her clients that daily seek her small store to do their shopping because she is stocked with all the products that a homemaker needs and she also attends to them with the charisma that she is known for. With this loan of 1,800 PEN she will purchase sacks of rice and sugar, noodles in packages, milk, and fish preserves from a variety of brands in boxes, eggs, and personal hygiene products, to be able to continue offering great service to her clients. Yrmita, which is how she is referred to by her loved ones, feels very strong as she continues working. Day to day she is thankful for her life which has given her the great opportunity to get ahead as a women; she also thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her become an enterprising woman.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase more groceries to increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more seeds for his farm

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La señora Benita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Bandinas II”, Distrito D. la Banda D. Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 44 años y madre D. 01 hijo, que aun esta bajo su cargo.Nos cuenta que se inicio con la venta D. abarrotes, ya son años que se dedica a este tipo D. venta.Estableció su negocio, ahorrando poco a poco y con un crédito D. S/. 300.00 comenzó a comprar sus productos, para establecer su bodeguita.Hoy sus vecinos, amigos ya le conocen y tiene mucha acogida, sus ventas le salen a pedir D. boca y esa es una D. sus ventajas grandes que tiene, para generar sus propios ingresos y D. esta manera ser responsable con sus cuotas.Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, comprará abarrotes como: arroz y azúcar en sacos, paquetes D. leches y aceites; también paquetes D. gaseosas D. diferentes sabores y tamaños e insumos para la limpieza del hogar e higiene personal. Así D. esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Señora Benita is a client of the Community Bank “Las Bandinas II”, in the District of Banda D. Shilcayo, San Martín Province, San Martín. She is 44 years old, and lives with her one child and his father. Benita tells us she began her business selling groceries, and has devoted herself to this business for years. She established her business, saving little by little, and with a loan of S/. 300.00 began to purchase the products to establish her little shop. Today Benita's neighbors and friends know her and are well received, and her sales are going well. This is a great advantage, as generating her own income allows Benita to be responsible with her payments. With this loan of S/. 1,500.00, Benita will purchase groceries such as: rice and sugar in bags, packages of milk and cooking oil, packages of soft drinks in different flavors and sizes, cleaning products for the home and personal hygiene products. This way she will keep her customers satisfied and happy. Benita feels very satisfied with the work she undertakes, and believes it is worth the sacrifice to achieve the dreams and goals she has established in her life. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for providing support to her and other women who want to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to augment her inventory

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La señora Carolina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Barrio San Martín II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.Su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de Anticuchos, ubicada en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, donde hay mucho movimiento y poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donde vende diariamente  por las noches. Tiene 14 años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad y remplazar a los antiguos.Carolina, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Carolina is a client of the Community Bank “Barrio San Martín II”, in the District of Tarapoto, San Martin Province, San Martín. She is married, 48 years old, and has 3 children, two of whom still depend on her. Her fighting spirit and her will to succeed on her own propelled her to start her own business selling Anticuchos (a popular Andean meat dish) from a very well situated location with a lot of traffic. Little by little she became known by her customers, and today she tells us that her business is going very well. Currently, Carolina continues in the same business, selling food every night. She has been working at this business for 14 years, and is very happy with what she does. With this loan of S/. 2,000.00, Carolina will purchase ingredients like bags of rice, eggs, and chickens for her juanes (a traditional chicken dish), and also new kitchen utensils to provide quality service and replace the old ones. Carolina is very happy and content, and thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the achievement of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Margoli

texts.es: Margoli, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Barrio San Martín II”, Distrito D. Morales, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y es madre D. 02 hijos, 01 que aun dependen D. ella.Con la seguridad D. tener una buena sazón para la preparación D. diferentes tipos D. comidas, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio D. venta D. comida diaria tipo menú, ubicada en su misma casa.En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuD. a su puesto D. venta, donD. ella los atienD. con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo D. S/1.300.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria D. sus alimentos como sacos D. arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Margoli, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Margoli belongs to the Communal Bank “Barrio San Martin II” in the District of Morales, Province of San Martin, Department of San Martin. She is married, is 48 years old, and is a mother to 2 children, 1 of which still depends on her. With the security of having a good seasoning mix to prepare different types of foods, and due to her own initiative, she used her first loan of 300 PEN to start a business in the sale of daily meals; this business is located in her own house. Currently, though time has passed she continues with this same business, and counts on a loyal client base that daily seeks her sales stand where she attends to them with the charisma that she is well known for. With this loan of 1,300 PEN she will purchase supplies to prepare her daily meals, such as, sacks of rice, sugar, oil in packages, chicken, and also utensils which will allow her to proviD. better service to her clients who frequent her business. She is ready for anything and still feels strong enough to continue working and continue moving forward. Margoli thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies to prepare her food.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es: La señora Maria Alicia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Bandinas II”, Distrito Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 02  hijos, que aun están a cargo de ella. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza le motivó a crear su propio negocio de Servicio de Internet, se inicio con  S/. 300.00 y día a día fue ganando clientela dado el buen trato que les brinda y el precio cómodo en la hora de servicio de Internet. Actualmente continúa con este negocio pero ya ampliando con mas cabinas y considerando la demanda que tiene entre sus clientes que generalmente son adolescentes y vecinos del barrio donde vive. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará 01 escáner y una computadora, para implementarlo mas. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en cables,  para mejorar su cableado de red con canaletas, para dar un buen servicio y seguridad.Ella manifiesta que trabaja con mucho optimismo, agradeciendo la oportunidad de contar con préstamos que le ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Alicia is a client of the Community Bank “Las Bandinas II”, in the District of Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín Province, San Martín. She is 33 years old, and lives with her two dependent children and their father. Her strength and perseverence motivated her to create her own Internet Service business, which she started with S/. 300.00. Day by day she gained customers because of the the good service she provides, and the reasonable hourly price she offers for internet service. Currently, Maria Alicia operates the business, but is expanding with more booths due to the demand of her customers, generally teenagers and neighbors from the area where she lives. With a loan of S/. 1,500.00, Maria Alicia will purchase a scanner and a computer for greater use. She will also invest in cables in order to upgrade the cabling in her network with cable concealers, and to provide better service and security. Maria Alicia tells us she is very optimistic in her work, and appreciates the opportunity to rely on these loans that help her develop as a woman and a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a scanner and computer

loans.name: Marielith

texts.es: La señora Marielith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Bandinas II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de anticuchos en las fueras de su casa donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. Sus ventas lo realiza  diariamente  por las noches. Tiene años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  Marielith,  se siente tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Marielith is a client of the Community Bank “Las Bandinas II” in the District of Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín Province, San Martín. She is married, 38 years old, and has 2 dependent children. Her fighting spirit and desire to succeed motivated her to start her own business selling anticuchos (a traditional Peruvian meat dish) outside of her home, where little by little she became well known to her customers. Today Marielith tells us that that this business is going very well. She makes her sales every night. Marielith has been working in this business for years, and is very content with what she does. With this loan of S/ 2,000.00, Marielith will buy ingredients like bags of rice, eggs, chickens to make juanes (a traditional chicken dish) and chickens for her anticuchos, as well as kitchen utensils to provide quality service. Marielith is content and happy with her business and thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Zelmira

texts.es: La señora Zelmira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Próceres”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 41 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que en su trayectoria paso por muchas dificultades, pero su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante sola le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas prepararas.En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y le va muy bien, tiene sus clientes fijos y ya es conocida por sus clientes y por la buena sazón de sus comidas.Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de comidas, posteriormente desea implementar un Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Zelmira belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Próceres” located in the District of Tarapoto, Province of San Martin, Department of San Martin. She is married, 41 years old, and has 2 children that still depend on her. Hoping to see her children become professional and hoping to have her own income to achieve this goal, she decided to start her own business. She tells us that in her life she has faced many difficulties, but her fighting spirit for which she is known for and her drive to get ahead in life alone have encouraged her to start her own business in the sale of food. Currently she continues in this same business and things are going very well; she has loyal clients and is well known by her clients for having well-seasoned food. With this loan of 800 PEN she will purchase supplies to prepare her food, such as: sacks of rice and sugar, chickens and eggs, bunches of plantains, noodles, oil by the dozen, and kitchen utensils to provide quality service. She feels strong as she moves forward with her food sales, and subsequently hopes to open a well-equipped restaurant to provide her clients the best service and attention. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies to prepare her food.

loans.name: Maria Dolith

texts.es: La señora Maria Dolith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Bandinas II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.Con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos económicos en su hogar, le nace la idea de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas por las mañanas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado en su propia casa . Hoy en día ha ganando mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, y se hizo muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  Continua con el mismo negocio, atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su local y es ella quien personalmente les deleita con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz, azúcar y papas en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. Maria Dolith, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Dolith is a member of the Community Bank “Las Bandinas II” in the District of Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín Province, San Martín. She is married, 42 years old, and the mother of 2 dependent children. With the goal of generating her own income in her household, Maria Dolith had the idea to start a small business selling meals each morning, in a very comfortable environment in her own home. Today, she has gained much experience in this activity, and is very well known and loved by her customers. She continues in the same business, attending to her customers, who each day are welcomed at her location. Maria Dolith personally delights the customers with her delicious flavor and friendly character. With this loan of S/. 1,000.00, she will buy sacks of rice, sugar and potatoes, different vegetables, eggs and chicken. She will also purchase some kitchen utensils to replace those she has now, in order to provide better service and attention for her clients. Maria Dolith feels very secure, and has the desire to succeed and ensure a calm life. She tanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the achievement of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Sevil B., a married woman and entrepreneur, has two children. Her children are the source of her inspiration and drive because she wants to give them a better life so that they can study and do well for themselves. She started her grocery business 10 years ago to help her husband financially. She started with only a few products, but her business has subsequently grown significantly.

Sevil would like a loan of $2000 USD so that she can offer a wider variety of products and continue to grow the business since her clients are always asking her for new things. Sevil and her family thank you very much for your support. Your support will allow her business to expand and enable her to meet her goal of providing for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en: Shamil

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Agasen

texts.en: Agasen M. is a very loving father who is devoted to the needs of his four children, whom he adores. He raises livestock and, every morning, leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. He wants to improve the quality of his animals but, to do this, he needs to purchase better breeds of livestock and these animals are very costly. Agasen needs $2000 USD and, because he does not have that much money at this moment, he is requesting this loan. He hopes that you trust his hard work and honesty.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Shaiq

texts.en: Shaiq S. is 22 years old and full of energy and enthusiasm. Shaiq has been in the business of selling cows for over three years. He buys cows from villagers and from people in the nearby province to raise and resell to abattoirs and farmers. Shaiq is requesting a loan of $2000 USD to purchase additional cows to raise for resale. This young man counts on your help.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en: Mahir

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and two calves

loans.name: İlham

texts.en: İlham A. has a butcher shop and has been running a meat-selling business for 4 years. He provides the markets with meat and his family with food. İlham is 26 years old and married. He is requesting a loan of $2000 USD. This micro-entrepreneur is qualified to receive this loan considering the profitability of his business, his determination, and his experience. İlham is counting on your help. Your support will really help him.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Zumrud

texts.en: Zumrud A. is 45 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Zumrud's husband does not earn much money. To help her husband and to support her family, Zumrud has been running her business for 7 years. She sells household appliances. All the equipment is imported from Turkey and other countries. The business generates a significant income for the family, allowing them to improve their living conditions. Today, Zumrud is requesting $2000 USD. She is going to purchase new household appliances to expand the variety of goods that she sells.

loans.use: To purchase new household appliances

loans.name: Khayal

texts.en:
Khayal K. is 29-years old. He is married and has two children. Over the years he has tried various types of activities. Finally, ten years ago, he started his business selling cell phones. Khayal finds this business to be profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family.

However, Khayal thinks that it is overly expensive to purchase the cell phones locally and it would cut expenses considerably if the goods were purchased in China. With this in mind, Khayal is requesting a loan of $2000 USD. This is his first loan and Khayal is grateful to everyone for supporting him. He promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phones

loans.name: Fanusa

texts.en: Fanusa S., age 50, and her husband, have raised four children. Fanusa has been running a drug store for 15 years in which she sells only certified medicines. Because the store in located in the center, she has many clients and customers. She is now requesting a loan of $2000 USD to expand the business. The increased income will help to finance higher education for the children. Fanusa would like to assure Kiva lenders that she will repay the loan in time. Your generosity can change the life of this family.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Purification

texts.en:
Purification A., a 62-year-old woman, is married to Rolando, a 64-year-old man and her partner in a canteen (outdoor restaurant) business. She is a mother of two children, a son and a daughter, both of legal age. She live in the beautiful town of Cardona in Rizal Province in the Philippines.

She is a woman who believes in the gift of God. She believes that the most precious gift for humankind is opportunity. In 2006, she decided to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, hoping that with the access to capital, she could improve and even expand her canteen. She had been operating the business for ten years and she noticed the good proceeds it brough to them.

Currently on her fifth loan, she proposes the amount of 20,000 pesos as additional capital for her canteen needs. She will be using a portion of her loan to renovate her canteen. The canteen is along the main thoroughfare and is very accessible to customers. She hopes that someday her small canteen will grow into a much bigger one. She also dreams about helping her children to raise her grandchildren to have successful lives someday.

loans.use: To renovate her canteen and buy supplies.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil A. is 29 years old. He and his wife are raising one daughter. Khalil has been running a drug store for five years. He sells only certified medicines. The drug store is located in the center of the town, which allows him to have many clients and customers.

Now he is requesting $2000 USD. Being a very accurate person by nature, Khalil is sure, and would like to assure the lenders, that he is able to pay the loan on time without any violations. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine and to expand his business

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila M. has been selling food and drinks at her grocery store for a year. She is a true entrepreneur and studies the market to determine client needs and preferences. Naila is industrious and enterprising and focused on expanding her business. Presently, she has a monthly income of about $300. Naila is currently seeking a loan of $2000 USD. She plans to use the loan to increase her assortment of fresh merchandise and expand her business. With the increased sales and profits, Naila hopes to expand her grocery store and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of fresh merchandise and expand the business

loans.name: Emiline

texts.en:
Emiline F. is a 49-year-old woman with the determination and faith to get out from the ties of poverty. She is a mother to three children who are all of legal age. She is married to Joel, a private employee, but the salary of her husband is not enough for their daily needs.

As a woman of dreams, in 2005, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. Since then, she opened a general store and it really helped them to meet their needs. Now on her seventh loan, she proposes the amount of 40,000 pesos to pay for cases of soft drinks, liquor, rice, and groceries for her store.

She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and KIVA, she can reach her aspiration to step out from poverty, expand her business, and pay for the needs of her children in school.

loans.use: To pay for cases of soft drinks, liquor, rice, and groceries for her general store.

loans.name: Joshqun

texts.en: Joshqun I. is a 27-year-old man who opened a small café where he sells beer and other drinks, such as fresh juices. He is married and lives with his parents. His dream is to build his own café where he can sell food, as well as drinks. He started his business in 2004 and, since that time, his small café become very popular among local people. Now Joshqun would like to expand his business and improve his working place so he can approach his dream.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila M. is a 39-year-old mother of two boys. She is strong and full of courage mother to lift them out from poverty. She is married to Edilberto, a 40 year-old caretaker of a house of a relative. She lives in Teresa, Rizal Province in the Philippines.

As a caretaker, the income of her husband is not sufficient to meet the needs of her family. Then came the idea of joining ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2005. She was given hope and opportunity to have access to capital, so she started her canteen (outdoor cafe) businness. The business went smoothly and brought them good proceeds. Currently, on her eighth loan, she proposes the amount of 45,000 pesos as additional capital to purchase stock and renovate her canteen.

She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and KIVA, she can reach her dreams in life: sending her children to school until they find jobs, expanding her business, and even plans to have an internet cafe someday. Now, she said, my dreams are almost within my reach.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and renovate her canteen.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza T. is a 52 year old woman and mother to an only child, a boy who is a fourth year high school student. Her husband Pedro is a farmer and also serves as her partner in her business. She lives in San Guillermo, Rizal province in the Philippines.

With the belief and faith to get out of poverty, in 2006 she decided to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. During her previous loans, she carefully invested in her general store and it progressed good and sound. Now on her 6th loan, she proposes the amount of 30,000 pesos as additional capital, still for her general store. Specifically, the amount will be used to pay for cases of beer, soft drinks, liquors, and groceries for the store.

As a parent, she dreams of sending her child to school up to college and find a job for a greener living. She hopes that her business will expand for them so they will have savings for future use.

loans.use: To buy cases of soft drinks, beer, sacks of rice and liquors and groceries for her general store.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia M. makes a living primarily from selling bananas in her community. She is 46 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Kinuman Sur, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Lucresia has been operating her specialized retail store for over a year and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lucresia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lucresia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a food business

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie P. is 25 years old, married and has 3 small children. Their main source of income comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. They are from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. Marjorie has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marjorie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marjorie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair her fishing boat. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a fishing boat

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Thol Tun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan Thol T. is a 46-year-old widow with five children: one of whom is a coconut seller, while another is a construction worker and the others are attending the local school. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand by purchasing more piglets to breed to earn more income for her family. 

Mrs. Chan Thol T. has been selected to be the village bank president by its nine members. This village bank is located in Khav village in Takeo province. The members plan to use their loan for different purposes. 

One member in this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en:
Pedrito P., 51, is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. He is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Pedrito owns and operates a business venture in the clothing sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing in the local community. Pedrito has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns ~3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Pedrito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pedrito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and to pay his children’s tuition fees.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis  Occidental. Its membership composed of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en: Thorng M., 27, is a resident of Kompong Cham Province. She is a vendor who sells produce in the busy local market. She sells items such as vegetables, meat, and cooked ingredients, and earns an average of $3 a day. She is married to Yous Yot, 26, who is a farmer, and they have two school-aged children. Thorng M. used to raise pigs in the past but had to stop the activity due to the financial problem faced by her family. She now hopes to rerun this business by using a Kiva loan to purchase piglets to raise. This will provide her with additional profit, which she will use to better meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Mrs. Lorn Chhim Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank is located at Ta Reap Doun Sor village in Kandal province. It consists of nine people, all of whom will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Lorn C. is the bank president and is a farmer. She owns 0.5 hectare land, where she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Long Dy, is a fisherman who is currently facing a small problem - he does not have enough fishing nets to catch fish; hence Mrs. Lorn C. is asking a loan to buy the necessary fishing tools that her husband will require for fishing. She hopes that the tools will increase the number of caught fish for sale. Mrs. Lorn C. is the mother of three children, one of whom is in military police and makes a small salary to support the family, while the other two attend the local school.

loans.use: to buy necessary fishing tools

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. hails from the busy town of Morong, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is 60 years old and a mother of three. All of her children are of legal age and have their own families. Her husband, Cipriano, is 60 years old and a traffic officer in their town.

As a woman of distinct faith and courage to overcome poverty, she really doesn’t stop searching for a greener pastures. In 2003, she decided to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with the hope that she would be able to access financial assistance for her business. She invested previous loans in the business of grilling pork, chicken, hot dogs and many other items. The business is in demand, especially during the afternoon when kids really long for grilled hot dogs, and for men who love eating grilled pork and chicken, especially while drinking beer. The business seems to be productive and profits sound. Now on her sixth loan, she seeks the amount of 25,000 pesos as additional capital for her primary business of grilling. Part of the loan will be used to pay for the sidecar of her tricycle as a secondary business.

She is optimistic that with the help of ASHI and Kiva, she can save money to build her own house and stop renting. Also, she is looking forward to having her own space for her grilling business.

loans.use: Additional capital for grilling business and to pay for a sidecar for a tricycle as a secondary business

loans.name: Mrs. Koeurn Sorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-eight people who live in the  Ta Reap Doun Sor village in Kandal province make up this village bank. They will use the loan they obtained for different purposes. 

Mrs. Koeurn S. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate vegetables, specifically cucumbers, for her income. In the field, she now faces a small problem because infertile soil has affected her crop. She decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. She hopes she can produce productive cucumbers for sale. Her husband, Mr. Eang Auk, helps her with the vegetable planting. Mrs. Koeurn S. has two children, one of whom is a laborer while the other is attending the local school. 

Eight members in this village bank loan are end-of-term borrowers and the rest have monthly-payment loans. The end-of-term borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito I. is from the village of Paypayan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. He is 52 years old. Pablito is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Pablito owns and operates a charcoal-selling business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling charcoal to the local community members. Pablito has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pablito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pablito is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional  materials. This will be the first loan taken out by Pablito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher folks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials

loans.name: Mel

texts.en: Mel Y., 56, lives in her small family home in the province of Banteay Meanchey. There, she owns a small restaurant to sell wine, soft drinks and foods to neighbors who come to eat and drink at her shop. She is a married mother blessed with four children, one of whom is married and lives separately, while the others are still living in home. Her husband is currently working in the military police post and also helps as manager for her business activities. Mel Y. will be using her loan to buy additional wine, beer, soft drinks and essential ingredients in order to continue selling.

loans.use: To buy additional wine, beer, soft drinks and essential ingredients

loans.name: Mrs. Socheat Uch Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of 30 people who will use the loan for a variety of purposes, is located in Ta Reap Doun Sor village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Socheat U., the village bank president, is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it and so is requesting a loan to buy different kinds of vegetable to resell in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Pov Borin, is a motorbike taxi driver who can make a small income to support the whole family. Mrs. Socheat U. is 29 years old and the mother of two children, four and five years of age.

Four members in this village bank loans have end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. The former are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of vegetable to resell in the local market.

loans.name: Orm

texts.en:
The man shown in the picture is Mr. Orm S. A., age 32, who lives with other family members in Banteay Meanchey Province. He is currently a local electronics repairer. He repairs his neighbors’ televisions, CD Players, and generators that are broken.

Orm S. A. is married with four children: his first two children are employed and the other two are married and have started new family homes. His wife stays at home to be responsible for cooking meals for the family.

Orm S. A. is looking for a loan to use as capital to buy additional tools to better support his electronics repair service.

loans.use: To buy additional tools to better support his electronics repair service

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira J., from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, is 38 years old, married, and the mother of two school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a clothing business whose main source of income comes from selling clothes to local community members. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over two years, earning approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elvira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase more products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek C., 63, is a local farmer who raises pigs in a stall next to her house to earn a living. She is able to sell each mature pig to a buyer four months after she begins raising it. Her husband jointly cares for their family’s pig.

This couple has given birth to three children who are married and have ready started new homes and they are all employed in different occupations.

Because the pig-raising business is the main source of family income, Sek C. would like a loan of $700 which will be used to buy more piglets to raise. She proposes to use the remainder of the loan to build a pigpen.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Ni Luh Eka Ratnayanti

texts.en: Ni Luh Eka Ratnayanti (DNR.M-0573) is a 23-year-old female living in the town of Desa Perancak, Negara. She is married and has an infant child. Ni Luh Eka Ratnayanti owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month. In 2008, Ni Luh Eka Ratnayanti joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 4,125,000 IDR which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her first from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Luh Eka Ratnayanti - (DNR.M-0573) merupakan 23 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Desa Perancak - Negara. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia balita. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Luh Eka Ratnayanti memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Luh Eka Ratnayanti sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Luh Eka Ratnayanti menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2008, Ni Luh Eka Ratnayanti bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Luh Eka Ratnayanti telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 4,125,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Luh Eka Ratnayanti berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

Therefore, Sovann is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase additional hair-cutting tools for her husband’s service.
